text:
Wow!  This place is the best dim sum in town...in any town.

My husband and I just drove in from CA and we were starving but had a craving for Chinese, we yelped and everything was closing or closed  ( 10:15pm)  we found this place and saw ..15 min left till closing and gave it a shot.So glad we did! 

So, we are avid dim sum waters back home, we have eaten everywhere from LA , OC to SD and this place takes it.Fresh, Fast and the service was phenomenal.They were kind and communicative.I was super shocked because usually other dim sum places they want you in and out ...sadly I expected this since they were almost closing ...but it was the exact opposite.They didn't rush us and in fact they kept asking if we would like more.

The food was fresh and tasty and the prices you can't beat, especially is you want to save some cash for the machines lol. Anyhow, so good , so happy !!! Great place and clean.

Tried this place for the first time. The staff was extremely friendly, great service! The food was awesome, it totally hit the spot for some late night dim sum. The Shrimp Shumai, Shrimp Dumplings, and Lotus Leaf Pork Sticky Rice would be my favorites. We came in late, close to closing, and we were still treated very nicely. Salt and Pepper Shrimp was also delicious! :)

Travelling all the way from Connecticut for a roadtrip and stopped by this dim sum place for lunch. We have been craving authentic chinese food for a long time and this place delivered!

We ordered chicken feet, pork ribs, custard buns, rice noodle, shrimp dumpling, sticky rice, and all were great. My favorite was the egg custard buns and chicken feet. Highly recommend!

Very friendly management and even gave us a free dim sum to go!

Very clean dim sum restaurant with good food and good service. 

It wasn't that busy when we arrived but the servers seemed to be attentive and the food arrived quick. 

Ask for the menu to see all of their food options because not everything they have is sitting out on display. 

This is located close to home so we will be back!!
My new favorite place for Dim sum!  The food was wonderful and very fresh, the atmosphere is bright, cheery, clean & modern.  The service was great, and staff were all so friendly and welcoming.

Great food and service. The staffs are very nice and friendly. The quality of food is good compares to other dim sum in Vegas. From someone growing in HK eating dim sum, the taste can match restaurants that what you find from HK.
Authentic dim sum experience. Super tasty pork and shrimp shumai and shrimp dumplings. Extremely reasonable prices. Highly recommend.
Dim sum was awesome ...... Better yet service is very good .... And attentive which is hard to come by now a days .... Will recommend and come back again

This is absolutely my new favorite for dim sum! Excellent food and a great selection. They have carts and a buffet style counter. I always order too much because everything is so delicious! Great customer service, very nice employees.

We were driving around and seen this place online we thought it must be good since they have a lot of great reviews. The service was spot in everyone was friendly everytime we needed something they came up to the table. The food was okay I liked it taste like they don't put too much salt like other places. I think I will be back again

Nice clean place. Very friendly staff and had both cart service and pick your own from the counter. Very convenient if it's packed and you can't wait for your favorite dish. 

Food was tasty, and exactly what I always want from my dim sum. Highly recommended.

This place is authentic and does serve real Asian dishes; but, the quality of the food is lacking. My buddy and I lived in Taiwan for a couple years and were excited to try this place, and we both left disappointed. Our search for Taiwan dishes that are as good as the distant island continues.

Tried this place during lunch today and was not disappointed. There were only a couple of carts circulating but they had a nice selection to get us started. What we didn't find out on the carts, they were more than happy to make. The calamari had lots of flavor and great crispy texture. We will be back soon.

I would say this is the first dim sum restaurant where the service was excellent. Usually, the servers at dim sum restaurants are rude but manager was really friendly. The environment was welcoming and clean. The food, of course, was really satisfying! The only restaurant that serves dim sum ALL DAY. Definitely recommend this restaurant because it's worth coming back to!

Mmmm Mmmm good! We went during dinner hours and it's just so nice to be able to get dim sum at all hours of the day good prices and attentive staff. Now my wife just needs to tech me Cantonese so I can come on my own.
Very good dim sum!! Prices are very reasonable too! I will return. Everything we had was great! Especially the barbecue pork bun, salt and pepper shrimp, and beef short ribs.

We looked up this place on Yelp, and it had the best reviews for any Dim Sum in Vegas.  The restaurant is bright and clean, and all the food was really fresh and hot.

I don't know all the names of things but we had really good puffy meat dumplings, sticky rice, shrimp and veggie dumplings, beef balls, and there were so many more choices.  The carts came around very quickly and always had a good selection.

I am not sure why this restaurant got a good review on Yelp. The restaurant looks like a cheap food court and little bit dirty.  

Service is very bad. For dim sum, you need to know Chinese to get fast orders since people in the restaurant don't speak much English. The atmosphere in the restaurant looks like a flea market with customers running around to get their orders. 

Foods are not great either. I got a bad smelling food from dim sum. Not sure it was my bad luck or they reuse the food from previous days. 

Anyway, it was a total disappointing based on Yelp reviews. You get my idea

First time coming here for Dim Sum.  The wait staff was very informative and attentive.  The potstickers and pork, shrimp and chive dumplings were wonderful.  Impressed by there service and food. I will definitely return.
It was great! Staff were very friendly, place was clean and the food was nice and reasonably priced. I recommend their steamed runny salted egg yolk buns!!
Good Service! Great food! Reasonable price. It's definitely worthy of try! I like the coconut tart, chicken feet, ribs. Yummy!
Great food , clean place, fast service , reasonable price !! Awesome place to try if you stay in Vegas !! Must try : coconut jelly after meal it's AMAZING !!!

The best dim sum place in the city! I went around 5pm with a party of 6 here and the place was pretty much empty. The place is clean and not cluttered unlike other dim sum places. Once we ordered, all of the food we ordered went out to us in minutes! The food is great quality for the price. The staff is also friendly and made our lunch quite enjoyable. Highly recommend this place. I will DEFINITELY come back here!

A great restaurant should have delicious food even during off hours of the day. I came in the late afternoon and waited for a couple of minutes before I was seated. The restaurant was practically empty, only a couple people sitting in the booths but was for the most part clean. We waited over 20 minutes to order because we could not get anyone's attention. It's as if they didn't want to talk to you. Everyone was doing their own thing. I finally got the attention of one girl but then she end up forgetting about me a minute later because she sat down at another table and started eating her lunch. At this point, I was ready to leave but I saw such great reviews for this place and drove over 35 minutes to get here so I decided to stick it out hoping the food was good. Again, I was mistaken. We order 7 dishes totaling to about $28 which for dim sum, that's expensive. The dishes didn't even come with your standard 3-4 pieces of food. Some of ours came with 2 pieces! That's $1.50 for each piece, ridiculous! Now the quality of food, totally lacked flavor and you can tell it was microwaved because the inside of the food was cold and mushy. On my way out, I noticed that their fried ducks and chickens were just sitting out on the counter with no heat lamp, don't know how long that has been there. I could not believe that this place is still in business. From the poor customer service to the lukewarm almost cold food, to the steep pricing, I will definitely NOT be coming back here.

The food is fresh and tasty.  This is the first time here.  I think it taste better than some of the dim sum places in New York.  The staff is friendly and are attentive to our needs.  Definitely will come back if I'm in the area.

Clean location.  The food was tasty and from Tuesday to Friday the front page of the menu is on special.  By the time we finished with our first set of orders from the cart there was always someone to take our order if we wanted more items.  A nice Dim Sum location.

Came on Christmas Day hoping for good dim sum. This place didn't have much variety and it seems that they're not prepared for busy days. We asked for sprite and the guy didn't know what that was. We asked another person and she didn't know what we were asking for. We could see from our table the green can and tried to just say green can and they told us that was tea. Hummm... my husband walked up there to get it by pointing. 
There was one nice guy working who helped us to get what we wanted food wise from what they did have available as the carts had only 2-3 items at a time and the same stuff kept passing. Food is better at dim sum cafe or orchid garden. Probably Will not return.

Pretty clean and the people that work there are all really helpful and kind! Sometimes when you go to Asian places they seem like they don't want you there and they just want you in and out. But not here! Really nice people

Hands down the best place for dim sum in Las Vegas Off Strip and they serve dim sum all day long.  

The restaurant is clean, prices are reasonable and they offer a good variety of dim sum.
Amazing dim sum and on top of that it's super affordable. During lunch they bring the cart around to the table and you can choose off that or their full menu. A must eat in Vegas!!

??????????????????????????????

This is a very good restaurant, I suggest all people who like Chinese food to have a try.

If you want to have Dim Sum even after Dim Sum regular lunch hours, you should try Yum Cha Dim Sum.
I tried their Beef Ball, Chicken feet. Fish stuffed tofu are so good. 
Place is clean and the service is go!
Super solid dim sum. The Shu Mai and Spinach Shrimp dumplings were exceptional! Their chrysanthemum tea was also above average. And great service, too. Clearly a place that cares about food.
Finally I found the real good food dim sum restaurant in Las Vegas with comparable price with Las Vegas.  It has really Cantonese style rice noodles with green onions and  cilantro

Forget about Spring Mountain Road. Why is this is my new go-to spot for dim sum in Vegas?  1) the freshly prepared dishes and open kitchen, 2) spotless dining area and floors, 3) super friendly staff, and 4) an owner  who genuinely wants to please customers and took the time to explain the hot food bar and carts. We ordered baby bok choy, har gow, shumai, spare ribs, taro balls, sticky rice, and baked char siu bao. The dim sum itself was hot, full of flavor, and not too greasy. We'll definitely be returning next time we're in LV.

Hard to believe that good dim sum is hard to find in Vegas when there is so much other good Asian food.  Dishes were hit or miss.  Mini spare ribs were good as well as the chicken feet. Long rice noodle rolls (not sure what you calls these in english) were not good nor were the egg custards.  Chow fun was OK.  Shrimp dumplings were passable. Turnip cakes were pretty good.  Overall, was OK but not a homerun.

Great restaurant for Chinese food!! Found them on yelp and it didn't disappoint. 10+ dishes for under $35 and friendly servers and owners. Perfect option if you want Chinese and easy access off the strip. Big parking lot.
yummy.. clean, and everybody is helpful.. good tasting food. We'll be back here for sure :)
This place is pretty good, came around 5pm and at dim sum, they didn't have the push carts but they made the items fresh.
Went there last weekend. Owner was great. Delicious dim sum at low prices. We ordered to-go, I personally would recommend eating in for some of the items they have.

We were passing through Vegas on our way to Kingman, AZ and came across Yum Cha and were blown away from the service and the food. I've eaten at dim sum places in the Bay Area a lot and this place is just as good if not better. You won't be disappointed. I can't wait to come back here next time I am in town!

Have been looking for a dim sum place to eat in Vegas since we first tried one in Sedona.  

Yum Cha was clean, the staff was attentive and answered all our questions, which were many and the food was so so good.  There were many items to pick from on the menu besides dim sum.  Some of our favorites we had were the fried eggplant with a sweet sesame seed sauce, chicken wings, egg tarts, bar-b-que pork steamed buns, and shrimp dumplings.  We will be back to try other items, especially the duck.

Was there around 7:00pm on a Thursday. The place was pretty empty, which was not a good sign. I ordered a number of dim sum dishes, and a HK style chowmein. Most of the dishes did not have a good texture. The hagow wrapper was thick and chewy, but the filling fell apart. The turnip cake was mushy, The shumei and wrapped bamboo were very tough. The beef mixed was mostly tripe, no other organs, and the taste was bland. The HK styple chowmein was a dark sauce, which is not authentic, and tasted so so.

All in all, it was a pretty disappointing meal. I will not return...

Decent place with great dim sum. Family and Baby friendly.

Decent place with great dim sum. Family and Baby friendly.

Will come again

I was hesitant to eat here because I remember the last 2 Asian restaurants that were here before this, and it was scary to eat there. But I'm glad I tried it, and I'll definitely be coming back!

Dim sum is something that's not done very well in Vegas. So I was really surprised by how good this place is. The basics like Siu Mai, sesame balls, chicken feet were all good. Shrimp dumplings were amazing, they were so good we had to have more. I really wanted different varieties of the dumplings. But this isn't Din Tai Fung, but it's still pretty good. 

I'll definitely be back, there's still a lot  I haven't tried and seen a lot so I can plan my next attack lol.

We've been to Vegas quite a few times, and we would always hit up our usual dim sum place.  This time we decided to try a new one.  We found this place on yelp and we're gald that we did.  The dishes were just as good and some even better than our usual dim sum place.  The open counter makes ordering certain dishes much easier,  especially if you don't speak Chinese (you can just point).  This will probably be our new dim sum place everytime we're in Vegas now.

We just returned from a trip to Las Vegas. While there, my husband and I made it a point to eat local and eat off the strip. 

On our last day we tried Yum Cha, a dim sum and open stall Chinese restaurant. 

We went for lunch. There is a dim sum chart that circulates among the tables. Additionally, the open food stall allows one to point other foods to have brought to your table. Dim sum prices range from $3 -$5 for lunch.  The dim sum features pork, shrimp, sweet and savory. 

The service is excellent, the food is delicious. The staff will offer selections based on your preferences. 

We highly recommend this place. We are only disappointed that we couldn't eat here again.

Sometimes you crave a food and are disappointed when you finally get it. This was not one of those times. Perfectly sized to have a little bit of a lot of things. I was very pleased with the food and service. Superb!
It's a Chinese restaurant so the customer service is average at best. If you go in with that mindset, then you'll enjoy this place. Top notch dim sum at $3/order. That's a steal!!
Very delicious dim sum, we will be back! Staff are friendly and quick. Food was delicious, we enjoyed every thing we ordered.

This place is outside of the Strip in Vegas!  Their Dum Sum is not as good as their reviews.  Not many choices to choose from.  Their Fried Taro is big!  Others have 3 pieces, they only have 2.  The sad part is its mostly Taros and not much meat inside and not much flavor to it. A Dim Sum located inside Rio is much better!

Great meal. Pleasant staff. We felt very welcomed. As soon as we were seated, the carts started coming. Cucumbers in chili oil, noodles and fried shrimp balls that looked like chrysanthemums were delicious. The best was the coconut buns for dessert. A short drive from the strip, easy to locate. Very reasonable.

Definitely recommended! Family friendly and a great value, dishes are super fresh, delicious, dining room is bright and cheery, and the staff is ready and willing to help.  Owner came over to talk to us because we clearly weren't local. He was just as welcoming as his staff, who not only recommended some great selections, they sat down at another table and ate the same items they were selling to us, which was great to see. When we travel I make a point of hitting local spots and Yum Cha is a winner for us. Took my two dim sum eating kids and they downed the baked bao, polo egg buns, and fried rice, but the coconut rolls are just spectacular and they have a number of more exotic dishes as well. Loved the malaysian pancake and curry sauce. Solid add to the local scene, Yum Cha beats the pants off Orchid Gardens for straight ahead dim sum. Get off the strip, already, and see what the local food scene is about--it's places like Yum Cha that make it worth the trip!

I love Dim Sum, and really like finding it when I travel.
Yum Cha is a nice place with great service and better than average Dim Sum For Las Vegas. 
This is the 2nd place I've tried in Vegas and it's really worth hitting up.

My second time at Yum Cha was disappointing. I visited for dinner--around 8:00, and ordered the veggie noodle, chicken Shumai, shrimp dumpling, and xiaolongbao. None of this was great: the Shumai had many bones in it and the xiaolongbao had no soup in it at all. Additionally, the black vinegar that is supposed to accompany the xiaolongbao was diluted with water, which was a downer all together. The shrimp dumplings and noodles were both dry. The whole visit was surprising, because the first time I visited was incredible. Skipping out next time.
So bad!!!never come back again! We wait the food  almost 1 hour , the food is ok. We just order a noodle soup:(

Fast service, decent pricing. Parking is very easy and it's close to the strip. They serve on heated carts so as soon as you sit down you can get your dishes. In addition the staff was very friendly. I'll make sure to stop by again the next time I'm in town.
The food there was very delicious.The service was great. If you get a chance try the Lava custard bun it's really good!

First timers!!! Heard good things so we decided to come down. Very cool place , not exclusively ????, they also serve dinner items and have a semi buffet style counter for other foods not on the carts. Food was great! Chomped through some chix feet (that I haven't had in 6 years) that were bomb. The lotus leaf steamed sticky rice is a must. The host took us up to the counter and explained all the food options then gave us some complimentary dessert to try! Warm tofu with ginger syrup was delish! We will definitely be back!

Dim sum all day with good service. It's in the same plaza as my gym but I've never been. Went here because I was craving dim sum and it's 8pm. Good thing it's all day dim sum! The food was good just a little bland for my taste.

They serve Dim Sum in carts until 2:30 but until closing via memo ordering. My sister and I went there at about 7 pm to get some Dim Sum and every thing was excellent including great service. We will be returning as this was excellent value and service. 

My sister and returned today and the Dim Sum and service was excellent again. We will return for dinner over the weekend.

Not worth it.  Service is way too slow, it wasnt even that busy.  Portions were too small.  Also the model they use is made to order, meaning everything you order comes out at unpredictable times and in an unpredictable order.  I wanted to love the place.  Dont come here if you are hungry.

Wanted to try dimsum and this one had good reviews on Yelp so here goes.

No comment on the restaurant decor itself. It's clean- (that's important!) Straight to the food:

-Salt and pepper shrimp was too salty. Had to scrape some off.

-pork belly: looked like a lot of pork in the picture but actually a small serving. We laughed about it. Taste was ok. I've had better fatty food. Yup, I said it. 

-siomai- shrimp and pork/ mushrooms were very good. Added 1 more order, in fact. Hey, we were hungry. 

-shrimp toast- Ha, good too. Crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside. Wait a minute, that's me!! 

-sticky rice wrapped in leaf (you guys remember what it's called?)- good but small serving. I mean, tiny. But an order has 2 pieces. Maybe they should combine it and have 1 good sized serving. Not complaining... just a suggestion. 

-egg tarts- I've had better. Wife said it wasn't fresh.  Yup, she can tell. Her taste buds don't lie. Mine do, darn it. I ate it all. 

-Buchi rolls- those round things covered with sesame seeds and has red bean inside (its for those who don't know). Epic description? Thanks for going with it. I liked it. 

So in a nutshell, 3.5 stars. Not 4. There's better. Might come back when they have carts going around. We ate about 5 pm. Came straight from the airport. Should have been in my intro. 

Would recommend some because it's not bad at all. I might come back.

The Best Dim Sum in Vegas!  We passed on Lucky Dragon, and Jasime for a good Chinese food experience.  From the siu mai(both the chicken with mushrooms, and the traditional pork) to the crispy fried egg plant(a bit sweet, but the crunchy texture made it a bite of heaven) it was all excellent.  Friendly service, ask about the story for why all the bird cages for the decor, it is a cultural experience....awesome, and worth the wait!
This place opened 6 weeks  ago. First time here, and will definitely come back. The cleanest by far among the many dim-sums in LV. Food's superb and the staff are very friendly.

First time here and everything was good. I usually never eat eegplant but their's was really good. It kind of tasted like a donut. The prices are reasonable. It's a pretty big place but sadly not too many customers, at least around dinner time. Service was rather decent and the staff was nice.
This Place Is So Bomb I Love It Will Always Come Back I Bring Family With Me All The Time and The Love it

Read abouth the good reviews about this new dimsum place in town. And they were right we like almost all weve ordered like chicken feet, fish ball, pork siomai, congee, hongkong style fried noodle, pork bun, sesame ball. Also they have new item in the menu pork sung bun which is good too. Roti and taro cake is fine but not a fan of it maybe because we are not used eating these.
Good customer service, big space, parking lot is ok too. Will definitely be back!

"Yum" is the word when it comes to dim sum cravings and Chinese cuisine. Yum Cha's restaurant staff is courteous and attentive. Every dish that comes out of the kitchen has picture perfect presentation which compels you to start eating with your eyes and you will taste the passion of experienced cuisine chefs in every bite! Yum Cha deserves to be on everyone's hot-list of places to eat and is definitely among our top destinations as foodies when in Las Vegas.

Good food!! Good host!!
Dim sum was good. We went weekday evening. Wasn't crowded. All food we ordered was good. I am from Vancouver and used to really good Asian food. The food did not disappoint me.
My first time here and I'm so glad I yelped this place their dim sum is so so good! I will defiantly come back when I come back in town! :)

Really nice food overall and short wait time, however by the time we arrived for dinner many of the food options were unavailable/sold out. The staff were friendly about it, but unfortunately we were unable to order what we wanted to. Perhaps they have more availability during lunch or breakfast.

Yum Cha Dim Sum restaurant is now my go to spot. The dim sum foods are excellent, and the service is very good. Foods came out hot and fresh. Location is easy to get to verses having to go to China town. Prices are very reasonable. I highly recommend Yum Cha to experience Chinese brunch.

Selection was great, customer service was good besides a very minor language barrier, and dim sum service was prompt, hot, and fresh. Overall I will definitely be returning with friends and family. Recommend the chive, BBQ pork buns, and red bean bun for sure.

This place has the best dim sum in Las Vegas and it is open until 10:30pm!  What more could you want?  The service is good and the price is very affordable.  Definitely get the baked lava custard bun.  ???????????????

Great food. Excellent friendly service.  We will definitely go back. large menu and large portions. Stewed short ribs, chow fun, ginger fried rice, steamed dumplings and salt and pepper calamari.  All were great.

My family and I are from California and we originally wanted to eat at a buffet, but stumbled upon this place. It isn't the typical dim sum place where the carts are going around, it was like a buffet dim sum! We ordered wanton noodle soup, pork buns, vegetable dumplings, fried tofu and shomai. ALL SO DELICIOUS!!! Sam was surprised to see my brother eat three plates of pork buns, and told him I'm coming back for my birthday so he gave us two complementary desserts!! It was nice of him(: definitely coming back here again, and again. Thanks Sam!!!
Good dim sum! Very clean restaurant.  Staff is really nice & attentive. Food is fresh & hot. Prices are decent & portions are good. We would definitely recommend this place to family and friends.

I've seen this dim sum restaurant plenty of times when I leave the International store because it's just across the street. I finally gave Yum Cha a try last Saturday because I felt like some dim sum for lunch. I arrived right when it opened so it wasn't at all busy. 
I ordered some general tso's chicken,  shrimp dumplings,  and pork dumplings to go. I wasn't expecting it to cost a lot but it was around 18 dollars!
  It was 18 bucks but I was pleasantly surprised at the amount of food you get. I got the normal 4 pieces each of the dim sum,  but the general tao's chicken was a large helping!  I think I had it for dinner in two or three nights. It was all delicious!

This was first time being in this restaurant. We found this restaurant thru yelp and saw it has over 4 star rated, thought just try it.
It was a lot better than we were expected.
Service was wonderful, so friendly, price was extremely cheap, display of food was easy to choose from. 
I know this is pretty new place. Hoping it won't change. I look forward to going back again

I am so blown away by my experience here, so here I am. I am pleasantly shocked and surprised with the extrodinary customer service and attentiveness of the staff here. During our visit, 5 different staff came to our table to check up on us. The lady who took our order gave us recommendations and the food was SO GOOD. The food here is made to order and there's also dim sum carts around so you can start eating while waiting for the rest of your order.

Must: Curry noodles with egg noodle (you can pick your noodle type), dim sum (radish cake), roti canai, Choy sum, their new item fried pumpkin.

I highly recommend this spot. Definitely worth checking out.

I had my fair share of frequenting Chinese restaurants, and if you have as well, you'd know they are not known for good customer service. It's all about good food. This place has both. Gem!!

Good dim sum and great service!

My favorites were the Shu Mai, Sesame Balls, and Pork Ribs.

Very nice and clean restaurant.

We came around 2:30pm on a Wednesday on an off hour and the food was still very fresh.

This is the WORST Dim Sum I have EVER had!!! We waited over 20 minutes before our order was even taken. There were people who arrived after us who were tended to. When the waitress came back she stated ooooh, sorry. The Crab Rangoon was stale with curdled chucks of cream cheese inside. The hot and sour soup was average at BEST! Food tastes reheated in a microwave! Stay away! YUM NO!!!!!
it just seems cleaner and better made than other dim sum places in vegas. Definitely the go to as of today.
The foods are so good. Very traditionally Cantonese dim sum! If you like dim sum you should try. ??????! ??????????????
New restaurant. Staffs and the owner are very friendly. We try the curry noodle, not a traditional hongkong dish, but really delicious.

Cheap fast tasty dim sum, at a place that has outstanding customer service, which is really rare for an authentic Chinese place.

The people here are very nice and attentive, the dishes are $2.88 (mon-fri) $3.28 (sat-sun and holidays) same dishes $3.98, $4.98, $5.98 for other dishes depending on what it is.

Everything was fresh, I came in at 3pm on a Sunday, so the carts had stopped, but I could order anything from the counter

The food had a good balance, the flavors were well balanced.  Definitely worth your time to check it out

Nice and clean place to eat!  We went there for Dim Sum, many selections, good food and very reasonably priced!  It has a contemporary decor, not like any typical Asian Restaurant.  I would definitely go back again to try their beef brisket noodle soup and other delicious dishes!!

If you're looking for some incredible Dim Sum in Las Vegas, this is the place! Took the family here and was totally satisfied with the quality, price and service. The steamed bbq pork buns, spare ribs, shu mei, har gow, and shrimp noodle were incredible. Definitely a "can't miss" spot for our visits to Vegas.  The manager or owner (Sam) went out of his way to make sure we were totally satisfied. Waitresses were very friendly also.
Here for the4th of July! Nice variety and quality on par with other nearby places. I enjoyed the usual shu mai and my friend really enjoyed 2 tripe dishes.

We went to Yum Cha 3 times in one week. We enjoyed every thing we tried!   The service was good & the staff are good at making recommendations. The chrysanthemum tea was an excellent choice for non-caffeine tea.

i must say this place satisfy my dimsum pallet.. we came in here not knowing what to expect..

Staff: the staff are very friendly and very polite.. the lady cashier help us most of the time and she is super awesome..

Food: food is far better than orchid garden.. although they dont have much variety to choose from, they stick to the basic of dimsum which is a very good thing.. 

Ambience: very cozy and has more space than a regular dimsum place.. the place is very well lit.. and the place is very clean..

Salted Fish fried rice is now my favorite, they cooked that very well

So much better than a typical Las Vegas breakfast/brunch.   Best Dim Sum I've ever had, and great service.   Clean new place.   I have to try Dim Sum in California still though, but Yum Cha is my current favorite.

Second time here for late dinner and food are always excellent.  We love the roti the first time but for some reason this second visit is more tastier!  We only come here for dimsum and it's great that they serve it all day.  This time we came with our son and we ordered a lot.  We're surprised that Elaine still remembered us and she and her team always give excellent service.  Food are delicious, service excellent, and the place is very clean compared to other Chinese restaurant. Our favorites are roti, shrimp ball, taro dumpling, BBQ Pork Puff Pastry, so we always have these whenever we come over.  This is now our GO TO DIM SUM place.
I love to come here! It's always great service. The foods were delicious and fresh. The restaurant is clean. Recommend mango pudding
Terrible.  Had to wait a long time just to have a cart go by.  Everything was out.  Never had this kind of experience at a dim sum house.

the best dim sum I've had! we came late at night so we didn't get the push cart experience but they had the menu which described what was in everything. worked out perfect as this is one of the first times my kids have had dim sum. the regular entrees were just as good to. everything was freshly cooked.  

their customer service was great.  they weren't pushy like other dim sum places where they get upset when you don't order more.  the waitress was very helpful and great on suggestions for food to try, she even gave us a free dim sum to try.  i forget the name of it but it was delicious. 

if on i lived closer to the restaurant, im interested to know how the atmosphere is like during the day

Great Vegas eatery with all day dim sum.  And it's good.  Loved the sticky rice, beef crepes, and salt and pepper squid.  Best squid I've had in the USA.  Good service.  Only knock would be the decor which looks more like a fast food or food court style.  Tasty food tho would certainly recommend.

Great service. Food is fast and hot. I had to be adventurous but liked everything I tried.  My husband agrees all had good flavor,  even though he was looking for something super spicy. They have dim sum, kay not a cart.  You can view & order at the counter.

I got a restaurant.com gift card on the same day that I went to the restaurant. The owner said they don't take the gift card from restaurant.com. He said he discontinued it in July. However, when I called the restaurant.com customer service, they said the restaurant is active and nobody noticed them that he wanted to be off the list. I am not sure who is right or wrong. I only come here just because of the coupon. The food was not good. But they were hot. So if you use the coupon, make sure you ask the owner before you start ordering.  The staffs were nice and helpful. But that's all about it.
Yum! Sorry no pics too busy eating. If you like dim sum, you must try this spot. Clean and the host is very nice. The water doesn't taste hard which is always a plus.
If you are looking for the best dim sum in Vegas. Come to yum cha! The food is great. I'm so full and happy!

Been looking for a new dim sum go-to place in Vegas for a while, after my previous place went out of business. And I think this is it! Really a cut above all the other places I've tried. Also service is extremely friendly! Atmosphere is a bit more like a mall food court than a formal restaurant the upside to that is there are big TVs all around the room so you can get them to turn on the game if you're there for lunch on a Saturday or Sunday...

Recommend beef tendon and stuffed tofu skin

One word... YUMMY!  this is by far the best dim sum place in vegas. The food taste fresh, great customer service, and reasonable price. The calamari and garlic fried rice with chicken is by far the best I have tasted. There's lots of choices and they don't harass you to get more of this or that. I would totally come again.
Very good food. Love the ginger and scallions. Huge menu. Also have Dim Sum. Try it, you won't be sorry.

I'm surprised at the reviews this place got.  It's the primary reason we decided to try this place out.  But, from the get go we had a bad feeling about this place.  

First, the pros:  clean, spacious and has a very relaxing atmosphere, not to crowded

Then, Cons: took a little while before someone greeted us and took us to our table.  Then the server was confused about our drink order.  One coke and 2 hot teas.  Pretty simple. 

We ordered our dim sum which then took nearly 10 minutes to come out.  But not all at the same time.  Pork spare ribs came as we finished eating everything else.  

Aside from the chicken feet (My fiance's favorite) everything else tasted old.  The look fun noodles looked grey and the edges were hard, the fried taro tasted like it was made in really old oil, the spare ribs was to chewy and tasted like it was marinating in a bowl of garlic for a week and the hot tea was warm. 

Finally, I always find it interesting when we are close to leaving/finishing multiple employees come over to see if we need anything.  A simple and unassuming gesture, but can be perceived as a way to rush you out.

This is my favorite dim sum restaurant in Vegas! 

Everything is freshly made. The food is served steaming. Many dim sum restaurants served their food cold after sitting out for a while. Some of the food is available in the carts that they push around, but I love that they have a larger dim sum menu for you to order off of. 

My favorite dish here is their roti with curry. It is absolutely addicting. Sticky rice, shu mai, and custard buns are a must order. I honestly haven't had a bad dish here.

I highly recommend!
Food was good. I'd have to say the flavor of the food is better than other dim sums here in las vegas. The prices are unbeatable. Service was good. Nice environment. Spacious and we'll designed.
One of the best places in Vegas to get great tasting dim sum. I would order everything on the menu if I could!
Good place, I would recommend for since dim sum. Nothing usual, good or bad. Just, good enough

Service was as wonderful as the delicious food. The dimsum was amazing. Very clean and everyone was very friendly. I would recommend this place to anyone that's trying dimsum for the first time. The employee thoroughly explains everything, so you don't need to be nervous about what you'll be trying. I also enjoyed the interior design with the bird cages.

The fresh roti with chickpea curry is hands down one of my favorite dishes here in Vegas. The flavor is incredible! And as a fan of the red bean sesame balls, they are huuuge here. Win and win! Sorry, no photos, I was too busy stuffing my face. It was THAT good. Maybe next time I'll be able to resist and take a photo first.....maybe. We need a Yelp Elite Event here!

Been looking for good dim sum like back home in SF and there's not too many places out here up to par. First time at Yum Cha today and it was great. We started eating as soon as we sat down and we were in and out of there nice and quick. 

All the food was hot and delicious and I have no complaints. Customer service was excellent.

Let me start this mini review by saying that the people that works here are amazing and are very friendly. They are very accommodating and tries their hardest to explain what things are and even tells you what are the average ones and which ones are good . So far my wife enjoyed their porridge and chicken feet . I order the shrimp + pork shumai and the fried pork bun (highly recommended) which I had to order some more for take out . Would come back if we're craving for some dimsum . Stop by and meet these nice people and awesome dimsum . 10 am - 2 pm if you wanna see them walk around with the dimsum on the cart !

Very good dim sum and Chinese food... Must go if in Vegas! The food (dim sum and Chinese) is absolutely wonderful and the service is amazing with friendly waitstaff and the staff is awesome when helping you decide what you would like. We were visiting Las Vegas from Arizona (but transplants from the Bay Area in CA) and my family and I were missing the dim sum places that seemed abundant in the Bay; Yum Cha filled that void! Having just recently opened Yum Cha is ready to take over Vegas. I highly recommend stopping by to dig in on some Bao, pearl noodle, or order yourself some Shu Mai... A must visit when in Vegas!

Beyond my expectations! Dim sum was amazing and lots of variety. Servers were very helpful and nice. Chicken feet and egg tarts are a must try. The food is canton style, food was authentic Chinese. Overall the restaurant is clean and organized. Prices were reasonable and I would definitely come again.

Loved this place. Great food and excellent service. I would definitely recommend. Har gao and shumai even though these are rather common dim sum staples. The sweet bun is scrumptious with oozing custard

Nothing stands out as far as dimsum in this place!  Noisy and unorganized, service is just plain disappointment!  Waited for a Calamari for 35min after repeated  inquiry from inattentive servers!  This Chinese restaurant is the 3rd leasee in 5 yrs in the same building!

Food is too salty. Fried calamari got too much flour coated outside. Most of food doesn't have price tag and did not tell you there's surcharge if you add other ingredients which you should tell customer ahead of time before order. Service is good, but food came out slowly in very disorderly manner. Will not go back anymore.

If you guys craving Dim Sum...i highly recommend YUM CHA on Tropicana and Decatur. Place is one of the cleanest Chinese Restaurant I've eaten at so far. Food are fresh and delicious. And the staff are very friendly and courteous.

What an excellent meal we had at Yum Cha!! We were visiting Las Vegas and looking for something off the strip that was unique and authentic. The Yelp reviews seemed great and the website too, so we figured, "let's check it out!".

We arrived and the place had an inviting vibe with many tables and a great looking dim sum menu. I love the carts full of delicious food, the different choices and flavors. A few carts came by with more and more great choices! We started with shrimp rice dumplings, chicken and pork shu mai, tons of sweet pork dishes. All so good!!! The tea was also excellent, went so well with our meal. 

The service was pleasant and the manager was so friendly! He treated us to a delicious pork bun and took us through a tour of the food that is in the buffet-style area. I am excited to go back to Vegas and try that Malaysian dish!! My boyfriend loved the place too, it's a great spot, I totally recommend!
$25 lunch for two. Well worth the Uber over from the Strip. Typical dim sum fare. Clean restaurant. Quick service.

We celebrated my sister's bday here yesterday.
Although we were hoping for dim sum...it's only available during lunch. I wish I knew this ahead of time. We had dinner around 6:30. We ordered so many different dishes. The food quality was excellent. The flavor was great as well. But if they served dim sum from opening to close, it's a great possibility the restaurant would be pack with customers. The restaurant is still new and very clean. The ladies room was very clean as well.

The server explained to us that only a few of them can speak English, the rest spoke Chinese (Cantonese). So we sat in her station. She was very nice and attentive even though we were a group of eight. Next time we'll definitely be there during lunch hours for dim-sum.

We decided to try this place after reading Yelp reviews. We were not disappointed. The food was fresh and hot, prices were good, and the staff welcoming, helpful, and friendly. We especially loved the Mushroom Mai. We will return on our next trip to Vegas.

This place was so awesome! I love Dim sum and this place was a great authentic american version of that. The atmosphere was very welcoming, the hostess, waiter, manager everyone was friendly. The only thing they should improve on is their entrance, looks dated and not a lot going on. Food was on point, cart lady very friendly, i would love to return!

Having visited before official grand opening, it's understood the place is not running at 100%. The food was very tasty. Management (?) was interested in knowing what we thought of the food, service, etc. Personally, I'm particularly interested in cleanliness especially the restroom. I give a thumbs up. Will be back!

Went here today with friends from out of town. Food and service were excellent. Best dim sum I've had in Las Vegas. Favorites were pretty much everything we ate: Salt and pepper shrimp, shaomai, cha shao bao, and much more. Was hard to stop ourselves... Reasonable price for everything we ordered.

Host immediately catered to us upon walking in and explained the menu well.  Great service, people were nice, and provided dessert dim sum on the house!! Be careful, huge portions..

We had the Gen Tso Chicken, Chow Mein, and Sweet And Sour Pork along with complimentary egg tart pastries =]

Cute, made to order Dim Sum Spot. Easy to access parking and off the strip/215 freeway. 
Staff is VERY Friendly and super nice. Everyone speaks English very well if you have questions about the menu. They serve dim sum all day until closing as well as a full Chinese menu.

Dim sum was ok, not great.  Not steaming hot, even the bottom trays.  Also ordered a pan-fried noodle, but wasn't exactly what a pan-fried noodle typically looks like.  No gravy, noodles not crispy, and has onions (usually not in this dish).  Place is clean.
Friendly. Fresh. Clean. Items not on dim sum cart were cooked to order. Flavorful and satisfying. I would definitely come back again.

Me n my fried we wanna tried this place after a recommendation from one of our friend. And she was right. This place is the way to go!!! Awesome dimsum and they have it all day!!!!! Yuuum. Be back for sure.

Went to Yum Cha for brunch and I was very pleased with everything! We were seated very fast and as they were taking the drink order the dim sum carts were already asking us about what kind of dim sum we wanted. The food was amazing! We ordered shumai, hargow,  pork buns (steamed and baked), shrimp and beef rice noodle, beef ball. All the food was on point! The service was great as well, I tend to drink my water really fast and I could honestly say that I did not have a empty glass the entire time. Everyone was really nice there so it felt like I've been going there for months even though it was only my first time. They serve dim sum all damn day too which is amazing!!!! If you like dim sum you gotta check this place out!!

OK dim sum, I have had a lot better and a couple worse in town. The service was really good though. I will update my review if I go back as I kind of went at an odd time and that may have impacted the food.

Sooooo efficient and scratches that dim sum itch for a very reasonable price! I didn't want to make the drive down to Rio or Gold Coast and decided to try a more local restaurant for dim sum. Yum Cha has a very casual, cafeteria-like feel. They dangled birdcages from the ceiling which made me smile and remember when I used to go to dim sum as a child with my grandfather back in Hong Kong. The service was VERY quick. You want some egg tarts? They're at your table in 30 seconds. Tofu fa? 20 seconds. The service staff is on top of things for sure. The food was pretty good. I did not experience any problems with the taste or freshness of the dishes.

No wait times, quick service, decent food. Definitely an option for casual dining.

Over rated... The green shirt guys are interesting... less PR and more actual work. Asked for a simple shrimp fried rice it took 5 employees to figure it out... Seriously!  I can speak a little Cantonese and Mandarin. Then had to order dim sum from the counter it seems they don't have carts on the floor until 5pm. So I ordered from the counter then the food disappeared for about 10 minutes Hahaha WOW. below average dim sum. Then I had to hunt down the spice tray not on the tables. Install some fans and get rid of the empty bird cages.. Seriously!  Tip of the day - 168 market has better DIM SUM and better service. No return visit.  P.S. The shrimp fried rice is how they made it to 2 stars pretty good.

The staff were very friendly and quick on the service they provided. The restaurant was very clean and open. You don't feel congested like some places you go. The food was freshly steamed in the push carts and delicious! I highly recommend if you are a dim sum lover!
I like this place , first time for me to eat and it looks clean and organized..I would certainly come back and try some more of the menus.

This is second time I ate here.  The first time was ok. This time was worse . The second I asked for a fork, I never saw another come to my table. If you think I'm going back , you have another thing coming . You het better service at McDonald's!

First time here...and now my GO TO DIM SUM / CHINESE FOOD spot in Vegas! 

Clean dining area, clean facilities, and and overall great atmosphere.

VERY DELICIOUS with VERY GOOD PRICES! 


Sam the owner and the entire staff were very welcoming and provided great friendly service as well. 

Definitely will be a frequent returning customer!

I finally had a chance to come in and try Yum Cha and i was very impressed, food was delicious and the chicken and pork buns were not soggy at all, they were just fluffy and good,  very friendly staff and i had a chance to have a chat with one of the owners, very delightful man. I will definitely recommend this place to my friends.
I have tried Dim sum all over vegas and this is the best i have had in a long time.

Very nice people. Good food. Coconut bun for dessert. Yum Cha!  I am a first-timer to Dim Sum but Becky said it was very authentic. I will take her word for it; all I know is that it tasted good & fresh. 

A little bit off of the "beaten path" but still close to the I15 and many of the hotels / casinos west of the Strip. 

Well done, Yum Cha. Well done!

I went here to try out a new Dim Sum place. The location used to be a Chinese buffet that must have failed, so my expectations were not very high.  I was surprised by the food and the service. Especially the service. The carts came around often. You can order directly. The waiter was very attentive. Will definitely be back next time we crave some Dim Sum.
Great dim sum place! Fast service, clean and new restaurant. Food was really good, loved the bao! The noodles were a big hit too. Close drive from the strip, and would recommend!!!
First time here and everything was great and service was great ! My husband and I love dim sum ! Glad we found this place ! Yummy dim sim

Here on our 1st time and 1st vacation to LV. After a longs day of awesome sight seeing. Our sister-in-law & brother took us here for dinner and wow Onodeliciousnous! 
Welcomed by the owner, she's so pleasantly friendly and made it feel so homey. Very clean, a little modern with a touch of decor and a lot of space! 
We placed our order -Family Style- it was so Quick, Hot and Mmmyummy! We had 2 types of noodles, a couple different type of dim sum and 1 protein. We started off with Sis Fave an appetizer Deep Fried Eggplant and Man was it Choice!! Then the rest came out one by one and there was no pause in between and everything was Hot. 
We had a good time, plenty of laughs during dinner, taken good care of. 
To our family and friends when your here for vacay or live here, you gots to come here for sure! Aloha & Mahalo Yum Cha! Also, to our Braddah and Sistah for bring us here :)

This place probably has to be the best dim sum I had in Vegas. From the moment I walked in to leaving all the staff has been so nice. Once we sat down water was given and less then a minute food was pushed in a cart to our table. The staffs always made sure to refill our water and always had food coming when we were about to be done with the dish. They also recommend a lot of delicious dish to try. we got them all and the taste was amazing.

Worth the price. It's my first time seeing such setting of a restaurant in Las Vegas. It is very clean and waiters are all helpful. Food is fresh and good price. Dim sum serves all day along with hot pot and food from menu. Would definitely come back, good location, easy to find.

Was really excited to try a new dim sum place in Vegas.

Big space.. We went around 2pm and there were a few tables dining.

Whom I believe is the owner came over and made some suggestions. We tried our normal dim sum cravings and also what she had recommended.

I can't say that it's good but it also wasn't bad? Lol 

I wouldn't mind coming here if someone had invited me but I probably wouldn't go back on my own.

Service was excellent though!

Pretty good I was visiting from Vancouver and this place still has cart service which is really rare now in Vancouver. Dim sum is still pretty cheap. $2.98 each for the basic steamed dishes and the veggies and other are a higher price. Would come again. The best places to eat in Vegas are the smaller shops. Everything on the strip is either too salty or too fatty or too sweet. While not a fancy decorated place it's good for a satisfying meal without blowing your budget. You will probably need a car to get here.

Very roomy, well organized and clean were my first impressions of this place. There are several dim sum carts that keep coming around with many classic, basic dim sum choices. The dim sum "specialties" are served at the counter and you can walk up there to order or wait for a waitress to come around and order with her. The owner was very nice. He came over several times to check on us and made sure we were happy with the food as well as the service. He also asked for our suggestions and constructive comments. I have been to so many popular dim sum places in town and generally I never get good customer service. If they're not ignoring your request then they're basically throwing the food on your table and walking away. This place was an exception. I was very happy with the service I received today. Overall, I think the food was good in flavors, selections were various and customer service was outstanding. I will definitely come back.

Really disappointed visit. Came at noon and was seated right away

Service: we were served right away and food comes to your table in less than a minute! 

Food: absolutely nooooooo!!! The shrimp rice noodle was cold and flavorless. Everything else was just ok. Lastly we ordered curry fish ball, and the inside is freaking frozen!!! I told the lady that the inside was frozen and she just walked away....told a second server that the center of the fish ball is still frozen and he prob didn't understand so he called another server and this time we finally have a response. There was no apology what so ever, he just said:"oh..I'll cancel your order" and that was it -_- 

The only thing that's keeping me from giving this place a one star was the fast service.
And also, the tea tasted like charcoal at the end, it was weird (we ordered the oolong)
Will no come back again

First time dining here. Really a friendly staff. Very helpful. The steam dim sum served of the cart is hot and fresh. The fried dim sum or soup is ordered from the server or at the counter. I like that because it's fresh and hot instead sitting on a cart and getting cold. They would constantly check on us and make recommendations on their specialties. Overall a enjoyable experience. Has plenty of parking. Will be making this restaurant a regular dining.

This place has potential. Customer service is very good compared to other Chinese places. Dimsum dishes were ok. My usual dish is Ha Cao but I had to throw out the shell because it's a little hard.  We ordered 2 tripe dishes, the second dish was too chewy.  The place seems clean and all the server wore mouth masks to avoid spitting on the foods whole serving?!? There was a gentleman opened the door and bow to us when we exited. Kind of reminds me of any Japanese places.

Do not go here for dim sum, especially if you've had good dim sum in LA. 

We had a large party of over 12 people so the long wait was expected. But once they led us to our tables, they still weren't clean all the way so they frantically wiped whatever parts of the table that we weren't already sitting at and then they didn't even wipe the center rotating tray. We also didn't have any sauces at our table so we had to grab them off of another empty table.

A server came to take our drink orders and we ordered half hot tea and half iced water. She only brought out the tea. 

The cart servers weren't any better - they totally ignored us even when we stood up or raised our arms to get their attention. If it was busy, it's understandable for them to not notice us, but it was definitely not busy. 

Once we did get our dishes, legit everything was overcooked. The shrimp dumplings stuck to the paper on the bottom because they were so mushy and fell apart when we tried to pick them up. The shrimp rice roll was too mushy it just fell apart in my mouth, I didn't even have to chew it. And the bun baos were so mushy, when I picked it up, the top felt like mud and it stuck onto my finger.

Not coming back, do not go here.
This place has the best customer service of all dimsum restaurants. Crews have a very pleasing personality. Food is great, clean place, I would say this would be my go to dimsum place from now on.

Great place altogether! The host greeted us as soon as we walked in the door and immediately was friendly with us getting us laughing and recommending food. We ended up getting the chow mein, general tso chicken, and sweet and sour pork and even were given egg tarts on the house. Amazing service from everyone there and great prices.
Pinapple bun leaked out and was watery. The pork ribs stunk, and being from Monterey Park this dim sum sucked bad. I would give it a zero if I could

The dim sum was amazing, came here for the hot pot but since it's the summer time they aren't serving it. The server told us they only had one order of hot pot this whole summer. The staff is very friendly and the restaurant can accommodate large parties. 
Their sesame balls are a must-try!!! They got them just right. 5/5
Very horrible customer service!! The man at the counter was very rude and we got up and decided to leave. Food was very unappetizing and wouldn't recommend this place to anyone!!!

At long last, I can have dim sum for dinner! 

I can't always go when most dim sum is offered at restaurants and sometimes, I only crave it for dinner, so my family and I are so glad that we found Yum Cha. 

The location is easily accessible (short drive from Henderson or the strip) and the restaurant is very clean. They have TVs all around showing food shows and the news but the sound is off so it's not distracting. The food shows are pretty interesting (showing different food from Asia).

The staff has been really friendly each time and very attentive.

During the day (lunch) their dim sum is available via push carts (steamed items) while other items are made fresh to order. At dinner time, everything is fresh to order! They also have a full Chinese menu for the non-dim sum fans. Once again, this is perfect for my picky family.

Our favorite dim sum items are:
Siu mai (pork and shrimp)
Pork ribs in black bean sauce
Potstickers
Pork buns
Beef tripe

We have also tried their sweet and sour pork and fried rice from their regular menu and both were really good and better than other we have eaten elsewhere.

They also have noodle soups and duck on the menu.

I definitely recommend Yum Cha to anyone who loves dim sum (especially for dinner) and for anyone looking for Chinese food. It's worth the drive.

Las Vegas, we have dim sum happiness! First time visit to Yum Cha today (Thursday, 4/27/17) with two friends.  The restaurant is spacious, clean and friendly staff.  It was not busy, there was only one couple sitting in one of the booths and the rest of the place was empty, but it was also a time of day when most are just leaving work (5:15pm). This did not worry me because I felt we would be given swift service and lots of attention to detail, which we did! From the Jasmine tea to the soup dumplings, everything was flavorful and fresh tasting!  I left very full, not heavy full but satisfying full.  The price was surprising (in a good way) the three of us had 10 dishes and it came to $42.00 and change, I was expecting almost double that, it helps the there is a lower price during the week (approximately $2.88 per dish vs. approximately $3.68 per dish weekends and holidays).  The staff was so helpful in making suggestions and keeping the tea and water full, and just friendly in general.  Our server was very honest about what she thought we would like and she never tried to "trick" us into ordering more dishes.  She was also very forthcoming about what the crowd and environment is like during the busier lunch time hour (they only do cart service during the early part of the day through lunch due to the volume of customers). Every dish we ordered tonight was freshly prepared and came to the table hot and delicious. I live 45 minutes away and used a 1/4 tank of gas and it was worth it!!! Thank you Yum Cha, you have a big fan in me and my two friends, we will be back with more newbies soon!!!!

I was super excited to try this place out. It was once a Chinese buffet before it closed its doors. Someone had posted a Roti picture on Yelp and I wanted some! Haha! As soon as I came in, it was a huge dining area and I was greeted by super friendly staff. This place specializes in southeast and southern China with a hint of Malaysian flair.

There were several carts going around the dining area and food selections available on the counter and an a la carte menu as well.The food inside the showcase and behind the counter all looked good! Forget the food cart! Haha! The bulk of my order came from the counter. You choose your food and tell them what you like. They have a partial open kitchen where they heat up your food on a skillet prior to arriving on your table. 

What stood out to me were pan fried chive dumplings, lotus leaf sticky rice, fish balls, and of course the Malaysian style Roti were all delicious! The fish balls were one of best I've had and they were larger than normal. Whatever sauce used on those fishballs really paired well with it. The Roti was delicious, but prefer mine thinner. I was told that they make the curry dipping sauce from scratch and that some restaurants use curry powder. As usual, Roti and curry together was a great combination. I wish they have a sweet version of this Roti (bring on the condensed milk and sugar please)! I was so disappointed I did not order a single noodle! This ain't me! I was too full! Haha! 

This is a sure return for me as the food were all done right and tasted great if not better than some of the competitors out here. They have many options to choose from that's a must try for me. It's also great for a huge group and lots of room to socialize. I stopped going to a couple of places that served dim sum in Vegas because the quality of food just went downhill as well as their service. If I can give "my other dim sum" place a 4 star? This is definitely a 5 star! What pushed it was the visibility of their partial open kitchen. It's located on Decatur and Tropicana. It's the plaza across International Market and next to Sushi 21.

           Yum Cha, you've earned my 5 stars!

The food is both varied and delicious. The restaurant is spotless and the servers are friendly. 

If you arrive after 230, there are no carts out but all that means is that you can order anything you want and it will be made fresh 

Make sure you try the lava tart for dessert as it is delicious.

This place has great authentic dim sum and amazing customer service. Wife and I had dinner tonight and the server showed us all of the dinner dim sum choices. We tried several of the more popular items and everything was full of flavor and generous portions. Will definitely come back with a bigger group as this place can accomodate a lot of people. I hope this place catches on and stays in this location for a long time.

Great new Discovery! I came with my fam last Saturday evening and we surely enjoyed this one. The good ones that we'll come back for before we try their other items in the menu are: shumai, tripe and chicken feet; those feet are 2 star better than Orchid Gardens. (These dimsum items taste fresh, clean and flavorful). Also the crispy, delicious, and not greasy S.and P. pork chops as well as their Surprisingly "what?, a chowmein can be this good"... Sam our waiter was  very nice and attentive. Oh the hot tea here is good too.

Amazing food and even more amazing service. Been a fan of another dim sum place up north and thought I couldn't find a better place, but I've been proven wrong. They have unique dim sum offerings and the taste is savory. Had the pork ball (fried Mochi with meat inside), salted egg custard bun, salt n pepper shrimp, shu mai, crunchy shrimp ball and beef tendon. 

Owners really care about earning your business and make necessary effort to make sure you leave with a good overall experience. Will definitely go back.
Was very impressed fast and very good dim sum,  many there were asian customers, so I knew it must be good!

Boyfriend had dim sum cravings so we decided to try out a different place other than Orchid Garden since their service there is a bit slow. To Yum Cha we go, location is great and the food? Well, excellent! 

We ordered Shrimp & Pork shumai, Pork Bun, Crab claw with shrimp, Chicken Fried Rice, Wonton Soup, Chicken feet, Beef tendon and Beef spare ribs.. And also their Xiaolongbao is a must-try, boyfriend and I loved it. 

The staff here works efficiently, and I like how friendly they all are esp. Elaine. Price is affordable too. We'll definitely be coming back.

Had a craving for Xiaolongbao (XLB) and found this place on yelp.
Since it was late afternoon, I called to make sure they had some...I was happy to find out they serve dim sum all day.
They make it fresh so it takes a little longer and it is worth the wait.
The XLB and choy-sum were delicious and fresh.
They have an open kitchen so you know it is clean.
The service was awesome! Sam was very friendly and accommodating.
We will definitely eat there again!

They have a great menu, ranging from tried and true Chinese food to dim sum. Had their crispy fish which was on point. Service could have been more responsive as we came during early dinner when the restaurant was not busy, but the food was worth it.

Went here for lunch and it was very disappointing. From the very moment we sat down we were ambushed my carts. We hadn't even ordered our drinks yet. Custard bun was undercooked. It was raw dough on the inside. The soup dumpling was also raw in the top. Pork dumpling was also raw on the inside and you could taste the oil it was fried in. They had the temperature wrong on the oil. They need to cook their food thoroughly!! Not coming back here.

Absolutely delicious! Umami heaven. The barbecue pork buns were fluffy clouds filled with unctuous pork; the chicken buns were also a huge favorite. All the steamed dumplings were succulent and fresh. The sticky rice wrapped in lotus leaf was another favorite -- springy and flavorful. We've already been twice in a week and will be returning again the next time we're in the area. Service was outstanding: our water glasses and tea was constantly replenished, and we were asked if we wanted refills even after the check. When we ordered off the menu, our dishes appeared so quickly it felt like magic. Lovely atmosphere, cozy and casual. A must-visit if you love dim sum.
This place is literally perfect. I've tried several dim sum while in LA but this is way better. Every time I go to Vegas I go this place.

Loved the atmosphere and décor concerned about the concept. We came here for dim sum for lunch and they only had two carts that had the exact same items in both carts of about 10 items. So disappointed because the place was pretty cool. The employees could not understand English nor help us understand what to do. We ended up going up to the food bar to ask and finally management started to help. I think they could use some training in customer relations. The food was tasty but a little pricey.

Good dim sum & I liked the line so you could look at the specialty dishes & order them. The place is super clean & staff is really friendly. I didn't like the cream buns as they were crunchy & had very little filling. Too bad because those are my favorite. Prices were higher than other places I e been but still good.

This place is clean, modern, and delicious. You have to try their baked lava bun, it's sooo good! At first the carts kinda had the same items, but when the owner came to check in on us, we told him the items we were looking for and he brought it out for us! The staff speaks English and they constantly refilled our water cups. So their service is really great overall. I also liked how their food wasn't as greasy as some other places in Chinatown. Another great thing was they had a menu with pictures of their dim sum items so you knew what to look for.

After orchid garden shutting down several times for health issues . We've found this place and it's been our GO-TO ever since . The food is really good , but the service is really what has us coming back . The owners treat us like family , they recommend different items and also give us samples for being loyal . BEST DIM SUM PLACE IN VEGAS HANDS DOWN . Don't let these other yelpers fool you .

Super cheap dim sum place but the quality was just soso. We ordered those regular dim sum like shrimp dumpling, sui Mai, mini Shanghai dumplings, curry fish balls, beef balls and lava bread. 25 dollars for two is not a bad deal but please don't have a high expectation for the taste. Won't be back.
So good! Excellent food excellent service! Owner was very nice. Came for my birthday breakfast! Very clean bathroom!
Their dim sum was tasty and 1/2 the price of Rios. It 8s clean and the staff is very attentive.  Their bbq puffs were the best I've ever had!  There is plenty of free parking.
Fresh food,Good taste and friendly staff.Owner is very nice guy. Not far away from Strip,you can enjoy one of the best Dim Sum in town.

This is the best dim sum place I've been to. It's not oily, and the service is extremely good. It doesn't seem overwhelming or unorganized like Orchard Garden or Hong Kong Garden. The food isn't oily, and has good flavors.

Always looking for a good dim sum place... I think my son had 6 pc of har gao (shrimp balls) to himself! The jasmine hot tea is delicious. We also liked the shu mai, hot & sour soup l, egg drop soup and egg custards. Not too busy, clean & friendly people. My 3 yr old was treated so well!

Been craving for authentic chinese food since i moved to the US. I could say that Yum Cha is a good find! Besides the great dimsum and chinese food they serve, they have the best employees. We met Elaine and she was nice enough to give us free mango pudding for my husband's birthday. It's our second time here and we'll definitely be back for a third time!
The food is great. The service could be a little better, but the staff is friendly and nice. Great food to eat after a night of clubbing in vegas.

The best dim sum restaurant I've been to in Vegas. 

Restaurant is clean and food is delicious. One thing that stood out from all the other dim sum places is their customer service! We never had to ask for water refills and if we had to ask for something they were happy to help us. There was always someone checking on our table to see if we needed anything or just to see if we were ok. 

We tried a little bit of everything and everything was so good!! The salt and pepper shrimp needed more flavor tho. I also noticed that there was no roast duck or BBQ pork. Unless I missed it on their menu. 

Don't forget to get the CUSTARD BUNS!! Omg !!

Prices were decent! For 4 adults and 1 kid total bill was only $55

If you are looking for a dining experience outside of the strip , consider a visit to Yum Cha. Sans flashy lights and boastful signage, this casual dim sum experience provides a friendly, fuss-free, and filling meal. Main highlights include late night dim sum, and friendly waitstaff. The whole-fried flounder and coconut tart pastries distinguished Yum Cha from the standard shu mai and potsticker offerings of many other competitors. Yum Cha is a great stop for any visitors seeking relief from the typical offerings on the strip.

Dim sum in Vegas has been hit or miss for me.  Yum Cha was very good.  Better than most of the others in Vegas.  Our food tasted "fresh". We've been to others where the food tasted as if it had been sitting out a long time.  Good selection too for the price.  We (two of us) were stuffed for twenty dollars and still had leftovers.   We really liked the pork buns and shu mai. The staff really wasn't "friendly".  They were efficient and attentive.

My wife and I have visited several dim sum places in the Las Vegas area, and this one's the best so far. The pork spareribs, the beef rice noodles, and the beef balls were all excellent. Plus, they open at 10:30 AM, so they're perfect for brunch. We'll be back soon.

Discovered Yum Cha by accident when I drove by on the way to somewhere else. We had the dim sum, which was kept on the buffet instead of carts because it was after 2 PM. It was delicious! The steamed pork buns are savory with just the right amount of sweetness, and the various dim sum dishes are authentic and fresh. Their crispy pancake appetizer is delectable and reminds me a bit of Indian cuisine. Everything was hot, fresh, and tasty. Yum Cha is kind of a hidden gem.

Made to order dim sum, open till 10:30pm. Great authentic flavors. Great customer service not like other Chinese restaurants I've been to. Found this place on yelp, thanks yelp! Everything we ordered was on point! Will definitely be my new go to dim sum restaurant! So many other things to try, can't wait.

Good food. Mediocre service. Room is huge with only 1-2 people pushing carts. One lady pushing a cart does not seem enthusiastic doing her job. She just walked right passed us. We had to flag her down, actually her co worker had to flag her down for us.
This is now where I can get my dimsum fix and the compli tea is really good too.. yum yum all around

Las Vegas isn't really the place for good dim sum but this place is not a bad choice ! I like this place much more than the ones in Chinatown , but maybe not as much as the ones in the casinos.

We came here for lunch which is the proper time to eat dim sum anyways. What caught my attention is that this place is very clean plus the prices are not that bad (compared to other places like Chang's right down the street). They serve dim sum all day which is cool. You can order dim sum off the menu & you can walk up to the open food bar. It seemed like there were not that many carts were going around but we had no problem having our waiter take our orders. I just wish there were more carts going around for the dim sum experience.

They have typical dishes like congee , shumai , har gow , chicken feet , etc. All the food is served piping hot. It surprised me that they have roti w/ curry here. The roti was perfectly cooked but the curry was alright. It was a bit oily. For dessert , I usually get egg tarts or red bean sesame balls at dim sum but the custard bun was definitely my favorite here. I enjoyed breaking open the custard bun and dipping it in the custard filling. Tea is extra here which I found a bit odd since it's usually free at other places.

This place is pretty big so it's great for large groups and families. It's on Tropicana/Decatur located opposite of International Market. It's a decent place to get your dim sum eats but don't go in with super high expectations.
It was good dumplings were good wanton soup was good. Wife had orange chicken and pot stickers. Nice to have by the house I will definitely go back.

This is my new favorite dim sum spot! Very clean and fresh food. Everything well made. Standard dim sum items and some special items. I really like that veggies and fried items are ordered from a menu and made fresh. The roti chickpea curry was amazing and I enjoyed the shrimp wontons. I can't go without coconut buns and their bread/pastries are really good.

Get your yum cha on at Yum Cha! Came with a group for a daylight savings dim sum brunch. There are carts, hot pot items, a cafeteria-style counter, and a full menu for special orders and entrees. They seem to have a few more traditional items than the few other dim sum spots in town, but unfortunately even with the selection YC isn't about to compete with CA's shops so scale back your expectations.

Some favorite items were the radish cake (so crispy!), the chive pancakes (stuffed with filling!), the taro dumpling (crispy without being greasy), and the lava custard bun (a new item for me). We also got some of my go-to orders of hargow, shrimp and chive dumplings, shrimp rice noodle, and BBQ pork bun. Unfortunately, I was disappointed with some other items: salt and pepper calamari didn't have much salt or pepper seasoning and the Xiao Long Bao soup dumplings weren't soupy, for example.  

Food quality was pretty decent for most items and the service was really a lot better than I've experienced elsewhere- cart ladies were helpful about showing and describing their items, constantly giving drink refills, clearing plates, and asking for additional orders. Pricing was pretty fair too, at about $20/person for our feast.
This place is in order. Good food, food comes pretty quickly, it's just a service is not enough, it just does not exist. But the food was good.

I'm in town visiting and was looking for some Chinese food. Well this place is pretty good. Food was prepared just to my liking. Perfect amount of sauce on the General Tso chicken and FRESH! The fried rice was cooked different than what I'm use to, but still good. I'd definitely do business with them again next time I visit.

Really liked their custard buns!!!! Both steamed and baked were so good! Also one of the best dim sum places out there! Staffs were friendly, the manager will recognize you if you come back for the 2nd time!

This review is not based on the quality of the food, but the customer service. After finishing a really good meal, we ask for to-go boxes. I decide to take one more bite of the beef tripe before packing the food up and notice a long strand of hair in it. I quietly mention it to the guy (I don't know if he was the owner but he was older and rude af). He acts like he doesn't see it & asks me to hold it up to the light. He then proceeds to make jokes about how it's probably my hair before taking it back to the kitchen. Mind you, my hair is BLACK AND GREEN OMBRÉ and the hair in the food was a lightish brown, almost blonde. He returns with some oversized muffin looking things and says here I'll give you these free, even though it might be your hair. At this point I'm so annoyed, I push the muffins back at him & tell him I'm leaving, just give me the check. He insists on us taking the free pastries, when I literally just have to blurt out I don't want the shit and just give me my check. The dim sum & wait staff was solid, this guy was just a total dick with no customer service skills. I will NEVER be back. Ps: most of the food was good, their salt & pepper squid is salty to an EXTREME and the jellyfish salad had a whole cup of sesame seeds as a topping.

What an unexpected surprise! Very good dim sum with excellent flavor and variety! I wanted it all! Service was very prompt and friendly. I will definitely return here another time before I leave and will go back next time I visit Vegas! Yum indeed!
