This place had quality food! Try the dim sum and the sevice was both exceptional and friendly!

This is now my favorite dim sum place srsly the best in Las Vegas, the dumplings and shumai are so juicy! I also loved their roti bread with curry on the side, very unique option if you are into trying new things (: To top it off, their service is excellent, every worker made sure that we were content with our meal and stay.

It's more like 4.5 stars actually. 5 stars definitely for customer service. First time here tonight and the experience was well above average. Food quality is very good. This place is CLEAN.. than most chinese dimsum restaurants. My wife and I ended up finding a new dimsum place after seeing the now-closed Orchids Garden featured in dirty dining.

Yum Cha did not disappoint. Best rice cake in town! The place wasn't packed when we came in so food came fast. They have a dimsum menu and a regular a la carte menu. Our first time here is definitely not gonna be the last.

I love this place. Ihave been there 3 times in.the last 2 weeks. They serve dim sum all day. The cart stops at 2:30 but you can still order from the dim sum menu all day. And the dim sum menu has pictures so you actually know what you are ordering. There is also a regular chinese menu which is excellent. We always order too much food and end up taking enough food home for another meal. I think I am going to lunch there tomorrow.

Yum Cha is an All-Day dim sum restaurant. The service was good, with friendly and attentive staff. We ordered various dim sum items like steamed meatballs,  shrimp dumplings, steamed pork hash and pork spareribs. The food was good, if not a little bland on some of the dishes. Overall it was a good experience.

Amazing service and super kind staff! Definitely worth the short trip off the strip for this treasure! Everything is well priced (~$3-$4) snd super fresh and tasty. Fed and filled 6 hungry people for around $60 total--such a relief from the other overpriced and bland food on the strip. My favorites were the shumai, soup dumplings, and fried shrimp balls! If I'm ever in Vegas again, I definitely will be back!

I haven't had dim sum in a couple years. Dim sum is the only reason that will get me to wake up early.  Yum cha has a diverse menu. I was able to eat chicken feet, tendon, and tripe. If you stick to the steamed menu it's pretty waist line friendly.

After a long night in Vegas, this restaurant gave everyone some life. We got the chicken feet and it was pretty good. The meat fell right off the bones and the flavor was just right being a little sweet and salty. My favorite was probably the crunchy shrimp balls. The outside is fried to a golden crisp and the inside is filled with juicy shrimp. We also got the congee and it was also good. It was the right amount of saltiness and the century egg really brings all the flavors together. The shumai was only okay though in my opinion. They added dried shrimp on top and that overpowered the dumpling. Otherwise, that would've been really good too. Last, we got the soup dumplings and I was pleasantly surprised. The skin wasn't too thick and the soup inside was flavorful. The prices here are also great based on how big your stomach is. Each ranges from $3-$6 and comes with 2-4 items. Not too shabby...

Service was very strange here, we sat down ordered a ton of stuff, they came all separate and took very long for each one to arrive so we would eat everything , then the next dish arrives in like 15 min increments , and we had to keep asking for our order because they forgot 80 percent of it. Whatever did arrive was part cold .and not so good, the shrimp look funn was disintegrating as we picked it up with our chopsticks , no texture or bounce at all. The only saving grace of our meal with their laksa that was good. Everything else, was cold, and lacking in flavor and texture . Service was almost non existent in the sense that everything took forever. The price was pretty cheap tho but I guess u get what u paid for. For a party of four our bill was only $60. We still never got our damn shu Mai by the way which we asked for 3 times from the time we sat down to 10min before to deciding to give up and go.

We came into town for the 4th of July weekend and stumbled upon this little gem through the great reviews from Yelp. I'm glad we stopped by. Food was really good and talk about customer service...it was amazing! 

CUSTOMER SERVICE: First thing, we ended up getting there about half an hour before closing and they allowed us to eat there without rushing us. Second, they let me go up to the counter and order the dim sum plates that i wanted (cuz i do better visually than through the menu when it comes to that kind of stuff). Third, they kept checking up on us to make sure everything was okay and that we had what we needed and to top off our drinks when low...very attentive. 

FOOD: They serve dim sum all day. We tried about 8 different dim sum plates and they were all really good. 

We're happy to have found this place and will definitely be back next time we are in town.

Really good dim sum.  We started trying out dim sum restaurants starting about 2 months ago and we've been to many so far, including Chinatowns in different cities.  This restaurant is not in Chinatown. We like this place the best. The food is always served  super hot and they're all seasoned well.  The tea is good also.  Price is reasonable.   We drive bit more to come here but concluded it's worth the drive.  The staff is nice too.  Overall, our favorite.  No complaints so far.
Tried 4 different Yum Cha places in Vegas so far in 3 days.  This is the best taste one ... geee ... It deserves 4 stars just making my previous eating places look bad.
I love this place!! The food is amazing and the staff is wonderful! They always fill up our hot tea. Everything taste really delicious

Delicious food and fast courteous service. I especially liked the baked sticky pork buns and the fried shrimp balls. The restaurant and bathrooms were very clean. The owner came to our table and personally greeted us and treated us to a sweet custard puff pastry. I highly recommend trying this place when in Las Vegas. We will definitely return.

Yum cha got C from the district recently.please confirm.
Business is so so.monday was little bit busy.food is below OK.

When Yelp works, the reviews the restaurant has received matches the food quality when you get there and you're not caught off guard or surprised. 
This is not one of those instances. Overall, I would say our experience at Yum Cha was disappointing. Not sure why it got so many stars. The biggest disappointment here was the beef (and shrimp version as well) wrapped in rice noodle dim sum, that was unfortunate as those are my kids favorite dim sum dish. I don't understand how they can mess this one up as it's probably the most common dim sum dish. 
The sticky rice wrapped in lotus leaf was also disappointing, no filling inside. I mean literally nothing inside! 
The other dishes we had, such as the steamed tripe, fried taro, steamed roast pork buns, beef chow fun (ordered from kitchen), was good. 
I'm comparing this to dim sum restaurants I've been to in the NY/NJ areas and having eaten dim sum for over 30 years. :)

I will be kind and offer this place a 1 star. 

The wait staff is friendly and eager to please. But the food is not good at all. 

My wife and I visited this place yesterday and ordered 

1. Hai Gow -- ( shrimp dumpling ). Only bits and pieces of shrimp with a lot of pork grease. The dumpling skin is sticky. Chef needs to work on improving the skin.

2. Shrimp Cheung Fan --  ( Shrimp rolled in large fat noodle ).  Shrimp is very small. The Cheung Fan is too thick. Has no taste. 

3. Chicken Feet -- For the one, the chef has to re-learn how to flavor the dish. Tasteless!!

4. Rice in lotus leaf -- again, totally tasteless. In the rice, there is only minced pork and a piece of Chinese sausage. The chef needs to visit other dim sum places and re-learn his trade.

5. Tofu with fish meat -- again, tasteless.

We stopped ordering when 5 out of 5 are failures. 

Awful place if you are interested in good food.
I love this place. Authentic Dim Sum, great service, clean, and Elaine always makes sure her regulars are taken care of . So ask for Elaine and tell her Nikki sent you!
I like this place.  It's quick, efficient, and isn't crazy expensive.  I took my parents here and they liked it too.
I've been stopping at this quick dimsum eatery for a few years now,  every time I go to vegas. They don't disappoint.  It isn't fancy but the food is good!!

Another dim sum place just like the rest. The place is huge so a great choice for big groups. When we got there only one cart was going around and we had to order other stuff we wanted with a waiter, which is strange for me. Isn't dim sum known for the carts being pushed around?

Food was average, same items and same taste as all the other places, did not see anything that would bring me here specifically! Although their food did seem to be fresh, crispy food came out pipping hot and crispy as it can be, hot food came out looking fresh unlike some other places where it looks dry as if it was re-heated from the day before.

Although I wouldn't say Chicago has the best dim sum, this tea house in Las Vegas ranks comparable to what I would expect in Chicago's Chinatown restaurants for dim sum. 
They bring carts around the table for you to pick the small plates you want and if you don't see what you want after a few carts go by, the wait staff is helpful in getting you your particular choices. 
The owner of the restaurant was noted at the time I was dining and helped out as much as he could given that the restaurant was very busy.
We had a wait to get a table, but it wasn't more than 5-10 minutes when I arrived around 12 noon on a Sunday. 
I had the traditional shrimp dumplings, pork shui mai, turnip cake, shrimp with rice noodle wrap and all were very good. I will definitely come back to Yum Cha the next time I am in Vegas.
first time eating here. very nice and clean place to have dim sum. food tasted great. service was very welcoming and friendly

My boyfriend and i saw this restaurant driving and was really excited seeing them because we love dim sum! We went in and the staff was really nice to us... The owners were super nice and let us know that it was the 2nd day of being open and if we were looking for something specific let him know and they will make it in the back....

So place looks like a food court but the owners said they do carts too and regular entree meals and hot pot... So lots of option... 

I personally like the choices we got... We had spare ribs and calamari... Chow mein dim sum.. Siu mai and chinese broccoli and the congee 

We really like the fact it is served all day dimsum so thats a major plus in my book.. Definitely coming back.. Love the people that work here super nice...
Disappointed. Pictures look good but reviews are overrated.  Can get better dim sum at other places in town.

Not being from the area and deciding to stop in we were pleasantly surprised at how clean and fresh all the dishes tasted. The dim sum was pretty solid and the restaurant was clean. I appreciated the time and effort the servers took to give extra service and do recommendations. With all this said being asian, I sometimes get really bad service at asian restaurants but here they were very hospitable. I also have had dim sum at many places around the country and I have to say that this place ranks high up there. Give them a try you won't regret it.

Ive only had dim sum twice and this place was the second place ive been to. Everything was perfect all of the dishes were as good as i expected or better. They have so much variety i cant wait to come back and try new things!! The service was some of the best ive ever had, besides being attentive the waiters would give recommendations and explain different foods to us and how they should be eaten. Couldnt have been better, i left very happy. The price was good too. For two people who took a bunch of food home and the bill was only $40 it seems kind of pricey at first but the experience was akin to high dining.

I brought some of my coworkers who were here from Chicago. 

This place for being a Chinese dim sum place was very clean and very presentable!

The dim sum dishes were all very fresh and you can tell they were just made.

They also have a counter you can walk up to and order something and see them cool it. Definitely a first having a great experience at a Chinese restaurant! 

Nicely done!!!
The food was amazing and our server gave us excellent recommendations. We loved the salt and pepper shrimp and the curry veggie chicken soup!

Came in for lunch this time, so got to experience the carted service.  9 tables occupied and two server carts from Sam and Co (no Elaine present, sorry I missed you).  I was skeptical that the food quality might suffer for the sake of convenience vs coming at night where food is made to order, but at 11:45, everything was hot and delicious.  The dumplings were NOT sticking to the tins as I was fearing, and my sesame balls with mung bean were crisp on the outside, not too oily, and nice and gooey and chewy on the inside.  Regular Dim Sum items are reduced to $2.98/ea Tues-Fri, so that was a pleasant surprise!  Great experience all around once again!
Not a bad place for congee, noodles, and dim sum.  Not exactly a destination spot or a place to bring your friends to entertain.  Just OK.

Interesting set up.  There is a long steam table on the right as you walk in.  There are a variety of noodles, fried pastries, and curry dishes.  They only had a limited choice of tea.  The manager said its because they are still getting their supplies in.  The fried egg noodle dish didn't look too promising, but turn out to be quite delicious.  The turnip cake was a disappointment.  Hardly any turnip, therefore no turnip flavor.  The shu mai was very good, though it was made with ground pork, not chopped pork.  The har gow skin was outstanding.  Thin, good chew, very good.  Unfortunately, the shrimp inside was not the freshest, with a strong fishy taste. Pan cake for the roti canai was light and crispy, and the chicken curry sauce was spot on.  We were dipping everything in the sauce.  The curry fish balls and the curry spare ribs were just ok.  I would skip the stuffed bitter melon next time.  Only thing I taste was the bitterness of the melon, not the stuffing.  The pan fried noodle with beef and tomato was very good.  Now to the best part, all that food and only $35.
Really cool that they serve dim sum as long as they are open.  Overall, the food was fine, but the service was great.

This was my first time here at Yum Cha! The dim sum here is very delicious and not oily like other dim sum places. The service here is great! The staff here are so nice and friendly. 
Not only is there dim sum there's stuff to order on the line too. Try their Malaysian pancake (Rotti) with curry. It's one of their best sellers. 
Their desserts are very yummy as well! The custard bun and coconut bread are so good! My boyfriend loves the coconut bread and was so excited to have me try it. 
Come and try! This place is comparable to Orchid's Garden.
Had chicken feet, char shu rice rolls and sticky rice dumplings. Unfortunately I could taste the ingredients weren't fresh. Days old meat taste :(

Yum Cha was a fun experience. We decided to try several Dim Sum plus our favorite of the night the Won Ton soup. The Dim Sum we picked were the steamed pork buns also the chicken buns (both soft and delicious). The veggie noodles were really tasty and quite a large portion (so we couldn't even finish it). I enjoyed the curry turnovers, but my friend thought they were to strong in the curry flavor (kind of like an Indian Samosa). Dinner time they have you order what you want, but at lunch they have carts going around to try different things (sounds fun). All in all, I definitely recommend this tasty place!
Decent dim sum place.  Half full Tuesday lunchtime.  Has all the popular varieties you expect.

The flavor of food was about average. The shrimp dumplings are not enjoyable. The other dishes I ordered were much better. 

The wait time on food is very quick. The service is on point. Which was the reason I rated them 3 stars from 2.5.

The prices are slightly higher than places with comparable quality and flavor. The convenience of this place balances the price point.

I would recommend getting dim sum before 2:30! It's the proper time to each it anyway. 

We came after 2:30 and it was very dead. You can only order dim sum at the counter and they heat it up for you. 

The dim sum was only okay. The ha gow felt old and was already sticking to the bottom of the tin. The tripe looked so old that it was even white. The only one that tasted really good was the shumai and that one was the last to come out and it was piping hot! 

We also ordered crispy pork belly, fried calamari, and salted fish fried rice. 

The crispy pork belly was not pork belly. It was just pork dipped into batter and then deep fried. Not good at all. The fried calamari was good! The salted fish was good but def not worth $13 for basic fried rice. 

Service was slow on our water since you already know American Chinese food is salty AF. Other than that, they were nice!

Like most of the reviews say the staff here especially the management is over-the-top focused on giving you the best customer service experience you can encounter at any restaurant including five star restaurants. They've only been open a few months so the usual issues are still being worked out a little bit to get everything right. But there's no dim sum restaurant in Nevada that has more potential than this one especially with the great location super clean quality dining areas and extensive menu selections both with dim sum and Menu Entrée Choices. Be sure to go up to the Steam Table Line where fresh Specialties are offered as well Call ahead and ask for "Elaine" or her Husband to get professional proactive experience. Servers even wear clear masks for extra hygiene quality! Can handle big groups easily with call ahead. Seats 200+
Food was great! A couple of things were a little cold but they replaced them as soon as we as we asked. Recommended for hangovers!!

Review as we eat! Basic dim sum! Nothing spectacular at all.. Not one item stood out from any other dim sum restaurant. I'll have to try other vegas spots to see how it compares but I'm definitely not fond of this place

Highly rated but the food was disappointing.  Most of the food looked good but  the hargow slimy. Beef roll was very bland . I did like the noodle . Ham sui gok was oily but the meat was bland.  We did like the barbeque pork buns

I just ate here and this is probably the worst dim sum I have eaten to date. Food tastes like it has been sitting out and then reheated to be sold. There is no quality here and no one really pays attention to the food they are actually serving. I had to send two dishes back because it was spoiled. And that was 2/5 dishes we got. So disappointed and I wouldn't ever come back here when I am in Vegas.
Yum cha was great! The selection of dim sum was fantastic and all of the dishes were reasonably priced. The wait staff were super friendly and made the overall experience a joy

I would recommend this place to all Dim Sum Lovers, foods is pretty tasty compares to places in Los Angles. 
It is rare to find good DimSum in Vegas, but this place is awesome. Price is very decent , love everything in here.
Eggs custard is sooo good, chicken feet is very soft and juicy. Hmmm can't wait to come here again for the next trip to Nevada.

Dim sum/food is good. Nothing that stands out, but decent. A little over priced for the quality of the dim sum @ $3.58 a piece, but you have the convenience of dim sum anytime. 

Service was excellent and good served in a timely manner.

We came here based on other reviewers on yelp.  This is less than sub par quality food.  Nothing stands out.  The service is worst.  No one says anything.  I came up to pay for the bill and the host does not say one word.  What a terrible experience.  I don't recommend it to anyone.  Too bad there isn't a zero star rating.
I must say the service was really good. The price for the food was reasonable and it was good. I'm coming back next time I'm in vegas.

This place is ok if you are in a budget and want to get the same amount. The place was beautiful and clean with an open area. The food was good, I would say, slightly above average compared to the majority. The price was very reasonable, and I would definitely recommend this place to a friend.

What a great find that is chinatown-adjacent. The interior is not crowded and not overly fancy. It's very clean. Slightly strange quirk: the tv is playing videos of cooking demos of Indian street food. 

The menu is divided into a dim sum menu and an entree menu. We only ordered the dim sum so I can't make any comments about the entrees. Each order came out relatively quickly. Pay attention to the pictures on the menu as the number of pieces shown is what you get per order. 

The xiaolongbao were good. Slightly doughy but not too soupy. Great flavor. The steamed buns had a generous amount of filling compared to the dough. Great flavor in the pork buns. Our waitress also said there will be BBQ chicken buns after Lunar New Year. 

The real standout was the curry and potato puff. It is similar to a samosa but different. Delicious though. 

For dessert I always get an egg tart. It was quite good but not as good as you'd find in Hong Kong. The waitress says the custard buns are the specialty so I'll have to make a point to try those next time. 

In all this was a great find for dim sum. We spent about $50 for two and had more than our fill. The only downside to the pricing is that there are only two price tiers (where most places have Four or five). This makes some items a steal and some kind of expensive. 

The service was great. The waitress was really happy to talk about the menu and keep us engaged in the choices. Everyone was super friendly and I definitely didn't get the feeling that I was being a dumb white boy. Go check this place out and eat all the dumplings.
Great family owned business.  They are very friendly and always know our name.   Great food, small dishes, and great prices.

First time the place was clean enough the dimsum carts on a Thursday were only 2 going around.  When our check arrived it was for the other table.  Came back twice to get our correct amount. Food was not bad. Just ok

I have to admit, I decided to check out this place solely based on the yelp reviews. We were on our way to another dim sum spot but the reviews intrigued me. 

The place is pretty big and spacious. On top of how large the restaurant is it is extremely clean. We were greeted right away and seated quickly. Everyone was friendly and on top of things as far as cleaning off dirty dishes, refilling our water, etc. That's also a very big difference from other places. 

The food was all fresh, hot and quite tasty. I really like how they have the open counter for you to pick from as well. Definitely stands out from other dim sum places. We will be back for sure!

Wow what can you say? This hidden jewel had the best food I've ever had from a dim sum place( (located in Vegas) Our favorites were probably the fried eggplant and pork buns but the dumplings were a close second. Also the atmosphere was cheery with the staff being extremely nice and talkative. We talked to both the owner and other people working there and thought they were all very pleasurable. Overall this was a perfect place for any meal, and we went around breakfast. This will definitely become our Las Vegas dim sum Hang out and it should be yours to!

The place was recommended to us by local SE Asian student. I was there with Foodies so they knew what to order: I liked the sesame buns, but the egg tart was the bomb!!!! My friends had it at a Dim Sum in Chicago, and they convinced me to get the last one; it was very light and did not have that "eggy" smell or taste. I may revisit for these two items next time I am in Vegas!

Came here for dinner on a Friday night. This passed Friday night actually and upon getting there, there was probably two other tables with guests. By the end of dinner, it was a busier house. Employees were very kind and frequently checked on us. We came for the dim sum and it was our first visit there. We got many items from the dim sum menu... I believe a solid 8 items at the very least and had 2 items from the entree menu. I was glad they had a full menu of items outside of dim sums. I believe the price points were between $3.90 (sumtin) and $6 (sumtin) for the dim sums. The items were as fresh as you can get and it was helpful that you could view half of the kitchen area from the seating area. Overall, one of the better places to get dim sum in comparison to the other places in town.

Amazing food. Very nice staff, which is a rare find in Asian Resturants. They are attentive and accommodating. Dim Sum and menu prices are very reasonable. Will be returning on our next trip to Vegas.

Service was GREAT - so nice, sweet and timely.
I loved their food, some I felt they reheated up and others so fresh. The radish cake was hands down the best I ever had. 
Next time I will come not hungover so the food might taste better! Cheers

First timers here, and it was great!!! Customer service was good, we had our drunks refilled the whole time we were there. Dim Sum cart was always stocked with hot food. They also have a separate food counter that serves different foods aside from the Dim Sum. It was the first time trying Roti... 2  up. 
I really hope this business stays open longer than the other businesses before them. Love the location, so close to home.

Visited on May 20 and have been lagging on the review. I am half Taiwanese and Caucasian raised in Northern California, so I am used to the typical customer service received at many Asian places. Not so here, they were actually very friendly and provided good service on top of reasonably priced, tasty Dim Sum. It is bright, airy, and open with plenty of seating which is a plus. They lost one star on this visit because the older gentleman who was asking "how many" looked me and my wife up and down making sure we weren't homeless. He was way too obvious in this and needs to work on being more discreet. We just needed to use the restroom before being seated. When mentioning it to a younger gentleman which I believe was the owner or manager, he informed us they had a real issue with homeless people using the restroom. We will definitely be back to give Yum Cha the opportunity to earn the fifth star because of our overall experience and our conversation on the way out with the man who's name eludes me. He gave us the impression they genuinely care about people's experiences.

We arrived right when they opened so there were plenty of seating. The tables filled up quick, probably because it's Easter Sunday. The fried calamari was too salty for my liking. The portions were decent. The dim sum here was decent compared to other dim sum joints in Vegas. The restaurant is big and clean. The staff is friendly & attentive, some of the staff didn't speak English but we were able to point to the menu to get our orders in. They had dim lighting, a few tv's & a counter where you can order togo. Great place to take the family for dim sum, especially if they're out of town.

Good dim sum and good service! A must when you visit Vegas! I came here for the name because their name translate to drink tea/dim sum in Chinese which is funny. It was pretty busy even though I came on a weekday but the staff was efficient and fast.

What can I say. The service was exceptional and very detailed oriented. By far one of the best dim sum restaurant outside of the strip that serves legit dim sum. My fiancé and I were very impressed. The server interacted with us not just about food but making small talk which we like. We came around 8:00pm, so eating there didn't feel like a restaurant but more like as if you you were at home eating comfortably. We will come back.  


FOOD WISE: you need to try the Shrimp and Pork Shumai, Shrimp Dumpling, Fried Shrimp Wanton, CHIVES DUMPLING (the best) and all the bake goods!!

Really was hesitant at first on trying this place out but I was craving dim sum so I decided to give it a try. There's only a few dim sum places opened late in Las Vegas and this one was nearest to my house. So Let me start off by telling you the experience here is great. The service is perfect and even talked a few stories with our server she is a really nice lady. On top of that they make the dim sum fresh to order  and the portion sizes are great for there prices. Definitely gonna come back

The best thing about Vegas?
LATE NIGHT DIM SUM.

My visit was later in the day, so there were no roaming carts delivering deliciousness to your table. That's fine. We ordered our dims sum off the menu. Har gow, shumai, and beef noodle. We also ordered chow mein and salt and pepper pork. I mean, if you're going to go get some late night eats you might as well go big and order all the food.

Everything was great and the prices were typical. The dim sum dishes ran from $3 a piece. Family style entrees were around $10. Our server was friendly and came back to check on us a few times and refilled drinks quickly. Which was surprising, since you know how most Chinese restaurants are. 

Will come back again! I would suggest checking to see when they have special weekday pricing on dim sum. It's like happy hour for shumai, that's a win!

This place is on point!!! We are from Hong Kong so naturally very critical of dim sum. We tried some other places in LV but this is the best. Superb service and the food taste like home... Location is great as well only a very short drive from the strip. We came around lunch hour and the food stays fresh on the carts. They also have a hot plate bar where they pan sear taro cakes as ordered so it was very fresh. My parents are elderly and they find the seasoning just right. Just the fact that we could communicate with the servers and owner/manager is simply like home. We are coming back for dinner service to get a better idea! Bring an empty tummy!

We went for dinner and it was amazing as well! The salt and chili pepper fried shrimp is perfect! And the ???? slow cooked pork belly is definitely well seasoned! The food here is not greasy or too heavy on salt so you won't need a nap afterwards! Two things are very impressive here if you're Cantonese: the steamed egg was exactly done right, smooth in texture and not tough???????BB??; the other was stir fried beef and rice noodles ????, ?????????????

traditional Chinese cooking?

I really love this place. It's one of the best dim sum place in town. They have the carts only on lunch time. A lot of people eat here everyday but there's no wait coz people come and go. If your going to eat here make sure your ready to try a little bit of everything ;)
Very friendly staff, fast service and solidly authentic food. Curry fish ball is especially good. Great lunchtime place :)

Omg!!!!! Best dim sum ever and so fresh! I hate it when we go to dim sum and ask for a dish and are denied. At Yum Cha, they will make you whatever dish you want that is not already on the carts. The baked pork bun was so pillowy and fresh. I was absolutely shocked that the shumai was so delicious! I can't wait to come back.
Good food.. the 1st time wasn't that great. Fried rice tasted bland and nothing special but I still get food from there. It's close and customer service is always good.

Excellent food coupled with very nice people. One of the best places I've ever eaten in Vegas and I've eaten Bacchanal, buffett at Wynn and other buffett pkaces and this thing tops my list. Would recommend and come back again if I ever visit Vegas again.

Seriously my favorite din sum place in town. Huge with lots of parking so you never really have wait for anything. Service is very friendly. They have pretty much any dim sum you are looking for so definitely the place to go if you are craving something that you can't find else where. Give it a try!
Went here for lunch with my family. Nothing but great service. I highly recommend the sesame balls if you're planning on getting dessert.

I was craving some Dim Sum and I looked at all the Yelp reviews.  We were so glad we decided to give this place a try yesterday.  The place is nice and clean.  The staff was so helpful and nice and they came by to see if we needed anything.  Since I was there for Dim Sum, we picked delicacies from the cart and we went up to the window case and ordered some more food.  The food was tasty and fresh.  We particularly liked the pork rice porridge.  We are going to come back and try the dishes on the menu.  Their lunch menu looks like a real good deal.  The prices were really reasonable.  It is very close to Highway 215.  Give this place a try!

Decided on dim sum and tried this place. Very quiet, food is good. Interior is very spacious not your typical Chinese restaurant. Room to walk around. Not a large selection of dim sum steam cart comes around but baked or fried plates are on display but have to ask for items.

Had lunch with my friend here on a Saturday noon. Many round tables and booths. We ordered many dim sum, and some green veggie and congee. The baked lava custard bun was really huge, and liked the flowing lava inside it. The Chou-sum was steamed and served with oyster sauce, and tasted fresh and light. The egg and pork congee was good too, with sliced green onions on top of it.

This is definitely my go to place for dim sum when we visit vegas! We usually come every couple of months and since we found this place several trips ago, we have come every single time! The first time we came here, we actually came twice in the same stay. They have a huge selection of food and I like how you can see everything up front. They also have a counter where you can see things like soup and different types of dessert. The owner is super friendly and the staff is amazing! I have 2 boys, age 7 & 10 and they love it here! Environment is pretty relaxed and family oriented! Make sure to check it out... you will definitely be glad you did!

Being from the East coast and a Chinese food connoisseur I found this place to be phenomenal. The dumplings are some of the best I've ever eaten along with the riblets pork and beef. The staff is extremely friendly and it's set in a very casual diner like atmosphere.
Dim Sum at NIGHT.  Reasonably priced, made to order (carts before 2:30 pm) pretty yummy.  Clean and the staff is very friendly and accommodating.

Came here with my boyfriend and thought it was a good spot for some great dimsum . The place is huge and their selection is awesome . The food was tasty as well and it didn't take long for them to bring their carts around to us or take our orders from the menu . The only thing I didn't really appreciate about this place was how long it took for us to get seated , get checked for more water/napkins and get our check after we were done . I understood that there were tons of people , but we were literally waiting in line to pay instead of them coming to get the check from us . And the workers don't speak English that well , so it'll be hard to understand them sometimes.
Amazing service and delicious food. It's also a plus that they are open with dim sum so late! Would come back and enjoy again.

Went here with my friends, I wasn't planning on eating since I wasn't hungry but had a interesting experience.. so to give you some insight I was the only person in our group who wasn't Asian, but I am a lover of Asian food just as much as my friends. When we sat down the wait staff took our drink order and that was all fine and good. But then a woman laid a FORK down next to my plate and only MY plate(I never asked for a damn fork and I don't need one!). Okay to be honest that is NOT cool to just assume that I would need a fork just because of my appearance. To put it in perspective: When someone of Asian decent walks into a Italian joint do the waiters automatically give those customers chopsticks? No. How rude! Just to prove a point I started placing dim sum on my friends plates with chopsticks. I am giving the place two stars because everyone who ate said the food was below average and wouldn't go here again. And the fact that they assumed I needed a fork because Im not Asian really turned me off this place..
Amazing food and GREAT SERVICE! Clean, very respectful, Kid friendly, great for big parties. Ask for Yao! He's AWESOME!

Came for brunch with the girlfriend. Thanks to my traditional Chinese roots, I've had the pleasure of consuming egregious amounts of dim sum in my past. This is definitely one of the better places. Service was good and while most dishes were frozen, they were well steamed and had the correct sauces. The ones that were fresh made in house were great as well. Out of the 11 dishes we got, here are my three favorite and three least favorites. 

Three favorites: 
1) Beef tendon - Fresh and tender. Sauce was on point 
2) Lotus Leaf Wrap: Savory & tasty. Good rice to meet ratio 
3) Tea: We got chrysanthemum. Ask for rock sugar. 

Three least favorite: 
1) Shrimp dumpling: A little cold - nothing special. Tasted like the frozen ones you can get at an Asian super market. 
2) Roti Canai: Bread not flakey, curry was average. 
3) Fried Taro Buns: To fried. Taro inside was good but not a lot of filling. 

Overall, while there were things I didn't as much, everything tasted good or great. Definitely come here if your craving some authentic dim sum.

We are a Bay Area family that came here for dim sum, so take this review with a grain of salt--we have high standards. The dim sum was below average. The har how was cold and hard, and the fried shrimp balls were also cold! 

The extra star was for the service, that's the only thing that was good here. They also advertised that everything was 3.80, but a few of the items we were charged more. If you're looking for dim sum, try another place.
Their food are not fresh! Rice porridge is a disaster. Staff are nice, this is a plus!  I think it's ok for dim sum, but not for their main course!

Well i havent been there but after researching I cant understand how there are so many good reviews. On August 12, 2016 they got 39 demerits from the Nevada Health District inspectors for being dirty. I highly recommend using the NHD website and checking their grade before going. You can also see demerits on previous inspections to check their overall behavior and maintenance of the establishment. Ughhh. Shame on this establishment. 39 demerits is just plain gross.

Grade A Food Establishment 

These people where very friendly. Even helped me with my order. I showed up with my daughter and were greeted with a friendly smile. 

Stuff we ordered. Top being the most flavorful. 

Chives Dumpling (Shrimp & Pork)
Shumai (Shrimp & Pork)
Steamed BBQ Pork Bun
Shrimp Dumpling

Wish it was closer but will definitely be back. Smaller Sized Dumpling then what you get in San Franciscos China Town however still very tasty and probably cleaner place too.

I'm always a sucker for the cart being pushed so that you can see what your getting and get what your seeing right now!.   
    Stuffed 5 hungover revelers for 60 bucks.   Food was good enough that just thinking about it right now has me hungry for more.  
     clean bathroom,  friendly service, will come back next trip to check consistency.

My daughters & I are from Singapore, & missing Dim Sum, we decided to have Brunch here after a week of Christmas fare & before our NYE Spanish dinner tonight. What a great place, great service, & great food. The Prata & Curry were delicious, the Sesame Balls were perfectly soft, balanced in sweetness, & taste, & the Lady Boss, Elaine, from Ipoh, Malaysia, brought us the Salted Egg Custard Buns. They were of melt-in-the-mouth consistency & were so delicious! Yum Cha is my new favorite!

Fantastic food off the strip!
The staff is friendly and provide excellent service. Then there is the food. We were so impressed with the food that we ate there twice in the same trip. There is not a bad item in the house and with a selection from "American Chinese" food to more authentic selects it was all fantastic. We highly trying crispy eggplant. 

Yum Cha will definitely be added to our Las Vegas routine.

My fiancé and I are visiting from CA and we love dim sum. We have a favorite place to go where we're from so I'm always apprehensive about trying new places because I don't want to be disappointed. We got a craving so I looked to Yelp.  I found and tried this place based on Yelp reviews and once again I'm pleased! 

We ordered dim sum items and some wonton soup. We had shrimp, pork/shrimp, and shrimp/spinach dumplings. We also had the beef crepe that comes with this amazing sauce, a tofu item, pan-fried pork dumplings and some black bean spareribs. 

Everything tasted amazing! It was delicious and fresh. The only reason I'm giving this place 4 stars instead of 5 is because we waited for the wonton soup and then got all the way home and realized it wasn't in the bag. 

The food was so good that we weren't even mad. I will definitely be going back to this place before I go back to CA.
This is my new to go to for my dimsum  craving, chicken feet tender is very falling off the bone, clean place, staff are friendly

Yelp reviews totally threw me off about this place. Service was decent. However: -Bathroom smelled and the urinal was right next to the sink with no separator. -Food was bland. -Organization was chaotic. -There were flys flying around our table. -As we were walking out, we saw the big "C" from the health department hanging on the wall...  Wouldn't recommend.

Absolutely love this place.  The food is good, fresh,  and authentic. The employees are very welcoming and will come to check on you regularly.  They care about your experience and take time to explain things and make suggestions.  Cannot get enough!
Very fresh and good food. Very clean compared to other Asian restaurants, and good customer service. You won't be disappointed at all with this choice of restaurant.

I don't know it's because I'm not Chinese but it took 15mins to get a cart and that's only because I had to walk up to someone and asked them how do I get a cart to my table and place an order. All the stuff we wanted they said "it's cooking". We asked 3 servers for two small bowls of rice. After we finally got our food, we waited for another cart......get this.....they passed up our table and went to the one behind me, TWICE!!!!! They only had 2 carts. VERY CRAPPY SERVICE!!!!

When we travel, Dim Sum is something we are always on the hunt for. Yum Cha is some of the best we have ever come across. When we were in Vegas a few weeks ago, we found this place on our first day in town, and we're so thankful we did. We went 4 more times throughout the week. If you venture off the strip, which you absolutely should, this place is a gem. The dim sum is fresh and tasty. The staff was super helpful, especially Elaine. Since we went 5 times, we made our way through their entire dim sum menu; our favorites were the Pork & Shrimp Shumai, Shrimp Dumplings, and the Chive Dumplings. The most unexpected and delicious item was the Radish Cake. Elaine told us most Americans really don't like it, but we absolutely loved it. It was super affordable, the prices couldn't be better. Can't wait to go back next year when we're back in town.
It's my first time here and food taste better than I expected. Curry noodle taste very good. They don't have a liquor license yet. Very quite and nice. It's relaxing and slow at night.

Great restaurant for Chinese food! Found them on yelp and it didn't disappoint. Super friendly servers and owners and awesome prices. Perfect option if you want Chinese and easy access off the strip. Big parking lot.

The dim sum is amazing - best in Las Vegas. The service is unique as there are push carts but for some items you can just go up to the counter and order. This makes a lot of sense as these items take longer to heat/crisp and you're left looking for them at other push cart places. Everything we tried tasted fresh and delicious. Parking and service were great, not always the case with Chinese establishments. The owner and several servers continually checked on us, made recommendations, and kept the tea pot full. Make sure to try the custard bun!

I didn't think the dim sum was going to be that good but pleasantly I was suprised. It's located off strip the area seems kind of random. We went on a Sunday and was seated right away no wait.

The service is really good here and the food is just as good. They have more variety compared to other dimsum places. The people are super attentive and it really helps that they speak English.

I love that they have the baked custard bun and steamed version. A definite must try!

The price is higher than other dimsum though.

I would definitely come back here when I'm in vegas.
Visiting from out of town and we stumbled upon this place after a long weekend of gambling and drinking. Dimsum was great and the service was fantastic, will come back when I return to Vegas!

Very good place. Delicious food and wonderful service. My sister visiting  from ukraine loved it and it was her first time having this type of food. It was also very close to our hotel Tahiti so it made it very convenient for us. We came and were served right away. Five thumbs up for this place and food.
Great food, takes awhile for certain things to come around so you're just kinda sitting there forever with nothing to eat.

Visited this place on a recent Vegas trip and was pleasantly surprised. Prices for dimsum are $2.83 during weekdays for shumai, hargao, and other favorities. I highly recommend the fried stuffed pork balls for their different textures (soft and gooey on the inside and crisp and flaky on the outside).

This place is amazing!!  I have been looking for a great Dim Sum place in Las Vegas and I found it!!  My fiancé got orange chicken in case he didn't like Dim Sum and the quality of the ingredients was delicious!!  I can not wait to come back and try everything on the menu.  The food and the quality of the food was well above average and the price was fantastic.  Everyone needs to try this place, even if you are not into Dim Sum

Bug dim sum fan here and this spot is definitely worth a try.  I normally go to Chang's when I get my dim sum jones but wanted to give this one a try when I saw it from across the street at the International Market.  Good selection and I like that you can order additional items from the provided menus.  Outstanding char siu bao - perfectly sweet and savory.  Only complaint - and it is VERY minor - they could have had one additional cart of goods moving around during lunch time.  When I went yesterday, they only had two.  

In the end, what really matters is the taste and quality of the food and this place is has both!

Great place and very friendly staff. Loved that the dim sum was available in push cart and also cooked fresh in kitchen. I loved how the kitchen was an open kitchen so you could see how they cooked the food! Yummy food. Favorite there was the noodle soup! Just like the comfort food in HK cafes.

This is my first time at dim Sum and I was a little intimidate, but it was a great experience! Food and service was incredible and they were very helpful. I highly recommend this place and I will be looking forward to bringing my family here!
I like that this place is easier to get to from the SW area. The service is excellent. The staff is very attentive and willing to explain the dishes.

It's nearby The Orleans Hotel and it's a local spot. I ate here twice during my 4 day stay, because it was tasty, fast, low-key, and good pricing. I didn't overeat and we shared several dishes, because of the dim sum style. We were told by the managers that it's busy during lunch and weekend dim sum time. I recommend the chicken feet.

Friendly and helpful staff! We came after 2, so there were no carts, but full menu available.  Liked it better since it wasn't packed- more attentive and able to walk up and look at the dim sum and order them.  

Dim sum tasted great!

Went again and it was even better. Had the soups, fried eggplant, and the steamed sponge cake  - unbelievably good. The owners are super friendly and want every customer to enjoy their food and stay long. They shared their service philosophy, which is to have each person enjoy the dining experience with a smile and happy belly. We had such a great time.

Came here at noon on a Sunday afternoon and there was no wait! The dining space here is very spacious. You will feel so comfortable eating here without the yapping in the background that you normally get at any popular dim sum spot. The cute dim sum ladies push the dim sum carts around rather frequently. They usually push the same popular dishes around so if you're looking to taste other items, you should place an order. The ladies wear protective mouth visors to prevent spitting on your food, so two thumbs up for that! If you look up to the ceiling as you dine there are empty bird cages as decor--this really reminded me of the grandpas in Chinatown that play Chinese chess back in the day. Speaking Chinese here is a plus! Clean bathrooms! Attentive servers! Definitely coming back!
Yum Cha was a delicious post pool snack. It really hit the spot! The Taro Dumpling and shrimp stuffed eggplant are on point! We'll be back to try the Roti Canai on Sam's recommendation

My boyfriend and I decided to try this place since ping pang pong had disappointed us recently. This place has a pretty nice size dining area for seating. The service is very good, all of the people working were attentive and smiling. The dim sum was hot and tastes pretty good over all. I liked the spareribs with the pumpkin and the turnip cake. Pricing was the best part, 2 people stuffing themselves only paid 20 total! That's a good bang for the buck. We will definitely return for more.
Been there twice, love it. Very fresh and great variety. Friendly and efficient service too. Highly recommend!
The dim sum is good, service is fast and not chaotic  (like most other dim sum places,) but most importantly...its clean.

I came here with another couple for dim sum. Everything looked really good and fresh- not frozen. I didn't eat much since I already had eaten earlier. Just came for the company but from what I can see they didn't have much selection from the push cart for dim sum. If you wanted more of a variety you can order from the menu. You know it's a good place when you see a lot of Chinese people in here. I will have to give this place another try next time.

The Yum Cha restaurant is incredible! My boyfriend and I eat here very often and we get amazing service and the food is delicious with great quality! The Dim sum is one of the best in town!!! The restaurant is very clean and spacious! I highly recommend this place(=

Dim sum prepared fresh (not on carts) during non lunch hours. Pretty good but I've had much better. Pork belly seemed like fried pork chop chunks, not really pork belly. Good, but I was craving pork belly. Ordered a side of white rice & asked for water, in addition to my hot tea. Neither showed up. Asked if I wanted anything else when the check was dropped. Ummmm... yes I would have liked water & rice with my meal. Food was ok but service not so good. Maybe an off day for them.

Big place. We were the only ones in the restaurant. Good service. They were very nice and attentive. Good food!

The only disappointment was that they didn't have pineapple buns. Lol
This restaurant has everything you need in a dim sum restaurant, friendly staff, delicious food, and comfortable atmosphere. The only place that has lava custard buns. A must try!

Great Dim Sum place! 

The staff is friendly, and their customer service is great! 

All of the items we chose from the cart were fresh and delicious. We ordered some shrimp noodle and fried wonton shrimp, and they were freshly cooked. 

We didn't order any specialty items this time around but we probably will next time we come to have dim sum.
The best dim sum place in Las Vegas. A little bit far but totally worth it. Service was great very friendly people. Food was reallyyyyyy gooooood!!! actually the best that we had in Vegas.

I don't often give 5 star reviews but this one is well deserved for more than just the food.. it's their PROMPT and polite service. I came by myself for a semi-late lunch adventure on a quiet Thursday, and the place looked slow. Naturally I expected quick service and wow did I get that. Got sat down and had hot tea and water delivered in seconds, followed by a couple push carts containing my go-to dishes like har gow, pork ribs, shrimp rice noodle and beef tripe. All of the staff spoke perfect English to their guests which I appreciate even though I'm Chinese (can't always assume they speak the same language). In addition, the restaurant is never short on TVs airing a variety of food/travel video clips and shows for our wandering eyes. And the open food stall showcasing specialty foods being prepared and cooked for availability is a pretty sweet feature. Overall this is an excellent and reasonably priced choice for dim sum off the busy Las Vegas Strip.

This place is horribe. My husband and I go to Dim Su regularly, but this place's food and service is awful. The food is not comparable to any other Dim Sum, and quality is terrible and overpriced. Half way through eating, the server studpidly thought we left and dumped the subpar food...save your appetite andbmoney for other high quality Dim Sum! Super disappointed! Would have given a zero star.

Not bad, clean but no ambiance at all, very cafeteria looking. I asked the lady why they didn't have a Dim Sum Cart roaming around and she said they couldn't afford hire extra people to do it, it was 5:30 pm dinner hour and very little people there..., so, we had to order the dim sum off the menu instead. Everything tastes fresh and good. It nothing special. Boring place, no ambiance, pretty good dim sum (we have had better), clean and nice people. Not a place to entertain guests from out of tow because he lack of ambiance and no dim sum cart. To sum it up: I would maybe go back out I wouldn't crave them.

If you want not so great dim sum this is the place to go. Its not terrible but not great, especially coming from LA. If you want something quick here is the place. Service was not too bad they are pretty quick with it. The restaurant itself is large. Only wish they would have more selection of dim sum. Maybe may not come back here, but we will see.

First meal at Vegas. Four star for the decent food and pleasant service. The price is surprisingly like fast-food price. Very inexpensive for authentic Chinese food. Really happy to see a Chinese restaurant with an elegant and friendly waitress.
craving for some authentic Chinese food after days of buffet at the strips. This place is actually very nice, clean. The owners is super friendly. Good service :)
We are locals and visited Ym Cha for the first time. Excellent!!! Amazingly fresh dim sum!!  Delicious!  This will be the only place that we will go for dim sum in the future!!!!

Been to a lot of dim sum parlors across the country (L.A., S.F., N.Y., Boston, etc) and although this was our first time at Yum Cha in Vegas, I would rank it in my top 5 in the country, and from a quality to price ratio perspective, best in Las Vegas for sure. My wife and I came here 5 minutes after they opened on a Saturday morning and all the items we ordered (14 dishes) were excellent quality, texture and flavors, and even their presentation. 

This is not a typical dim sum parlor where everything comes around in carts. Several items - probably their most popular ones - come around on the carts. But then you can also walk up to the "sample bar" where they prepare lots of pan fried dim sum dishes and order several other varieties of dim sum. You can also order from a server if you can flag one down. It's a creative approach and worked well for me. 

The service was attentive as they did a great job of making sure we got everything we wanted, and always filled our tea pot and water glasses. We would highly recommend Yum Cha and we will definitely be back here.

This new local gem has amazing dim sum

I'm from Orange County where dim sum is abundant.  I was really impressed with this place.  I came here on a Wednesday around 1pm with one other person.  Once we arrived we were seated immediately and carts were pushed to us.  They had everything a normal dim sum place would have but even more items.  Like a lot more!  I like that they had everything steaming hot and there were more items on their menu.  You are bound to find something you like.  Everything we tried was delicious and tasted like they had just made it.  I don't normally get desserts but we ended up even getting some goods for our hotel.  We got their sesame balls, egg tarts, and egg custard filled sweet rolls.  All were amazing and so amazing.  Our total for our food was only $19.  The desserts was an extra $10.  It was very worth it.  

The owner was really nice to us.  The girls serving us and pushing the carts were also very friendly and sweet.  The inside is very large with plenty of chairs, tables, and booths.  It's super casual.  You can walk up to where they are preparing food and also order there.  I cannot wait to come back here.

Clean facilities. Nice customer service. Food wasn't consistent. We would order a dish and it would be delicious- the next round, it would be completely bland. Still a good value for the money spent. We'll give it another try.

Made another trip to Vegas and had to check out some more of their local Dim Sum. People raved about Yum Cha so I had to check it out for myself. 
 
The staff was friendly which is always nice. To be fair I showed up there on a Thursday at 2:30pm which means this may have had some bearing on what was on offer. It was okay. I was going to snap a photo of what I ordered but it just didn't taste as bad as it looked. So that didn't seem fair. I ordered shrimp with black ,  spare ribs, shu mai and shrimp with chive.  Nothing was bad but the shu mai was old like it had been sitting for a while.

Listen this spot is clearly a favorite with the locals. It's large, clean and there's a great market across the street. Here's the take away. Visit Yum Cha on a Friday, Saturday and Sunday. I truly believe that their rush hours are different. I'm curious enough to visit on my next trip. So far K & J is the best in Vegas by my experience. I ate there at 3 on a Monday and it was fantastic!

Great service. Everything we tried was hot and tasty. They have the carts go around with the steamed items and you order the items that won't be good walking around in the carts from any of the servers walking around being extremely attentive. As a Caucasian only table, the only one there at the time, they asked if we needed more help or forks. The crispy pork belly and crispy eggplant were delicious. I could have had 3 portions of the eggplant if everything else wasn't so good. I try the sesame red bean balls wherever I go and they were the best I've had in a while. Will definitely be going there again. 

The reason I gave it a 4, which I could give it a 4.5, is the soup dumplings were not as good as other places I've had in this city.

Really glad we found this place, now we don't have to go to Ping Pang Pongs.

AWFUL, the WORST dim sum place.  This restaurant used to be fortune but then they closed and I'm pretty sure this one will too.

The price is just a lil. Cheaper then most dim sum, so I guess u get what u pay for!  It's a good thing I only bought around 7 items to go and tried it out at .  

Every item I ordered was a BIG disappointment (lack In Flavor, taste and texture)

I'm so sick of trying out new dim sum restaurants cuz I always end up going back to my one and only place(Ping Pang Pong)

Wanted to try some Dim Sum off the strip. Went to Yum Cha....what a great find!  It was off peak hours but still lots to choose from. The place is super clean and very well lit. All the dim sum staples we tried were very good. Had some delicious sticky rice and a nice serving of crispy pork belly. Also had a good bowl of congee. The owner Sam came over to make sure everything was ok. We struck up a conversation about Malaysia and the great food you can find there. His staff's service was great and he personally asked what could be done better. Now that's customer service! The place is new so hopefully the locals will support it and make it thrive. I want to return next time I'm back in Vegas.
Tried restaurant out at lunch on the way to Utah.  Food was average. The lotus wrap rice was bland.
Good food, clean and fast service. Owner is really nice greeted and checked on us couple times. Happy to find a new dimsum spot!!

FOOD IS GREAT. Seriously, I come here for their dim sum and I absolutely love it. Prices aren't bad either. $2 and some change per servings during the week, and $3 and some change on weekends and holidays. Not bad.

However, service is kind of all over the place.  Everyone is nice for the most part. They have the ladies walking around with the dim sum carts and if they have what you want, you're golden. However, if you want to order something that's not on the carts and you speak English only, there is a communication barrier more than half the time. One lady just nodded as said she'd get my order and 20 minutes later, never came back or acknowledge me and my family. I had to ask another women who understood and watched her walk straight behind the counter, grab the item I asked for, and come straight back with it! I'm guessing the other woman didn't understand me at all or forgot about us. 

Anyway, I've only been here twice so far. The first time we had a gentlemen coming to check on us regularly who spoke English and it was great! For that, 4 stars.

The second visit was with my family visiting us from California and I was so sad they had to be there to witness the lack of customer service. For that, 1 star.

I definitely will be back for the dim sum, so hopefully I can have a better updated review then.

I lived in San Francisco and there's largest Chinese community in the US but I like this this place more than any dimsum restaurant in SF.
Every time I come to Las Vegas, I always come to YumCha because they did really great job.
Great services , 
The server mention that sweet bun really hot and 
Take care really good.

good dim sum , and I recommend this is really awesome place if you love dim sum.

Came back to satisfy my craving for dim sum. The restaurant was clean as new and comfortable to dine in as usual. I also enjoyed how aunty Elaine recommended their specialities and no doubt they were good. 

Would definitely revisit them in weeks time to satisfy my craving for char siu bun and egg custard pastry! Overall, great ambience and definitely a good place to experience south East Asia cuisine!
By far the best dim sum in town !!! Very clean. Not oily like most places. Owner is very friendly. Food is amazing !!!! Highly recommend this place

I personally like the Cantonese dim sum, and this satisfied all my expectations. They don't offer the cart for dinner, but instead, you can order directly and they served it very fast.
The baked lava custard buns and steamed lava custard buns were awesome! Trust me, you should give it a try even though they looked super big. Across the states, I believe their custard buns were above 95 percentile. Don't be scared by the huge size of the baked lava buns, and don't lose interest in the boring appearance of the steamed buns, they were really really amazing! 
The shrimps dumplings across all kinds were okay, I guess you can just pick the ones based on the stuffings that you like. 
The rice noodles were super disappointing. At least the ones that we tried on that day were not fresh, the stuffing, either shrimp or beef, were super small. It was one of the few that I could confidently say that I don't like at all, even though I'm a rice noodle person.
It seems that even if you finish your meal for 30 minutes, they won't even rush you for the check if it's off peak hours. However, we were kinda busy and could wait anymore and went to the bar for our bill...

Yum Cha is my new go-to dim sum spot.  I've been to several dim sum restaurants around Vegas inside and outside of Chinatown and this place has won me over.  

I was greeted by the owner, and he took the time to explain to me that carts run from 10-3, but that I can also go to the food counter or order from the menu.  How outstanding that I can get my food 3 different ways (2 ways after 3PM when carts stop).  All the common dim sum goods can be gotten off carts, but those items are all also on the menu and most of the rest that my friends and I can think of is available on the menu or at the counter.  

In addition to the owner, the service is attentive and friendly.  The cart runners made it to my table every few minutes and the waiter checked in regularly for drinks and other matters.  The food displayed at the counter is for show and what you ask for is made to order.  

Dim Sum and tea is a staple in my circle of friends, and we have been to many establishments serving this type of cuisine in Las Vegas and other major cities.  Yum Cha is up there with any other place I've been to and will be our new cornerstone.

my Only place to eat Dim Sum even on week day!
place is modern, very clean. i love the little suspended bird cages. reminds me of Singapore.
Dim Sum is Dim Sum right? the only difference between others is that the place is modern, spacious, clean (no stinky carpet).
staff was very pleasant and friendly. 
i like their little mango and coconut flan or gello in caramel sauce. very light so you can have both flavor

My friends and I always go to the Rio to get our Dim Sum fix and it has been usually a hit or miss. I'm so glad I found Yum Cha that serves Dim Sum pretty much the whole day. 

We were greeted by the hostess immediately when we entered and seated immediately for our group of 11 with no problem. We were given menus, water and tea all around. Looking around the establishment is clean and well maintained. There are TV's all around displaying different channels and a large TV displaying Asian seafood show all on mute so it wouldn't be disruptive.

Food:

We ordered ALOT of food. Our server was great. She remembered everything we ordered except for 1 dish without writing anything down... at all and we ordered a minimum of 20 dishes.. impressive. 

My party and I ordered the typical dishes you get at most Dim Sum spots (see pictures/video) Everything was pretty much delicious and really had no complaints about any thing except for the jellyfish (usually my favorite). The Jellyfish was prepared very differently than i'm used to with it being a dry style compared to it being served with a sesame oil type base. I can probably speak for the rest of my party that most of the dishes were pretty good since we didn't leave much left over (jellyfish and a little piece of taro). 

The only dish that didn't come out was the porridge. But, by the time we were done with our meal we didn't even want it because it was so full. As we got the bill and asked if they charged us for the porridge they said no and they didn't. 

End food review

The establishment was very clean, the staff were friendly and attentive. Just a nice Dim Sum restaurant near the strip.

Last minute drive to our favorite Dim Sum Spot. We brought our son here before he heads off to college. Always great service! Food is always freshly cooked. Some of our dishes tonight.. shrimp dumpling, shumai, calamari,crispy eggplant, chives dumpling, coconut bun just to name a few. If your craving Dim Sum anytime of the day Yum Cha is the place to go!

My family and I have pretty much ravaged Vegas for the past 10 years in search of our favorite Asian restaurants there for specific cuisines so we were super surprised to find that we hadn't been to Yum Cha for dim sum before despite its stellar reviews and ratings. We were definitely not disappointed though and even came back here twice in one trip! The food and the service are both phenomenal so if you're looking for a dim sum spot in Vegas, this is it! 

Despite its popularity, there was pretty much never a wait since they have an abundance of seating and the staff are incredibly efficient throughout the entire meal. Upon walking in, it looks like a take out type of place but they actually do seat you so don't be confused~! Here, they only cart around steamed items so everything else you order from the menu (but those items come out fairly quick as well). Their most well known item is definitely the baked custard bun (even one of the ladies who help to manage said someone once ordered 100 of these to go to take back to California) -- seriously melt in your mouth heaven!! Aside from that, all of the dim sum items were yummy and didn't disappoint; you'll get exactly what you want for dim sum. 

The only thing that might be a little iffy for those coming from California is the slightly higher pricing for dim sum which ranges from like ~$4-$7 per item. One of the employees said this was their most common question/complaint was the pricing, but I honestly think it's understandable considering their popularity and lack of competition compared to California. Despite the higher pricing, I definitely still think it's worth it, especially since it's hard to come by an awesome dim sum place with even more excellent and friendlier staff in Vegas if you're visiting. Will most likely be coming back here whenever we're in Vegas again!! :)

Was excited to check out a new Dim Sum place since the Yelp reviews were the highest for this place in all of LV, and there wasn't even a 4 star rating for one in the past two yrs. Believe me I pay attention since my favorite place is at best 3-3.5. 

Well let's just say I don't think they deserve the 4 star rating. 

Let's start with the positives. Newer dining room. Fast friendly service. Reasonable selection of items. 

Negatives:

Cleanliness - asked for a knife to cut my pork buns and it was dirty

Food - most food was rather flavorless including shrimp dumplings, shu mai, shrimp chow fun, shrimp mushroom dumplings, lotus leaf pork steamed rice, and fried shrimp roll. Salt and pepper calamari, Chinese broccoli, and baked barbecue pork bun were ok. The steamed beef meatballs were not good. 

Not all of the dim sum items were not pushed on the carts and some had to be ordered off the menu so the dim sum experience was not the best.
Great food . Atmosphere is wonderful for kids. Just about one of the cleanest dim sum places I've been to.

The Dim dum not very fresh , service was fast and friendly . Not much to choices 
. FOOD was just ok
Super affordable, great food, great service! It's a restaurant, if you want to change up a menu item, like from shrimp, to pork, your server will take care of it.  Incredibly good prices.

Definitely a must try!  


The restaurant was CLEAN!!  Let's face it, many Asian restaurant are not clean.  The service was attentive and staff was kind, unlike all the other money-hustling dim sum places around Vegas!  The owner was sweet and sociable.  He was very professional!

I like the fact that they have a made-to-order hot bar!  If you want to make sure your salted shrimp is fresh, hot, and crispy and not from the cart, just go up to the hot bar!  They have congee and soups you can order from the bar.  I love their Chinese broccoli; it was made-to-order and was piping hot when it hit the table.

Eat fresh, my friends!

Came to yum cha cuz of all the good reviews.. 4.5/5 stars on yelp on a dim sum place?! Gotta try it!!
Yum cha is located on Decatur x Tropicana, it is right across from international market. 
The menu for dim sum is really small compare to all of the other dim sum places, and they have it by groups. It doesn't have a lot of what I usually ordered, and on the day that we were there, they don't even have the BBQ pastries bun, they told us they don't have it today.
So I've tried the har gao, siu mai, spare ribs,  the sticky rice with lotus leaves along with a few other dim sum, and honestly, I am not impressed. The taste is alright, I've definitely had better elsewhere, but the lack of dishes is really upsetting, I still felt the crave for dim sum after eating here. And they don't have egg tarts! (Maybe it's cuz it's weekday?) 
On their menu, they have a bunch of random stuffs too, like roti with curry and etc, and u can also go up to the counter to get the food too.
While they do have good services, I come to dim sum place for dim sum, so expand your menu!! Seriously, there was a lot of dishes that you can add!! 
Oh another disappointment was that they have messed up on the har gao. It was over cooked and the wrap wasn't made right. And I wanted to try their xiao long bao and they didn't have it :( 
However, they do have chicken bao here and it's rarely seen in most dim sum place. And they are also supposed to have streamed cake but I didn't see it in the cart?

The price is cheaper on weekdays/non-holidays so it's a better deal to go on Monday-Friday but they might have less items on the cart(?).

I've come here twice in the last two weeks and still have their baked egg custard buns and salt and pepper tofu on my mind! I haven't been up for dim sum lately, since my shellfish allergy makes all the good stuff hard to enjoy. I had read about Yum Cha on Yelp though and was eager to check it out. My husband was an immediate fan of their curry items and I really enjoyed their BBQ pork buns (extra sticky and meaty!). Our servers took care of us and explained their process to us  - during lunch/busier times they do the carts, but dinner and no so busy times you can order off the menu. Everyone was very helpful and eager to make sure we were enjoying ourselves. There has been a lot of turnover in this area, so I hope to see Yum Cha succeed in 2017. Seriously, get the custard buns!
Really good food and price is very reasonable. Didn't try but two dim sun dish the pork rolls and something else I can't remember the name for it. But all in this is a great restaurant.
Service was great! Food was delicious. Will definetly be back! Thank you! Their is nothing to complain about. Good prices, great food nice staff and they make you feel right at home.

We have been trying to find a good dimsum place since we moved here last year. Today we finally got to check out this place. We came in the afternoon so it wasn't busy. Food carts came right away before we could even sit down so that was nice. We always eat the same dimsum dishes so it's easy for us to compare. The food tastes fresh and it's not too greasy. Compared to the one place on Eastern in Henderson, this place is much better. The service is very good as well. We'll definitely come back.
Good selection and pleasant atmosphere.  I've done both in house dining and take out and both were good.  Among the better Chineese choices in Las Vegas.
Best dim sum I've had in Vegas, as we are from the SF Bay area. Glad I found it on YELP and we will come back. Highly recommend Yum Cha

Great dim sum!
Fresh and plentiful.
The wonton soup is so good!
The condiments were awesome.
Had a great light Sunday lunch.
Fast service and great prices!

Will be back.....soon!

Yum Cha has the friendliest workers for an Asian restaurant. They are always making sure we are taken care of and are very polite when they speak to us. They offer both dim sum and meals. It doesn't take long at all to get out food and I have not been disappointed yet with it. If you go you have to try their baked lava custard bun, it's the perfect texture with a sweet and savory filling. So far my favorite dim sum place.

My family and I were in town for the New Year and it's my job to find a good Chinese restaurant in town. I came across Yum Cha and definitely we were not disappointed. This restaurant definitely rivals the Chinese restaurants In San Gabriel in CA. 5 Stars!! The staff were also very accommodating and friendly.

Okay...... I think I found the love of my life!!!! 
This place is by far the best dim sum place I've ever been in the US. Malaysia's dimsum is compatible with Hong Kong's dimsum. They definitely reminded me of home - Malaysia! 
Texture, quality, flavor, seasonings are all on point! Haven't been this satisfied with Asian food in a long time. 

MUST TRY!

Very polite staff! Dim sum is served fresh and fast! The baked BBQ pork bun was really great. Also loved the shrimp & pork Shumai! The egg tart, sweet tofu, and coconut bun are really great desserts! The entire restaurant is very open and not too loud. It was nice talking to the staff while enjoying the food. I'd recommend this place for lunch, dinner, or even a snack.

Came here with my family on Christmas Day for Dim sum. We arrived at 10:30 and the place was half filled. The place got busier and service became slower. The food was good, and my favorite was the pineapple bun. The bun was filled with yellow liquid and oozes out when you bite it. The environment was really nice and clean. The servers either spoke Cantonese or mandarin, some knew English. They were also friendly. Besides the dim sum carts that they push around, you can also walk up to the counter to order what you want.

Overall giving four stars because service was slow when it got busier. We ordered some foods but the food never came. Some of the dishes were cold when they arrived to us. I would recommend this place, because it's a nice place for dim sum.
Great service, good food. As a Chinesr Malaysian, I must say the taste is genuine and nostalgic. 2nd visit! Must try for dim sum and the curry noodles are amazing.

Solid 4/5 stars. It's good, but not the best I've ever had. The service was easy and fast, but it confused me at first. They have it set up looking like a food court, but there are actual servers that take your order and bring your food. It honestly looks like it used to be a Panda Express or something. Either way, it's a place you would go to for cheap and fast dim sum.

We've lived in San Francisco, New York, Chicago and now, Las Vegas. We've tried Dim Sum here and now found Yum Cha. The Dim Sum is fresh, tasty, and there is a large variety to choose from. The food is very fresh and the restaurant is clean, inviting, and the owners welcoming, friendly and knowledgeable. The service is good, friendly and efficient. (My husband is Taiwanese)
We Highly recommend!!
Love the decor with all birds cage. It looks clean. The service is great and friendly. The food is great. Especially try their taro cake. Love it! Must try!
It was OK but still better than a lot of places. I order carry-out and it took awhile for my order.

The food was delicious here. However there is a bit of a language barrier depending on what server you get. The employees working and pushing the cart stok in Chinese to us when we ask questions that was really difficult for for us to communicate. There is a lot of picture pointing going on.
