However once you finally do get past that barrier the food is very delicious however a little bit slow. The prices for the food are reasonable and it fills you up pretty quickly.

Me and my friends has been coming here lately. After watching a movie in Orleans, we come here for great food. The staff are very friendly. Food is amazing. Resto is clean. I would rather go here than other dim sum place.

I really enjoyed this stop and look forward to more. There are dim sum carts that roll around, but they have a full menu, and a counter area where you can select more food (that will be brought to your table). We tried a bit of everything, from the chive dumplings at the counter service, roti and curry dipping sauce from the counter, and tons of dim sum from the cart. Everything was excellent!

I'm glad we found our new go-to for dim sum!
Best dim sum in Vegas.  Dumplings are always hot and fresh.  Service is always excellent.  And the place is cleaner than most.

Great new restaurant. I wanted to have some Chinese food and dim sum so I tried it out. They have a large selection to choose from. Everything was tasty with a nice presentation. So many items to try for next time. It's quite a spacious restaurant with a few large screen TVs, booths and accommodations for large parties. The owners take pride in their food and stop by to check on you. A must go.
Our new favorite dim sum place! Very clean establishment, delicious food, and wonderful service. I highly recommend the shrimp balls and our favorite, the baked custard bun!

I usually go to other places for dim sum and usually people that serve us are very rude but this place everyone is just soooo nice! Everyone is smiling and helping us out. They dont give us that mean look just like every Chinese place I go to. Always refilling our waters and I this place is surprisingly clean! 

Must try the roti with curry and calamari :) 
Oh and their water doesnt taste like tap lol

My family used to go for dim sum at the Orchid Garden for years and now that my sisters and I are growing up, we don't go as often and we order to eat at home. 

It's either a hit or miss for me. One day I come, they have egg tarts and the next time I come, they don't. I absolutely love egg tarts so why would I come if they're not going to have it? If they know that the egg tarts run out quickly, they need to prepare more.
Anyways, my family went on Tuesday to celebrate my sister's graduation and this time, they did not have crab claws with shrimp. I mean I guess. 

What I would recommend: 
-Steamed and baked BBQ pork bun
-Fried pork balls
-Egg tarts (when it is actually available)
-Chicken shumai
-Shrimp dumplings
-Congee
-BBQ pork puff pastry 
-Shrimp balls
-Red bean sesame balls
-Taro cake 

I kind of wish that they have pineapple buns on the menu but there are other dim sum places in Vegas as well.
You can order by menu and there are carts that go around too. 
The staff were nice and  pretty patient every time I visited. I praise them for being exceptionally patient this time with my family being those incredibly demanding/annoying customers. 
I also thought that this place would be packed but there is usually one or two families. I have never seen the place filled up. Other than that, the food is good and tastes like what I've had at other dim sum places.

Loved this restaurant. Seemed very authentic. Food was flavorful and hot. Service was excellent. Sam was very attentive and informative about dishes. I live in Anthem and thisb is my NEW DIM SUM RESTSURANT. Dim Sum is served all day. Try it. I am sure it will become your new Dim Sum restaurant.  ENJOY!!!!

I went here today with my mom since she's looking for a good dim sum place to eat with some of her friends that enjoy dim sum and good tea. We only tried a few dishes and were really disappointed with what we had so left after a quick snack.

We had the following dishes:
  ha gow - the filling was bland but the worst part was the wrapper. The wrapper was mushy and very sticky
  shrimp cheung fun - the cheung fun was a bit thick and tough, nothing like the ones I've had back in San Francisco and LA areas
  noh mai gai - rice was undercooked, bland as bland can be. This is usually my favorite dish so I've eaten it a lot
  feng zhao - it was cooked alright (maybe a little too soft) but very bland
  fried pork belly - over fried so it was dry, stale seasoning
  tea - not very good. it was hot enough but even after steeping there wasn't much flavor at all even at the end of the meal

The service wasn't bad with lots of servers for a half full restaurant. They were quick, attentive, and friendly.
As a sidenote, they really should get toilets/urinals that self flush. I took a look, washed my hands, and left the restroom without using it.
Visiting from Los Angeles came up on this great place. I can say this is good as the Dim Sum I have in downtown Chinatown.

Salt and pepper shrimp was salty, service was bad, i called the hosts they just ignored me and kept on talking, i have to wave 4x. HK seafood garden is much better... dimsum? They really have not much of it, only siomai pr whatever...

It's nice to get good Dim Sum. The reviews were pretty good so we were there right as they opened. The service was quick and continuous as the carts kept coming by. We had about 8 dishes from shumai to sticky rice and the egg custard tart was right out of the oven!

The tea was Jasmine and it was really tasted good. There were many big screen tv's located all around the dining room, plenty to watch. 
Service was very good and the restaurant was very clean.

Parking is everywhere as they are located in a large shopping center.

I've been wanting to have dim sum in Vegas, but it seemed there wasn't a unanimous favorite on Yelp. Yum Cha seemed to be the best of the options so my mom and I tried it out on a Saturday night. When you walk in, it resembles a cafeteria. We were seated right away and ordered water and hot tea (no alcohol here). There weren't any carts operating, we just ordered from a server. 

They have a dim sum menu and "regular" Chinese food menu, though we only ordered the dim sum. We ordered the Mushroom Mai, Xiaolongbao, Lotus Leaf Pork Sticky Rice, Veggie and Potato Curry Puff, and the Beef Rice Noodle. They were out of the Beef Rice Noodle so we ordered the Chive Dumpling instead. The server sort of laughed at us after we ordered, and maintained a somewhat sarcastic tone the whole time, but I think... he was trying to be funny? I have no idea. I thought he was trying to imply we ordered a lot of food but at the end of the meal I didn't think it was too excessive. 

All of the dishes we got were huge, even if there were only 2-3 pieces per. These are definitely not bite sized. The Mushroom Mai felt like a meatball/fishball and I think it's important to note that even if a dish is called "mushroom mai" or "chive dumpling", these are not vegetable dishes. We realized at the end of our meal that 3/5 of the dishes we ordered were made with pork and shrimp and the sticky rice also had pork. I wish we would have been able to switch it up a bit and we should have ordered a few vegetarian dishes. The curry puff was one of my favorites, and I really liked the texture of the sticky rice. The skin of the xiaolongbao was really good and I'm disappointed I didn't get to try the rice noodles. Overall I think our selections were a little too similar. Even with that mistake I didn't think the flavors were that great overall. It's hard to distinguish much flavor when you have a pressed ball of pork and shrimp that falls out of your dumpling. I think I'll be trying some other dim sum places before trying Yum Cha again, if I ever do. I will say that the meal was crazy cheap. $23 bill for a good amount of food for two people.

Native Nevadan- grew up on Dim Sum in the Bay Area and in S California. Our family have distinctive tastes and very particular to food being fresh. After eating all of the dim sum places all around Las Vegas, our all around was Ping Pang Pong, Hong Kong Garden, and Changs. My husband is a creature of habit and does not like to venture out what he considers as his staples. After persuading him to try what 521 other yelpers have reviewed, I am taking the time out to write a review because we agree. The atmosphere was bright and lively. The open kitchen where some dim sum dishes are made fresh to order gave me peace for cleanliness, the dim sum taste was surprisingly very good. There wasn't one bad item and I would say all around superior as a whole than the other dim sum restaurants in town. Xiaolong Bao was probably the main item I would stay was standard. The friendly customer service is the push to move Yum Cha to our now go to place. Give it a try, this place will start to get very packed.

Must order:
Shrimp and Spinach steamed dumpling
Pan fried shrimp and chive dumpling

I have never seen such a bad service attitude. Inside the buns is still frozen. We ask to see the manager. But manager does not appear. Just told the waiter to ask what we want. Attitude is very bad. And his expression also felt that we deliberately find trouble. There is no apology. No change of food. I will never to come again. Horrible service

Hands down, some the best dim sum I've ever had! The food was absolutely delicious, an amazing blend of fresh flavors that dazzled my taste buds. The restaurant has both traditional push carts and a counter where you can choose from an array of delicious made-to-order items. Customer service was great and the owners are super friendly. Too bad I don't live in Vegas, otherwise I'd be eating here regularly!

This restaurant is fantastic! As a vegetarian I find it difficult to find options when eating out. They have a great selection of tofu dishes and when they noticed I was looking at the vegetable section of the menu they made personal recommendations and offered to add some extra veggies. Extremely personal and so friendly. I love having this restaurant in the neighborhood. Highly recommended!
Very friendly staff, manager was happy to see us even though (or maybe because) it was our first visit. Had very good char siu bao. Happy to make dishes to order.
service is excellent!! Good is good but could use less salt I was driving so much water after.
If you like Chinese cuisine come to Yum Cha!! Clean, fast service, authentic Chinese food!! -Joscelyn:)

After my first visit here with my family, I couldn't wait to write a review about this restaurant! It became my new go-to place when I'm craving for some dim sum :]

The establishment occupies a pretty big space and they are able to accommodate a lot of people. Plenty of tables and chairs throughout. Majority of their kitchen is open as well. You're able to see most of it behind a glass wall. It's a great way for customers to know how their food is being handled and prepared.

Our server, Elaine, was really nice and informative. She told us what menu items are their most popular and recommended a few things, including one of their famous dessert items. But when it comes to dim sum, I don't even need to see the menu. ;] It's one of my fave Asian cuisines, so I have high expectations for it. lol From the shrimp noodle, shumai, salt & pepper calamari, to the veggie noodles and beef tripe, everything was so yummy! Pricing was not too bad either. :]

Unlike most dim sum places, they DON'T serve their dim sum from a steam cart all day. Our server told us that, once lunch is over, they prepare the food as you order. This is to make sure nothing gets left to sit out all day. When it comes to ensuring quality and freshness, you can tell the difference.

The rest of the staff was very attentive and always made sure our drinks were constantly being refilled. Since this restaurant has three owners, their menu has some Malaysian influence too.

Don't pass up on trying this place out! If you love dim sum as much as I do, you won't be disappointed. :]

My Girl and I gave this place a try being that we are Dim Sum aficionado's it was way better than we expected and reasonably priced too. They have all the same items from the other Dim Sum Spots so don't worry you'll be satisfied!
Compared to the other places we've tried I would give this place a must try! Coming from me I wouldn't say that to waste your time because everyone's taste buds are different so just try it out. Not only Dim Sum but they have a Regular Menu with Chinese Dishes as well. Spoke with one of the workers that used to work at a Dim Sum spot I would always go to and told him we'd definetly be back! I Guarantee you'll never say Nah when it comes to Yum Cha!

wow! I absolutely fell in love with this place! the service is beyond exceptional and the food is so delicious! they have such a great variety and it was all sooooo good! on top of that I love how really clean and open it is! this will definitely be our new go to everytime were here!

The best chinese restaurant here in Vegas, the food is really good and the cleanliness of the restaurant is impressive, prices are really good too especially if you come on days that they have the dim sum discount I think tues-fri!

This place was ok. Nothing to be excited about. Don't bother ordering the beef tendon noodle. Better noodles at 168 market food court for 1/2 the price.  Ordered off the steam cart and food was luke warm and few cold dishes.

Watching Bizarre Foods last night is the reason why my gf and I craved dim sum and chicken feet. We recently moved to Las Vegas so we were on the hunt for some great dim sum. We stumbled upon Yum Cha & I am so glad that we did. Every piece from the taro puff, to all of the various dumplings met our expectations and more! My personal favorite was the flat white steamed noodle with steamed shrimp. The sauce that was added to it before being served was absolutely delicious!  For desert, the custard buns had my name written all over it. First bite in and you're greeted with an explosive flavor of soft bun. Sweet and decadent custard filling and a bit of custard crunch on the top. All 3 mixed together tastes perfect! The staff was very friendly and we're always on top of things whenever we needed something. If you happen to be in he area and are craving great dim sum and Chinese food. Yum Cha is the spot.

Decided to try this place out since we wanting to eat some dim sum while we were visiting vegas and plus they serve dim sum all day. We ordered chicken feet(which I didn't eat but my girlfriend did - she said it was good), shaomai, crispy pork belly, radish cake, deep fried pork dumpling, and egg tart. The shaomai was just ok, not that great. The crispy pork belly and raddish cake were good. The deep fried pork dumpling and egg tart were pretty good. Overall I thought the food was ok. Not the best dim sum but not the worst. I enjoyed the dim sum restaurant inside the Rio Hotel more than here. I give this place 3.5 stars.

Simply amazing! Me and my wife ate for like 4 people and almost finished every last bite!

What I like about this restaurant is how fresh everything tastes. Servers come to you with a cart full of various piping hot items like steamed pork, buns, beef tendons, chicken feet, dim sum, fish balls, and more. What I listed is what me and my wife got lol. Plus the fish ball noodles soup, roasted duck, and sweet red bean buns for dessert. 

I thought the price was insanely cheap too. I thought the cashier employee ready 87 bucks, which sounded right, but it was actually just 47$! 

Speaking of employees by the way, the servers were all very nice, offered suggestions, and were nice enough to give us half a duck when we asked as opposed to the whole thing which I think they usually serve. 

STOP BY AND YOU WON'T BE DISAPPOINTED :D

Our experience with the service at this joint was horrendous today. First the greeter attempted to seat us near the front door where the cold air was blowing in.  There were plenty of empty tables or booths further in.  Reluctantly the greeter seated us just a slight bit further from the front.  The place then started to pack and the chaos began.  Instead of waiting for the dim sum carts to come around, the other customers either redirected the carts to their table or went up to the carts to pick their food.  Some crowded at the counter and grabbing food from there.  There was no civility or order.  It was like a horde of starving people in a soup kitchen.  We managed to get some dishes off a near empty cart that came by.  I thought eating dim sum or yum cha is supposed to be a relaxing experience when friends can chat over the meal.  I tried to order food off the menu from a server,  he just walked away and never came back.    After 15 minutes with no carts coming to our area, I finally got the attention of another server.  I asked him why the carts are not coming over.  He didn't answer.  I told him to bring us the bill and we are leaving.  His response was "Good, leave".
I take back my previous rating and changed it to one star because this type of service.  During our previous visit, Elaine who I believe to be the manager had asked us to each recommend 3 friends to patronize this joint.  If Elaine or staff member of this joint read this review update (which I doubt), we will tell our friends not to patronize this joint.  Today was within the winter holiday, it appears most of today's customers were from out-of-town.  This joint's owner or manager should realize it is the locals that support their business year round.  We are taking our business back to Chang's down the street.

Had the same problem as Lily C. Restaurant refused to honor $25 certificate obtained just days ago, claiming they have not participated in the program for a while, yet it is still listed on the website today. Get it together or just honor the promotion as a courtesy. We splurged since there was a $50 minimum. Big mistake as our bill ended up over $70 for 2 adults/2 kids. A bit pricey for a 'casual' lunch.

Decent dim sum, was a bit cold as we dined later in the afternoon. The freshly steamed dishes were fine. Not the best dim sum but not the worst either. A bit pricey at $3.50-$4+ a dish  ($1+ for each morsel). At that price point Ping Pang Pong @ Gold Coast is better. Service was quick and attentive but it was not busy when we went.

And in case you noticed this place has large number of good reviews - they reward positive reviews by bribing reviewers with free dim sum - shady.

My family and I were out in Vegas last month and I was craving dim sum, this place definitely hit the spot for us! It's about 5 to 10 mins off the strip, worth the distance though. The staff were friendly and the owner was very sweet. He came to check on us several times and we had a great conversation with him. The food was amazing! They have some people with carts walking around the restaurant, and the rest was made right in front of you where a row of steamers and staff were. It came out quickly, was flavorful, and fairly priced. If you're looking for a good dim sum spot in Vegas, this is the place to go.  I plan to stop here every time we are in Vegas for a great breakfast, vs an overpriced waffle on the strip.

DIM SUM PLACE LOOKS CLEAN 
.
**2017 Yelp 100 Challenge #6**
.
The place looks super clean & simple & pretty big. There's none of that stuffy feeling you get when you go into a Chinese restaurant be side of old carpet & all the oils stuck in it smell. 

The staff was very attentive at least the lady was super friendly. She kept checking up on us & made sure everything was good. 

The food IMHO was not the best. They had items that most other DIM SUM places aren't very tasty but the MAIN squeeze basic items that I usually get were just whatever's. My main concern was the SALT & PEPPER shrimp which they even show on the tv screen slide show Of how it should be but it came out like CRAP.... If the shrimp gets too much coverage from the flour then the shell doesn't crisp up properly enough for you to eat it whole. 

CHICKEN STEAMED BUN - HOT & soft 
STEAMED RICE CAKE 
CHIVE DUMPLING 
CHICKEN FEET - perfect 
LOTUS LEAF PORK STICKY RICE 
FISH. STUFFED TOFU 
PORK & VEG ROLL 
BEEF BALL 
RADISH CAKE - SO disappointed it's like they put too much flour in the mix 
2x STEAMED PORK RIB - FREAKEN YUMMY 
CHINESE BROCOLLI 
BEEF TENDON - DERICIOUS!!!
SALT & PEPPER SHRIMP - SO sad.

So I probably won't be coming back here unless the hubby wants some chicken FEET. One because you have no idea which items cost how much. Because I figured which page they are on would indicate the price but the way things were shown on the receipt says otherwise. So unfortunately when I don't trust something I usually won't be going back.

This was a great place, the food was delicious and the staff was awesome.  The dim sum was very good and very reasonably priced.  The female manager took extra good care of us and checked on us throughout our meal. The shrimp buns were delicious and so were the other dishes we had.

I need to start this review by saying how impressed I was with the entire staff.  The service we received was EXCELLENT!!!  I have never had such excellent service in a Chinese restaurant in my life!!!  The staff was very helpful with our orders, patient, and attentive to our needs.  

Dim sum for 2.  Got shumai, 2 kinds of chive dumplings, har gow x2, fishcake stuffed tofu x2, crab claws, and sesame bun.  I would say the food here is good.  Not great, not bad, but definitely good.  Would I come here again?  Yes I would.  Would I recommend this place?  Yes I would.  The reviews I read lead me to believe that there were tons of items up front in the display.  I was a little let down that they didn't have all the items I was hoping for.  The carts that come around are pretty standard for any dim sum restaurant in town.  The shumai were  good, they were my favorite item.  I judge every dim sum place by their shumai and I was not disappointed.  I'd like to go back with more people so I can try more items.
Lucky to have found this Dimsum spot! The food was great.l, and I'm from westminster where they have really good dumsum.

GREAT PLACE FOR CHEAP AND DELICIOUS DIM SUM!!!

*review is only about the dim sum*

We came at 12; no wait, lots of seating and carts walking around.

Mon-Fri dim sum is only $2.88 and on weekends it's $3.28

Carts are only till 2:30pm

We ordered: Pork shu-mai, Chicken shu-mai, Lotus Leaf, Steam Pork Bun, Baked BBQ Bun, Shrimp dumpling = total $21.80

I love how fast the service is and how attentive they are! Very nice! 

Food was pretty great for the price! Not too salty. Ok portion. CHECK THIS PLACE OUT! Worth it!!

This place is the bomb!! I never had Dim sum before and this place was a real treat. I enjoyed the push kart that came by the table, I tried way too many dishes off of that thing, I guess I didn't feel guilty bc it came to the table instead of me making frequent trips to the counter. I had the salt and pepper pork chops as a main entree and it tasted amazing. The BBQ pork buns was worth the trip by themselves. Give this place a try if you love Dim sum or just great Chinese food.

I was thinking a dim sum place close to the strip would be good to offer their selection daily, but they did not.  We came on a Thursday morning, and they had barely anything in their carts and when we asked for specific items they said they put in a order for it.  We were there for 30-40 minutes eating a chatting, the food was okay, the skin on the shrimp ha gao was thicker than i'm used to.  I would probably go again just so I can see how they are on the weekend, and maybe a fresher selection of dim sum.
I was thinking they wouldn't have a good variety of dim sum and they did. Good service, cute interior. From Tueday to Friday some of the more popular dim sum is discounted.

Don't believe the 1-star reviews!! They were disgruntled people who tried to eat here on Christmas day: THE BUSIEST DIM SUM DAY OF THE YEAR!! Of course it took forever...they were over-run! Every local was trying to eat there because it's so good. 
We had brunch there yesterday and it was amazing!! We hadn't even settled into our booth and were already had several piping hot delectable items in front of us off the cart! Shrimp dumplings, spicy beef, tender tendon, chicken dumplings, fried shrimp/crab claws, curried fish balls, hot mustard and chili oil!! A bounty of Dim Sum Delights!! Plus they offer a wide variety of a la carte items like beef stew and noodles.
The service was friendly, quick and intense! Our waitress gave us the low-down on the house specialties and made good recommendations. We ate until we could barely stand up to leave!
The place is huge and can accommodate large groups. The prices are good. I plan to visit every time I am in Vegas. It's only a short Uber off the strip and totally worth it.
Yum Cha is my new Vegas Fav for Dim Sum!!

My first visit here and I absolutely loved it! I've had Dim Sum elsewhere, I don't know how to order Dim Sum as other Dim Sum restaurants have carts that come around and you choose the ones you want. I  am very happy that they had a menu that tells you what type of Dim Sum you are ordering. Makes it very easy! You guys have to try the dessert Dim Sum. Its filled with Custard and its so delicious!! Yum Cha I'll be back!

The previous restaurants that occupied this space have left a bad impression on many. This is unfortunate because Yum Cha is very good! I've tried both their dim sum and their dinners. Both are amazing!  The staff is extremely helpful!  The owners are always around to help in any way!

Place is great! The dim sum here is really good! Served really hot and fresh! I would prefer here than Orchids. Service is better and the  place seems more modern and spacious. The food off the dim sum menu was great too! Didnt take too long for us to get our food to arrive to the table.
Great food and great service. If you want great Dim Sum this is the place. They have a huge selection of items and everything is always hot and fresh.

My Family and I live in Vegas for little over two years, from San Diego. Tried so many dim sum places and we have never pleased with the TASTE, FRESHNESS, AUTHENTICITY, CLEANLINESS, and ATTITUDE. Finally we have found a PERFECT THE BEST DIM SUM PLACE IN VEGAS - YUM CHA. My wife and I were so happy, even my 4 years old daughter love the food.
At the end of the meal, Sam the owner stopped by at our table. We asked him what should we have for dessert, he recommended us to have their signature 'Lava Custard Bun' OMG  we were blown away, they were so awesome... Sweet, little salty on the Custard and perfect crust on top of the bun.
Guys, you guys got to believe me... I'm really picky on the food, always want to make things right and perfect. I grew up in the Restaurant-Hospitality industry.
I would like to take this opportunity to share my idea with Sam, I think would be better if they add another hot sauce on the table - their own SIGNATURE HOT SAUCE. 
With their magic ingredients combination, will make them different than any other places just using chili oil and sambal oelek. 
We will be back Sam, You and your Team are doing an excellent job! Thank you.

Great service and hot food fast! 
Delicious! 
I will definitely be back for the crispy eggplant.

So every time we go to Vegas, we make it a point to come here. We live in LA and there is no shortage of dim sum spots and I think my family and I have been to most. We are huge foodies and dim sum is always a craving. If you're the same way - your dim sum eating life means nothing if you don't come here. Our dim sum worlds have been SHOOK. They have the freshest, tastiest dim sums ever. Everything is made fresh to order - not like some where you know it's been sitting in those carts since lunch time began. That's another thing, they don't do push carts - you simply order. They also have been attentive and friendly - each time we go we are met by the owners(?)/managers(?). We LOVE this place so much we plan a trip just to come here. It's really the best dim sum and they serve it all day! Not like most places that end at 3pm. If you're in town, make it a point to stop by!

GD find ! REALLY like their authentic buns for dim sum. Fried SHRIMP wonton excellent! Everything really delicious and made fresh to order (slight wait but worth it). Mgr Sam even made special lap xuong  order for us which I really appreciate!
Will definitely be back to try the lunch dim sum special.
Dinner specials and will have liquor soon.

Love their decor and the cultural history behind it!
Great place to eat. Food is always good and the service is great. They are always looking to improve. Food comes out quickly and is delicious every time.

Our only DIM SPOT..best Veggie and Potato Curry Puff!! Always welcoming, friendly, clean, and great selection.

Back again and always happy with the pleasant service and tasty variety of dim sum items.

We usually have gone to a different dim sum on S Decatur, but this visit, we wanted something much closer to Desert Paradise, our timeshare condo, so we happened to see the All Day Dim Sum sign in Yum Cha's window, which is at the intersection of S. Decatur and W. Tropicana Aves.

Boy, are we glad we saw that sign! This place is FUN! No crowded, hustle-bustle here, but don't let that make you believe it isn't worthy of your patronage. I think our early bird time frame may have been their less busy time.

Service is friendly, engaged, and competent. We had a table for our family (8), and they handled the varied ordering just fine. We had vegetarian preferences, tip-toe new to dim sum, and experienced dim sum addicts to deal with, and they seemed to understand. 

Some dishes were delivered to the wrong individual, but really, dim sum, is meant to be shared--and that only meant that someone who would never have ordered that dish, discovered they liked it. LOL.

We had our favorites, steamed pork buns, on the menu in various forms, and then there were a lot of other new ideas for us.

No one left hungry; no one was disappointed in the fare; no one felt neglected. The tab averaged $11.50 a person before tax and tip, and we had plenty of hot tea as well. We had good food and good fellowship. What more is there?

I remember the place that use to be here it was a dump, but since they have changed into a dim Sum Restaurant it's 100 percent better the food is great, clean and fresh I know a lot of other places in town where I can go to get Dim Sum this is my second time here and I am pretty pleased with them! I love the Lotus Leaf pork sticky rice it's my favorite! But I recommend this place! 

Best,
K.Kaviar
Good dim sum! Our first time here, and we would come back next time in Vegas. Had all the normal goodies, char sieu bao, har gow, sticky rice are all good.

We had dim sum for lunch here today.

The food was pretty good as we probably had ~10 different kinds of items.  The prices are very reasonable as well.  Just on the food we had, I would have given the restaurant a 3.5.  On the negative side, the choices were fairly limited.  We're used to going to dim sum in Chinese restaurants in Los Angeles, where there seem to be many different "carts" being wheeled around and at least 50 types of items.  Here, there is basically only 3 carts and maybe 20 items total.

The setting is also nothing to write home about.  Set in a strip mall, the restaurant looked dated and has the quality of a cafeteria type setting.

Service is great, but a couple of dim sum dishes were bland. The lady working there could tell we didn't like a few things and asked what was wrong. I would still come back here though and just not order some of the things, such as cheung fun and curry balls. I loved the radish cakes!
Great place off the strip! Whole steam fish was the best! Dim sum also serves at night!!

I always go here for lunch since it is close to my office. The servers are always friendly and attentive. Someone is constantly checking if you need something. Food is delicious. I super like their siomai, beef tendon, mongolian beef lunch special and custard bun. Those custard buns are so heavenly you have to stop yourself from eating more. Quality of food here is better than Orchid Garden. I would highly recommend this place!
Very nice owners and staff!! Food was very good and a great variety. We will be back!
Very good and reasonably priced. They have large round tables, so you can bring a crowd. Clean and spacious.

Found this place by accident! 
This place is amazing dimsum,soups and etc..
Street food in Asia .food are all to die for
And they have a variety of place to choose from..
Staff are very attentive and you get your money's 
Worth. If you are a tourist and looking for good authentic dimsum and chinese food ...this is the place to be.

Absolutely delicious.  After reading all the good reviews, I had to see it for myself.  So many choices, and fresh!  All the fried dishes were made after we ordered, not sitting around on the cart getting cold. The service was exceptional. They were very attentive and polite. We didn't feel rushed at all. It's so unlike a typical Chinese restaurant. We will definitely be back, bringing some relatives to try our new dim sum spot.

By far best place for egg custard. Great place for dim sum and the prices are reasonable. You have to try the baked lava custard bun. Crisp from the outside and moist and gooey in the inside. I say it's the Chinese version of lava cake.

It is decent, if you are very hungry :/
The selection of dim sum is limited however the quality for the most part is good. I loved the spinach dumplings and my friend enjoyed the shu mai (traditional pork). The service is impeccable :)

Great dim sum place in Vegas, compared to other places. We were seated quickly which was nice. Nice area where you can choose from a variety of stews, buns, and fried foods. They also cook it for you when you order it  so it's hot and fresh. Service isn't bad, staff is pretty friendly. Overall, would recommend if you're craving for dim sum!
Found Yum Cha on Yelp. We eat best dim sum in Atlanta and Seattle. Yum Cha must be best in Las Vegas because we loved it. Yum Cha has carts with all our favorite dim sum dishes.

Highly recommend. They have a wide variety of choice like dim sum, hot pot, and main course food. Servers were very helpful and nice, always have a smile their face. Since it was grand opening, so the environment was very clean. Each booth has their an outlet to charge any phones or computers! The great catch would be the super LOW PRICE for each dim sum! Would come again for sure!

Wanted to try a different Dim Sum restaurant when I was in Vegas.  
We arrived at about 10:30am and the restaurant was quite empty on a Saturday morning. 
There was 1 food cart and it looked like there's an area to select hot foods.  We did order off the menu too. 

Overall, the service was okay but the food was mediocre.  The spare ribs lacked flavor. :( 

Overall, I don't think I'd ever return here.  The food was just not as good as other places I've been.
They are so nice and really do care about taking care of their guests. Wonderful customer service. I wasn't the biggest fan on the food but it wasn't bad either.

Great new dim sum place. We love that they serve dim sum at night. We liked chow main, pork and chive dumplings, steamed shrimp dumplings, curry Malaysian pancakes, and egg custard. Its clean and service is good.

Great dim sum place in Las Vegas! Definitely my go to now for dim sum. 

The owner, Sam and the rest of his staff is very friendly and attentive to details. We never ran out of water or tea and they kept our table clear of empty dishes. 

The restaurant is very clean which is always a plus! There are too many places that have great food but dirty dining areas. Yum Cha has amazing food and very clean. There's a lot of seating and they can accommodate larger parties.

Now for the food, this is hands down best dim sum I've had here in Las Vegas! Some of our favorites were the pork and shrimp shumai, shrimp dumpling, sticky rice wrapped in lotus leaves, ang roti canai. Their yum cha fried rice was also very good and flavorful.

We had the custard buns for dessert and those were simply amazing. A definite must for those with a sweet tooth! 

Visit this place, you will not regret it! We will be back!

Or should it be called Yummy Cha? I've been to four dim sum restaurants in the Las Vegas area and I have to say that Yum Cha is the best.

My husband and I visited Yum Cha  this past Saturday. As always, my husband scored a parking space right in front of the restaurant. As we were walking to the door, the door opened up for us and stayed opened. When we got there, one of the employees of the restaurant was holding the door open for us. I don't remember any restaurant doing that for me as soon as I get out of the car. So I was wow'd.

We walk in and the restaurant is huge and CLEAN! Double WOW!. We are seated, are drink orders are taken, I turn around and there's the dim sum cart. Triple WOW! 

And the one cart has variety of options that it took us, what seemed like, less than 30-seconds to grab six dishes and 5-seconds to stuff our mouths with har gow and shumai when we realized, we didn't take a foodie pic. So in other words, we were hungry.

About a minute later, a second cart pulled up where we grabbed two more dishes and I was like, we have to slow down. Thank goodness my husband ordered chrysanthemum tea. And wait there's more. Whatever dim sum dishes they don't have on the cart, but is on the menu and as long as it was not a seasonal dish, you can order it and it is still the same weekend price of $3.58/each dish, $2.98/each on weekdays. So we ordered 3 more dishes.

Now it seems like we ordered a lot of food, and yah, it was, but keep in mind, depending on the size of the dim sum, it comes in 2s to 5s. Only two of the dishes were really bready, so we weren't filled up until we had the baked baos.

I have a lot of family and friends that visit. Yum Cha is definitely on the list of family lunch or dinner.

Fantastic job Yum Cha!

I don't usually give reviews often but this place is awesome! If you're vegan or vegetarian there are few options for you! They make a really good vegetable and tofu hot pot. The name sounds plain and boring but it is really flavorful!
Really great dim sum. The flavor is amazing, good amount of salt and clean flavor.   The restaurant is clean and comfortable. Service is fast, friendly and kind. I will be back

My first dim sum experience in Las Vegas. I had driven by Yum Cha several times since it is close to my house, but I finally found someone to go try it with (dim sum is hard to eat alone). The restaurant itself is fairly large, and the birdcages hanging from the ceiling are very distinct. The interior was clean, and service was actually friendlier and more attentive than usual for a dim sum place. It was also not too crowded, but also not empty, so a nice balance and no wait before getting seated.

As for the dim sum itself, there is a hybrid system of a few carts that come around and food over at the counter. I haven't really seen this setup before, but anything you order up at the counter will be brought to your table. The food itself was not bad; not the best dim sum I've ever had, but I also haven't had any other dim sum in Las Vegas to compare with Yum Cha. 

Prices seemed reasonable; I didn't really pay attention to how much each dish cost, but we were pretty full at the end and the subtotal was about $20 per person for our party of two. 

No major complaints. Yum Cha seems like a solid dim sum place, and it's close to my house too.

Just an average dim sum place. The service was amazing, but the food was mediocre. We ordered pretty much everything on the menu and it was either too mushy or just meh. I would give the food about a 2, but the service was so awesome that I had to give it an extra star. The calamari was non-existent, so it felt like I was just eating batter and salt. Literally, fried batter with nothing in it. The tripe was decent and the lava custard was pretty good. Everything else was soggy. I'm not sure if I'll be back here, but I tried! My last round, I ordered the pork ribs, stuffed mushrooms, and pork and chive dumplings. For some reason, something smelled really off. It turned me
Off and wasn't sure what dish it was. It was strong, like something went bad. My heart told me to stop eating, so I did. We ended our meal with the lava custard, which was delicious. TBH, I don't think I'll be coming back, now that I think about it....

I was really craving dim sum tonight and initially planned on going to the Rio or Chinatown but I noticed that Yum Cha had really good reviews so I decided to give them a chance.
We were seated immediately (boyfriend, son, and I) and they all seem like genuine people. Compared to most dim sum places, the service was great and the food was prepared fresh. You can actually watch then prepare your food for you. Freshly steamed, freshly cooked, and in a timely fashion.
I'd definitely recommend giving this place a try. It's ALL DAY DIM SUM at such a reasonable price and extremely tasty!
I'll definitely be coming back whenever I crave for more dim sum!
First stop for food once me and my girlfriend came in to town on a trip. Yum Cha has great Dim Sum but even better service. I would definitely come here again when I'm in town next time.

I'm disappointed.  Maybe because I've been spoiled by the dim sum in San Francisco and the Arcadia area but...I can't believe this got as high of ratings as it did.

I walked in with a friend recently and was very disappointed in terms of selection and flavor.  We were limited in terms of what was coming out of the kitchen and flavor was muted.  I mean this place satisfied my cravings, but do I really want to ingest this amount of calories for this satisfying only a baseline of dim sum?  

Nothing really stood out other than the fried pork buns and the egg tart.  Everything else, I could live without.

DINNER VISIT Sooooooooo friendly. Bent over backwards to be helpful. Super fresh and they make thier own soy sauce ..ARE YOU KIDDING ME !?!?, full menu plus dim sum. Very authentic.  I will be back. Thank you.

YUM-cha was definitely super yum. Driving around looking for a late dinner we went on Yelp to find something yummy. Thank goodness we were able to try out Yum Cha! 

Quality food and quality customer service! Everyone was friendly and very attentive. Food was superb, we didn't leave a speck of food on our plates. My personal favorites were the crispy noodles with shrimp and custard bun for dessert! We will definitely be coming back in a few days before we head back on a roadtrip home! Going to grab some for take out too!

We just found a new favorite DimSum place. The reasons are as follow;

Pro:
- Greeted immediately 
- Great Service
- Explained each item on DimSum menu. Once we mentioned we eat seafood only, they suggested great options. 
- Food was freshly prepared. 
- Food quality is so great. Very tasty & definitely not greasy. 
- Good size on the Tofu Fa
- Very clean & well managed restrooms
- They have diaper changing table on both Ladies & Mens restrooms.
- First restrooms in chinese & asian restaurants I know that use a touchless soap dispensers

Con: Other than too greasy on fried items, & some stained on the chair, we almost couldn't find any negative side of them.

I am not a big fan of Cantonese dim sum, but this place surprised me. There is a bit of a wait, but definitely worth it. The quality of dim sum was far above average and service was unheard of at a dim sum restaurant. Our server came by and explained everything to us, all the fried stuff is made to order, so don't expect them to be in the carts. The price is decent, quite decent if you compare to California prices. Overall, a great place to spend a few hours while you are in Vegas. Sip on some tea and have a few har gows.

A bit pricey for the quality of food. We got takeout here one night on our trip, and while it came out pretty fast, people working there were somewhat snippy with my husband who went to go pick up the food. Whatever, it's a busy week with the holidays so can't imagine people working there are thrilled to be doing this, but besides this point, I thought the food wasn't all that impressive for $10 a bowl of noodles. We got the curry fish ball soup with flat rice noodles (good, but $10 is a little bit overkill for about 6 fish balls and pretty much just red curry soup), and wonton noodle soup (again, about $10 for around 5-6 dumplings with a pretty basic broth and some bok choy). In a part of town where you can get decent quality ramen for less than $10, this was kind of overkill. We also got the century egg / pork congee which was around $5 but pretty small for the price. Overall, a bit of a ripoff but it got the job done.

Just OK. To be fair, I went late on a Sunday (2p). Selection was limited and a bit cold even though it still came from a steam cart. Flavor and service was fine but the food was nothing special except for the Crispy Pork Belly which was very good. Still, there's much better around town. A little pricier than I expected as well.

Good service ... food is affordable (dim sum )
It's far from where we live but it's worth a drive
Place is clean.  Manager approached us and ask where we from thinking maybe we're from out of town when he found out that we are Local ask us how we found his restaurant I told him from yelp and it took us 30 minutes get here, he gave us free custard dessert as a token of appreciation.
I'm not a fan of noisy places and crowded restaurant, this place is defensively recommended for people who just want to enjoy their food...

Wow! It was really good, and probably my favorite meal of this trip. It definitely compares well to places I've been in San Francisco bay area. It's authentic, and served hot. The dim sum is served all day, a rarity in most restaurants. They have the dim sum on carts until 2 pm. Afterwards, you have to go to the counter and to pick from the cases. I liked that they weren't very high pressure or no attention while we were there. My friends and I got to sit back and enjoy our food and catch up. If I'm ever in Vegas again and craving dim sum, I would go here. Also, the price was very reasonable. For three people, we spent less than  $40.

Ok I read high ratings so we went for dim sum...I'm going to tell u the truth...worse dim sum ever. Had shrimp. ..mediocre.  had sticky buns...disgusting.  had fried shrimp won tons..so greasy popped in your mouth.blah.  no dipping sauces other than soy sauce and hot sauce.  The mgr is super nice..the servers very kind so I wish I could say it was good but it's not.  I'm starting to distrust yelp ratings.

As a tourist coming in for EDC weekend we needed something wholesome the next day to speed up our recovery from a long night of dancing. Walking into Yum Cha, the staff is very prompt in greeting us quickly and the restaurant is very spacious and roomy. 

We came in for the dim sum on a Sunday afternoon and there was no problem with getting seated. After 2:30pm dim sum items are not pushed around on a cart, rather they are made to order. From chicken feet, to shu mai, fried shrimp rolls, we piled up a total of about 20 dishes total costing us no more than about $80 in all. The portions were just perfect to share and all the dishes came out well presented and savory. 

Would definitely recommend for the awesome staff that checked in on us often and I promise you won't come for dim sum and leave hungry!

my parents and I decided to eat early lunch here. This used to be Fortune Restaurant located opposite International Market on Decatur.

They serves dimsum. The owner said it was the first day of opening and we are the 2nd customers. They only have few items of dimsum ready. The owner said it was their first day so taking a while. 

the dim sum was ok. All of the dimsum are $2.88 each which is pretty inexpensive. We had chicken feet, pepper stuff shrimp , pork ribs and shumai.

Everything we ordered are very flavorful. Everybody here were nice and tentative, not annoying or fake. They took their time to explain everything and how it works. I like it how they also have chicken siomay, we don't eat pork so its good to have other option.Their dimsum price are slightly higher on the weekend and holidays. They have a lady walking around pushing dimsum cart, she has all selections of steam ones but if you want any fried dimsum or veggie you can walk up to the counter to see their selections and order from there or order it from your server.

Good dimsum, clean. We'll be back!

Found the perfect Dum Sum spot in Vegas!!! FOOD was DELISH (super authentic HK style Din Sum) & CUSTOMER SERVICE was IMPECCABLE!!! Everyone serves w/ a smile on their face! We ordered the Lotus Sticky Rice w/o knowing that it contains shrimp (which one of our friend is allergic to), so we didn't end up touching it after we found out there's shrimp... We didn't bother telling the server as most Chinese places wouldn't care, but Lien (supervisor/manager?) was AWESOME!!! She asked us how everything was tasting & asked if we knew how to eat the Lotus Sticky Rice as we haven't touched it yet, so I told her we ordered it w/o knowing that it contained shrimp, so she was so kind to switch it out for us with something that had the same value... That was such an unexpected surprise that she would be proactive in taking care of us... We were SO APPRECIATIVE!!! We'll definitely come back again... Highly recommend this place!!! Thank you so much for your hospitality again Lien!!! :-)

Haven't been for Dim Sum in a while and before heading out the the usual Orchid ran a quick check on Yelp and found Ym Cha. Really glad I did. We did arrive right at opening and every Item we had tasted so fresh and well above any we have had in Las Vegas. Haven't had this good of Dim Sum since last in San Francisco. 
They have carts going around with the usual items and you can go up to the counter to order others. I do recommend doing that right away. One of the best things we had was the chive dumplings ordered at the counter. You don't have to wait they will bring you what you order. 

Service was great place was clean and food the best.
We really enjoyed our first dim sum restaurant! Food was great, we tried a variety of dishes and the service and pricing was perfect! Will go back again for sure!

I am still not sure what people expect for dim sum. I have been to several dim sum restaurants in San Francisco and the Bay Area (Yank Sing is awesome, even if overpriced), and Yum Cha meets and in some cases exceeds those places. Flavor, choices, prices... All on point. Will be back and anyone in the Las Vegas area, support this local gem!!
Best dim sum place in town.  This place has great food, great service and a lot of options to choose from.  Staff is friendly and conversational as well.

I'll start by saying that the service was great! Super friendly, attentive and kind which is rare at a Chinese restaurant. The dim sum in itself was okay. 

I like the idea of walking up to the counter to order your dim sum. It's definitely different from the authentic cart service but it allows you see everything they have to offer and not have to wait for the cart to reach you. However, their selections were very limited when we went on a weekday. Only half the display station was filled with dim sum options. They had your typical hargow, Shumai, sticky rice and chashu bau but not much more. Wish they had more items to try didn't feel like I got a real dim sum experience. Maybe it's better on the weekend? I don't know but what I did try was just okay. Definitely not the best I've had and just okay. Would I come back? Probably not. Would I recommend it? Probably not.

These are the best dumplings I've had hands down. They beat the pants  off what I ate in San Fran in China town. There was more mandarin being spoken inside than there was English. I would come back here without hesitation.

Outstanding service and the cleanliness of the restaurant adds to the experience of enjoyable dining of their dim sum, menu items, and specialized desserts! The dim sum is ALWAYS fresh, never left under a steamer and rolled around in carts for hours. Dim sum can be made to order as well which, personally, makes this restaurant UNIQUE. Restrooms are very sanitary and CLEAN! As a local for the last 25 years, and after trying many dim sum places, the staff here SMILE and are very attentive to customers. I appreciate that level of service:) Check them out....you'll be very happy.

This place was recommended to me by a foodie and I have to say I was extremely disappointed.  The quality of the food wasn't any better than an East Ocean.  There were only 2-3 carts with very limited variety with a lot of the popular items not available.  They probably had less than 1/3rd of their dimsum menu on the carts and a lot of those items were in very limited quantity.  And all of this was at 1230p and not that many people in the restaurant!!

The staff tried to help by bringing us requests but even there they overpromise and underdeliver.  10 minutes turns into 20 minutes for 1 plate of food.

I love this place. I'm always craving dim sum in the middle of the day, which is bad because dim sum carts are usually out only during prime lunch and dinner times. Yum Cha is great because even though they put away the carts during mid day you are able to go to the counter and order what you want. I also get wonderful customer service here! They are all so friendly and helpful giving suggestions about all the options to choose from. It is also cheaper Monday through Fridays, which is a plus. I will be coming back again for the great service.

When I arrived there was a full bus unloading and entering Yum Cha, I considered leaving due to the size of the crowd but I'm glad I didn't.

I was VERY impressed with Yum Cha's handling a large group as well as separate diners and a solo (myself).  The carts focused on the large group yet there were plenty of staff regularly checking with me and having my orders filled by the kitchen.  Very impressed with the service!!!

I usually avoid fried items, i.e. Salt & Pepper Calamari or Shirmp, as it can be cold and soggy sitting on a cart for a while - but Yum Cha will prepared these items to order so it's warm and crunchy!

Prices were good, food was good (but a tad bland).

5 stars for outstanding cordial & attentive service, -1 for a bit lacking in flavor = 4 stars.
This is the worst dim sum in Vegas. Don't go. I read all those good reviews and decided to skip my all time favorite Chang's restaurant and give it a try. Waste my $$$$ and time!

Was in Vegas for vacation and found this spot on yelp. Definitely hit the spot! Great food and even better service. Our waiter Yao was very friendly and was very diligent in checking on us and making sure  our drinks were always filled!
A nice spot for some traditional dim sum. Good selection, plates are well proportioned and atmosphere is good. A little old school looking but it's not too bad and the service is pretty good too.

I'm usually skeptical about going to dimsum places other than orchid gardens but this one was a lot close so why not try it. The place is clean, you can dine in or get items on the menu to go. They had a very friendly staff who pretty much catered to our needs and everything. Very affordable as well.

I'm from SF where I'm spoiled with great food... This was my first time having dim sum in Vegas. I'm definitely going back soon, the food was delicious and the staff was very nice  The place is new & clean & great for parties
Take our  was not good and was to expensive for the amount of  food that was given. Don't think I will try to eat inside either.

They had some delicious dinner sums. I love that you could pick what you want. The only thing I was not happy about was their soup. I felt like I didn't have enough broth and too much noodles. But overall, I was pretty happy with the food. You have to order their pork bun for sure!

When restaurants advertise a certain service or product, consumers will expect them to deliver. Yum Cha is advertised as an all day dim sum; however, this place did not fully live up to that. Many of the items were not available upon request and we were, instead, forcefully advised to try alternatives. Don't get me wrong, there's nothing bad about giving suggestions, just don't be pushy and annoying about it. 

There are definitely better dim sum options in town in comparison. We tried this place out because friends suggested it. They raved about the quality and price. We, on the other hand, did not have the same quality experience they had. Orchids Garden will be our go-to spot for quality dim sum the next time we need our cravings fulfilled!

Was in Vegas for my anniversary weekend when I came across this dim sum place. Came here for lunch before we left to go back home and we were not disappointed. I compare all my dim sum experiences to the dim sum back in NYC where I am from. The dim sum here is legit. Not only was the food good but the prices were decent and not ridiculous like San Diego dim sum prices. Staff was extremely friendly and attentive. My husband and I felt like we had every staff member there taking care of us lol. There are ladies pushing carts and you can order off a menu as well. The decor is meh but the food, price, and customer service was on point! I will definitely be back.
A good Cantonese operated Restaurant. Food is good and not expensive. A good place to go dinning in Vegas.

For dim sum in Vegas I was impressed.  It is most definitely close to the best that I have had here.  Usually, I would drive to LA and avoid Vegas dim sum...but now I know of a place that I like the quality if food in Vegas.  The service was so so, but the food was tasty!  I'll come back to eat!
Visiting Vegas and found this spot, so we had to check it out. Good Dim Sum at a good price. I'd definitely come back.
I love the shrimp rice noodle,the sanmai is so soft l like it too , and the price is good?but I don't like the pork rib ,

Very spacious inside.  I walked in at 3pm and virtually we were the only customers. Kind of scary feeling. I had to double check If I was in right place since it has 4 and a half stars. Well all the dim sum was stacked up unattractively on buffet line.  You pick what u want and they heat it up for you. You can also order off the menu as well. Servers are inexperienced and barely speaks English but nice. Manager speaks fluent English so you can communicate through him. Ok as far as food goes everything was average.

I can see why Yum Cha has more 5 Star rating than negative, we went there mainly based from review of other diners, so here's my 5 cents worth...
Came here on a Monday noon, as expected, they're not too busy, and was able to find sitting and order food right away. Food I'd give it an A, which I consider good, not exceptional but good. Service, like I said they're not too busy, but we got exceptional service and attention, so I'll give it an A+. I believe the owner himself attended to us and explain how their ordering system work, got everything we wanted in a timely manner. Price, another A+, since we came on a week day, the price is reduced, yes to that! Parking, none issue to us so another A+. I think they do need more honest customer to help them promote, since they are relative new and away from China town, the only way they get exposure is through Yelp. Over all, we're very satisfied and will come back again the next time we come to Las Vegas.
First time dining at Yum Cha.  Friendly and fast service.  My favorites were baked bbq pork buns and mushroom and pork shumai. Bright and spacious place.  Definitely will return when I want dim sum.
I come here at least twice a week because I'm obsessed with their steamed BBQ pork buns and steamed lava custard buns.

LV is not the place to visit for DimSum but see the sign!

Nice selection of dishes but a bit on the oily side. Fine wise staff. Decor uninspiring but not disagreeable.

Driving out of Vegas, we made a quick stop for dim sum.  The restaurant has many tables and there are a few carts, but the selection seemed a bit limited.

Here's my quick rundown:

Shumai - very standard.
Tripe - tender in slightly seasoned broth.  very standard
Yum Choy - chopped greens were cooked well and loaded with stalk and leaves.  Very good.
Pork ribs - cooked with chopped pumpkin.  Greasy & blah.  Not good.
Beef ribs - loaded with black pepper and also greasy but good flavor.
Tofu skin with pork mixture -  chewy and very tasteful sauce.  It was very good. 
Sesame balls - crunchy, chewy, and sweet bean filling was perfect.  Very good!

The service was quick and it only took about half hour to finish our meal.
Very affordable.
Loved how clean and shiny the place was.  Great food and great service.  We will be back.

Average dim sum in Las Vegas, but for the price you can't really complain. And what's nice about this place is that if you're craving dim sum, they serve it all day! That's a first, well, for me at least. 

Nothing really stood out but they were all good enough to satisfy my hungry belly. They had all the typical dishes like har gow, chicken feet, and siu mai. Service is fine, nothing special. The restaurant is a asian looking for sure and very casual. No tablecloths, just a table, chairs, and a turn table. Pricing for the weekday and weekend different with the weekend prices being about $0.50 more for the dim sum. Cash only.

If you want some quality dim sum you're probably better off paying a little more to get that in the casinos. I prefer to go to the one in Rio. Though getting dim sum more off the strip is always easier.

HANDS DOWN THE BEST DIM SUM IN VEGAS!!!!  My partner and I ate here last week while waiting for our son to finish rugby practice.  Out of all the dim sum restaurants we've dined at, this place is the best.  The service was great.  Our server made the best recommendations on the menu, and they really tasted good.  It was like talking to an auntie made something special in the kitchen for you.  Roti with curry soup, and the Bo Lo Bao are a must have if you go.

Our favorite place for dim sum. We're from Oklahoma and every time we visit family in Vegas, we come here and order AT LEAST 10 orders/plates of the ha cheung fun (shrimp noodle rolls) and 2 beef cheung fun with EXTRA SAUCE. Everything is great, but the cheung fun is our absolute favorites! The owner is also great, she remembers us when we come! Definitely one of the best places for dim sum, available all day long.
Love the food.  The owners are super friendly.  I feel good when I eat there, because they put their heart into the business.
The food if it ever arrives is good. Maybe because they are new, they don't have their act together. For dinner they don't use the carts. I will come back maybe for lunch. We'll see.

There was 5 of us, 3 adults and 2 kids. Wanted to give this place a try, and it was a regret.

Price:
We ordered just about the normal amount we do for dim sum at any other dim sum restaurant. But our bill came out DOUBLE what we usually would pay, averaging $4.25 per item. That is expensive!

Taste:
As mentioned earlier, we ordered the items we normally do from other places. Steam Pork Ribs (???) was tough and lack flavor. Fried Taro Dumpling (???)didn't have flavor and was extremely greasy. Curry Fish ball (????) was frozen fish ball in curry paste soup, not chewy like it should be. Beef Stew (??) was flavorless as well. Ovetall, it was a great disappointment.

Atmosphere:
The restaurant was a bit dim, but acceptable. Unfortunately, there is very little ventilation, the front door was kept open, no A/C which means summer will be horrible inside there. Lastly, many flies inside, a few kept going around our food.

Husband said, this will be out first and last time here.

Price for value was bad, price for quality was also bad.
Decent place for dim sum. Stick with dim sum items. The noodles did not impress. Prices are reasonable.

I had read about Yum Cha from an article on Las Vegas Eater on facebook so decided to look up Yelp reviews. I'm always on the look out for new dimsum restaurants to try that are comparable to Hong Kong style dim sum. Our usual spot is KJ Dim Sum but service can be hit or miss and we didn't feel like going to a casino. From the minute we walked in to the minute we left Yum Cha service was very inviting and friendly. Every worker smiled, they all spoke very well english, very friendly and just made our experience comfortable. We came in around 2:30pm for a late lunch and learned that carts stop coming around the tables after 2pm due to its generally their slow time. They move all the dim sum to behind the glass counter where you pick what you want or you can simply tell the server what dishes you want and they'll bring it to your table. Our tea and water was refilled constantly. My husband and I especially enjoyed the shrimp stuffed eggplant here! Shumai, har gau, char siu bao and lotus sticky rice were all tasty. We'll definitely be back. Would like to try some of their non-dim sum dishes.
Finally a really good dim sum place in Las Vegas. I'm super picky when it comes to dim sum because my family used to own a dim sum restaurant in Cali.  Very kind service and I like the variety!
Here for a visit in Las Vegas. Dropped by to eat lunch. Excellent service. New restaurant. Clean. Good taste. Hope to keep the same standard. Highly recommend.

Everything we had for dim sum was delicious! The chow mien was seasoned perfectly. The best was getting the warm custard buns at the end where the custard oozed out as you break it open. Yum!!! Service was great too! Super nice staff and owner. I would definitely come here again the next time I visit!
The new Dom sum place introduced by my handyman. Foods are awesome. Usually dim sum can be a bit oversteamed and greasy but not the ones here.

Came here last night Friday and was quite surprised at 6PM that a good 80% of the restaurant was empty.  I know not the main dinner rush hour but still...

This is a sit down style dim sum although the rolling carts are only until 2:30PM unlike two others in town but exactly like 1 place on the westside that is full day non cart rollout.  The staff is extremely friendly and helpful with the menu items and even some of the unadvertised off menu items such as Chinese broccoli and black tea.  The menu is American broccoli.  The prices are about average although different costs for week and weekend meals.  

This works for families and even individuals looking for a good place to eat where you can bring a large group or a quiet intimate date with a loved one.

Been here many many times but just leaving a review. Reason being is they have been CONSISTENTLY good (food quality AND service) from the FIRST time to THIS time.

Cleanliness is also important to me too and they are clean here. Their tables are always wiped down, pre-bussed, and NEVER nasty or sticky!

Its a PERFECT place to get your general YumCha fix!!

Wow i was skeptical about this place because the dim sum joint in this build ing before had a rude ass bitch with no customer service talking to us like we stupid!!!  But OMG!!!  This place is comparable to my usual Ping Pang Pongs And Orchid Gardens!!! Absolute redemption from the previous joint. This place is legit as a mofo!!!

Unbelievable food... everything was so FRESH...  We were nervous because we caught them on a slow night, but that worry was erased.  Never had bok chok taste so good- steamed with some sort of garlic.  Dim sum was great.  Made to order shumai took a bit to make but well worth the wait.  Best black pepper sauce I've ever had.  Super-friendly gentleman made us feel right at home.  Very highly recommend!

was craving dim sum and saw reviews on Yelp and thought to try it out. the dim sum is yummy as well as the main dishes - all very flavorful. they even have taro cake (you can't taste the sweetness) on the weekends. the staff is very friendly and truly appreciates their customers. very spacious interior. there's lunch special dim sum on the weekdays everything $2.89 except the rice noodle roll (cheung fun). we will be back again to try different things. oh and the coconut bun pastry item is phenomenal!

Service is good.  Food is ok if you order dim sum and not a la carte. We ordered a beef noodle soup and the broth was way too sweet to our taste.  They put way too much msg in the soup and I felt sick afterwards.

We ordered calamare covered in mounts of eggbatter and with minuscule pieces of calamare inside. We ordered beef ribs soaking in oil. We ordered the fish of the day which was again soaking in oil. Very bad experience for $40. Defenitely the very worst Chinese meal ever and I had a lot of Chinese food in many countries of the world. This is not Asian Food Truck food at all. Chef needs retraining. Also we came for Hot Pot, advertised in big letters on the sign above the entrance but it was not ava

Sadly, Vegas isn't known for the best Chinese food and that includes dim sum. However, Yum Cha will suffice as adequate to satisfy your dim sum craving. It doesn't have the large dining rooms that I have been accustomed to in California, but there isn't much of a wait here either. Like traditional dim sum spots, you can order some larger plates off the menu while you peruse the selection from the carts being pushed around.

There are a few dim sum dishes that I thought were decent enough to come back for and others that I would avoid. I enjoyed the siu mai and the glutinous rice dumplings (filled with pork). The shrimp noodle rolls were also really good. However, the shrimp dumplings and soup dumplings were poorly made and quickly fell apart. In fact, xiao long baos were so dry that there was no soup inside. Of the large plates, we tried the beef chow fun, which was well received. 

The prices are decent and the service was pretty fast after we were seated. Prices are about 50 cents cheaper if you go on a weekday versus the weekend.
Friendly service and food was okay. I was very disappointed in the shrimp noodle rolls, they were not good.

This was our first dim sum dinner in Las Vegas....it was absolutely fantastic!  We're originally from the Bay Area and this place rivals some of the best Chinese restaurants there!  Everything was fresh and flavorful!  The prices are reasonable and the service was A1.  We highly recommend this place!

At first glance, you see the fast food takeout style buffet but the food was very good. They ended up having dim sum carts going around but some items you order at the buffet serving area. Once you order, they will cook your food and bring it to your table.

Some of the flavorful dishes we got was a Malaysian Chinese dishes and it was amazing. 
I loved the pancake with curry dipping sauce. It's a must!!
Defiantly going to come back again!!
Terrible taste and bad service! It's not worth to visit. Maybe worth to visit only one time to take a photo
Good food, great service when the manager/owner is helping. Much better than other dimsum places we've been to.

yum cha is a game changer. from food quality to service, let me tell you why..

I absolutely love har gow and shu mai. when I was a little duckling, I would get dim sum with my mom and they were our signature go-to choices. yum cha has the freshest selection of dim sum I've ever seen. the walk up hot bar is great because you can ask for what you want, they make it there for you and even deliver it to your table!

I'm a Chinese/Vietnamese descendant and I know how difficult it is to cross language barriers and we have our own way of doing things amongst other cultures. the effort that the staff and owners put in to communicate and communicate well with you is a huge plus. they check up on you to make sure everything is okay, and even make great suggestions. this is something I wholeheartedly appreciated and make the experience better. 

egg custard desserts won me ten fold. reasonable prices and superb quality. get some.

This is one of the better places for Dim Sum in LV. They serve it all day, as well. The food is great. I haven't tried their regular entrees, yet. Until I do, I'll keep this review at 4 stars. They have a lot of diversity in choice of foods. The price is a plus, as well. The service is fine. When dining dim-sum style, there's not much "interaction" between server and diner. Hence, why I'll wait until I try their main menu.

Pure mierda. Service decor everything. Used to be somewhat good, but now is terrible. Food is subpar in terms of preparation and execution. Service subpar even by fob standards. Will not be tipping. Probably going to be a while before I come back.

We should have known better coming from San Gabriel Valley (home of some of the best Dim Sum in the Western USA) than to go eat Dim Sum in Las Vegas... 

We walked in and the staff were very welcoming and kind to us. 

They offer Dim Sum (all day) along with their full dining menu. Please keep in mind this review is ONLY for the DIM SUM. 

We ordered Pork ShuMai, Har Gow, chicken feet and Pork ribs... All of these dishes were Dim Sum A at $3.58/each

The Shiu Mai looked like frozen prepackaged although the flavor was not so off. There were tiny little pieces of shrimp. 

The proportions of wheat and shrimp in the Har Gow were a bit off, you could taste the dough more than the overall flavor.  

The chicken feet were tasty. The sauce was a bit too thick and there were only three as supposed to the five that you normally get in most Dim Sum places. 

The worst were the Spared pork ribs. It tasted like old meat, or they used expired oil. Too much fat and not enough meat on the ribs.

I wouldn't come back.
Cheers!

This is the third time me and my friends have eaten here. Food is always good, fresh and yummy.  Elaine the hostess is very nice and accomodating. I would strongly recommend this restaurant to all my family and friends.

The worst service I've ever experienced at any restaurant.  Ever. 

These cart ladies need to rework their route schedule because we had absolutely no service whatsoever and whenever we asked for some service the server would say the carts are coming.  40 minutes after having no carts come to our table, we decided to leave. 

Don't go here.

(Update: I saw that I had this draft and decided to post this today since we were just talking about that time we had horrible Dim Sum service at this place in Vegas...and now I'm seeing that the business has closed.  Go fig.)
Service very good.They take care customers.Food it's super delicious like I go back to Asia.Restaurant's clean.Everything Awesome

Food is just average, service is very limited.  The pushcart ladies are quick to come around and ask if want anything, but the waitstaff does not come around often, not even to take away empty plates.

My mom and I enjoy Dim Sum and we stopped by for lunch. The spot was new to us and we wanted to try a new place. It was great! The staff was friendly and helpful, the restaurant was nice, the food was great, and the prices were a bargain! We can't wait to come back and bring some friends.

Not really my cup of tea (Dimsum) but this place is very good. The Soups are spectacular and I am not much of a soup guy. The GF loved fried eggplant (or whatever it was) I did not like the looks of it. place sort of reminded of the dinner at the palace in the Temple Of Doom movie, but not eyeballs in my soup which was fortunate. No too sure of the prices here either not expensive, not cheap.

Service was so frustratingly bad here!

First of all, they were out of half the things we were trying to order. Then, they messed up our orders several times. They kept trying to give us other people's dishes and not bringing us ours. We also had to keep asking about our dishes because nothing was coming out. 

When we asked about dishes that didn't come after over an hour, we were told that they ran out already.  No one communicated this to us. Then, we saw people coming out of the kitchen with the dishes that they allegedly ran out of! Unbelievable.

In all fairness, the food was quite good. However, the absolutely atrocious service made this experience intolerable.

Mediocre dim sum. Food is prepared fine just lacking flavor. 

There are better places to eat.

Best Dim Sum in Las Vegas! Good customer service :)  The lady was very nice! The shu mai and shrimp is very good. The egg drop soup with sweet corn and chicken is the best I've ever had. I'd return back here for sure! 
Lunch is 10:30 to 2:00 so if you come later you have to look at the food through the glass, but don't worry they will steam it for you :)

What a disaster this place was! The wait time was about 15 mins at 12:30. When we were seated there was no available wait staff to take our order. We were lucky that a solitary cart with a few items came around after about 10 mins. The servers were walking by but no-one stopped and said anything. We finally had to ask someone for assistance or we would not have been served. The dim sum was okay, nothing special.. We had the usual sui mai, shrimp dumplings, pork ribs, pork buns..We will not be in a hurry to fo back.
Not crowded.  Has all the mandatory Dim Sum dishes.  Fast service.  CLEAN!

The dim sum here is one of the best I've had. Fresh selections and most items are made to order. I especially loved the pork ribs and calamari. They have great service! The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. Definitely coming back to try their dinner.

So the food here is pretty good, especially since they are usually making all your food fresh... 

The only downside to this is I feel like you're not getting the full dim sum experience... Make sure you order all your food at once because if there's more than five groups in the room with you it takes forever..

But like I said, food is really good. Lots of flavor.

Yum Cha has yummy variety, cleanliness, and friendly service.  What more could you ask for?  This is a new "must stop" each time we visit our son and mother in Vegas.  It will be yours once you try it!!!

Really good service. The tables were getting cleaned so fast, water glasses were getting filled and tea was always hot. Dim sum was really good, we wished we had known about ordering at the kitchen counter.  Otherwise great experience would highly recommend going there.

I absolutely love this place! You can get dim sum for dinner!!! After craving dim sum for quite sometime I decided to try this place out, and I am not disappointed at all. The set up for dim sum was not the usual cart going around; the servers bring you what you pick on their menu. The menu had pictures for all the food and it was so easy to read! I really enjoyed how they set up their menu and the food was delicious. I really want to go back soon.

We decided to try this dim sum place after seeing so many reviews. You can get dim sum from carts as well as order from the picture menu. I must say that their picture menu is helpful especially if you're a first timer. 

We walked in little before their opening time at 10:30am but one of the staff sat us right away. The staff are really nice. Our tea pot was checked few times so we enjoyed many cups of hot tea. 

If you dine here, I would stick with steamed dim sum. One of our non-steamed dish that we ordered didn't seemed like it was made same day. That's why I could only give 3 stars.
