First time here and I will gladly give this place 5 stars!! The service is very good in comparison to the dim sum restaurants I've been to in china town! It is very clean, GREAT ventilation (trust me.. some restaurants in Vegas... I can see what I'm breathing in)attentive service from ALL servers, food is decently priced, and food is tasty! I'd recommend this to anybody lookin for some dim sum
Best Chinese food outside of NYC and San Francisco...Clean dinning room and restrooms... Great service...

For the high reviews I was expecting better out of this place. 

Food 2/5

The basics were decent but nothing was done to the point where I was actually impressed. What really pushed me down to two stars for this place was the veggie dish we got which was suppose to be boiled gailan but it was ridiculously oily to the point where it was barely edible. In addition, their special bun with salted egg was so doughy and raw towards the bottom it just wasn't that great. 

Service 4/5

The service here was pretty fast and everyone was very accommodating to what we needed. 

Overall we spent around $70 for four people. I think since this place does all day dim sum, it's good if you're craving some har gow at night, but if you're looking for a Sunday morning dim sum place I think there are better places to go.
Pleasantly surprised at this place, always like to seek out local fares. This is by far the best food since I've been to Vegas yesterday. Decor: bird cages, tv previewing salivating food.
Service was fast and friendly, food price was reasonable, dim sum came out in a timely manner- and tastes great.

Here is my verdict. Overpriced. Food=GROSS

Total disappointment. FOOD-GROSS

Don't mind the price for good food. Never again here. Food-GROSS

Came here after yelping. 
4stars yelpers- epic fail. Food-GROSS

My family and I love this place. They don't have people
Pushing around dimsum carts all day long but you still get the same experience since you get a menu filled with the cart items and just order from there. Everything ice tried here so far tastes great and the staff are very friendly. It's a nice change of scenery compared to all of the other dimsum places around town. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone needing a dimsum fix.
Not as good as I expected. Slow service, don't have many selections of foods. Foods were not as goods compare to other places. Taking too long to order. Will not come back again.

Dim sum was very average nothing special! resturant is very unorganized.  Only 2 dim sum cart with the same exact things on it. Service was also average.  I don't know if I will make another visit here.

My husband and I are from New York and so we are spoiled with good quality dim sum. Been searching for a while for a good go-to dim sum place since moving to Las Vegas and unfortunately have been to several bad ones... Until Yelp helped us find Yum Cha. Apparently fairly new but solid quality dim sum (up to par with NY, even the in-laws approved). More casual appearing than traditional dim sum restaurants, although they have the typical carts as well as a counter to order from. Food was fresh and did not disappoint. Best baked pork buns I have ever had (and I'm Filipino so I know my buns). Service was better than most, very attentive. Will definitely be back.
Pretty good variety. Nice to see a new dim sum place. Very good rice wrapped in lotus leafs. Awesome tofu wraps. No pokestops in the parking lot but the food makes up for it.

Very clean, friendly service staff. Some items were blank like spinach stuff with shrimp. Shrimp noodle noodle and shrimp Hai how. Spare  ribs I has flavor Shu mai.  Fried fish ball tasty. Shrimp egg plant good.  Not a lot of selection like orchid garden.  My opinion only.
we have had dim sum at several places in Las Vegas, and this is, by far, the best place by far. great food great service and great environment.

We stayed in the Las Vegas are for a week around the Thanksgiving holiday.  Tried a few Chinese restaurants in the Chinatown area, and they were all pretty bad.

We met up with a local who recommended Yum Cha for dinner.  We ordered from the Dim Sum menu and every dish was amazing.  

We ordered family style, where everyone orders a dish and each dish shared by all.  There were about 8 of us, so we ordered plenty of food, and there wasn't a bad dish to be had.

When we were here, it wasn't very crowded, and the owner served our table.  She was quite pleasant and offered a some recommendations which we ordered.  She even brought a dish or two that were comped.  

I was surprised to see such poor reviews for the dim sum at this restaurant, but I think I understand; those reviews must be referring to the dim sum lunches, where the carts are wheeled from table to table.   Our experience with the dim sum was quite different.  We ordered them for dinner and they were coming straight from the kitchen and hadn't been sitting on the cart for who knows how long.

If you love Dim Sum, I would highly recommend this place, BUT, maybe (based on reviews), coming during their dim sum lunch offering may not be the best way to enjoy this restaurant.

I really wanted to like this place, but I couldn't. The Dim Sum definitely leaves something to be desired. I'm native to the Bay Area, so it's difficult to compare, but this was just an average place and there are plenty of better places to eat in LV.

The food doesn't come out hot (at least the time we went there). They told us, the  dim sum is cold because that's how white people like it. Example, friend shrimp wasn't hot when it came out.

The pieces are smaller than I am used to. That didn't matter because the dim sum didn't really taste that good. We ordered shrimp, pork, chicken feet, pig stomach, sticky rice (my wife said it was the worst she ever tasted). The pig stomach had good flavor and the best dish was the beef stew.

Also, the pricing isn't quite clear. We went to this place as a result of a newspaper ad and the prices looked pretty darn cheap $2.99. Note, not everything is that price and the tiers are a little different than I am used to. Some dishes that should be the A category aren't.

All in all, we were fed. I don't think anyone got sick in our party, but this place leaves something to be desired.

This place is AWESOME !! Moving from LA it was hard for me to find a good spot since I've been going to the same ones all my life. BUT. Thankfully that has changed. The service here is so good! All the servers help out so someone's always checking on you ! Great prices of course ! Dim sum is always good priced. I personally don't eat meat so shrimp items are also generally sold out all the time but YUM CHA had everything I ordered! Soooo good we ordered more to go. Love this place ! Will be coming back here (:!

I arrived LV for vacation n had my first chinese dinner at Yum Cha. I was recommended and so gave it a try. Clean n cosy environment. Salty fish chicken rice, fish ball were delicious. Fillet wz corn sauce n Malaysian fat rice noodles were also nicely done. Last but not least dessert mango pudding n coconut pudding gave a lovely sweet ending to my dinner...
Very nice place, friendly staff, reasonable price and good quality food. Their manager is a very nice friendly person. Their egg tarts are one of the best in Vegas.

Super friendly staff, greeted us right away. It's Sat 1230pm, seated us right away. Gave us water and even kids cup and kids utensils without prompting from us. That shows the staff pays attention. Tables were cleaned promptly and frequently offered for more dim sum plates.

On to the food, I'm normally not picky so probably won't get a good opinion on it.

Usual dim sum items were up to par on the taste. I had to order from the menu as some items weren't in the carts. All were not too bad.

There's also some other items at the bar area and boba I believe.

I'd return as the location has plenty of parking and close to my house.

I haven't had dim sum in a while, so I was hoping for good things out of this newer spot. I wasn't disappointed.

Yum Cha is a dim sum restaurant located in the Walgreens plaza at the southwest corner of Tropicana and Decatur. Its name is literally the term for eating dim sum, but they do have a menu of other items which my group (Stefany V., Bethany E., and other friends) ignored while we had our Sunday "brunch" (boozeless as it was).

There is also a picture menu of the various dim sum items, which is helpful not just to non-Chinese speakers, but also for just seeing the entire breadth of the selection that this place serves. Regular items are $2.88 on weekdays and $3.28 on weekend/holidays, and they appear to be available from carts that circle the spacious room. Other typical dim sum items are priced in the $3.98-$5.98 range, and these were actually cooked in the kitchen to-order.

Needless to say, I tried quite an array of items. My favorite were as follows:

Taro Dumpling ($3.98) - one of my favorites to order anywhere, a pork-filled taro treat with a crispy exterior that wasn't as greasy as expected.

Shrimp Rice Noodle ($3.98) - shrimp and rice wrapper both were cooked right, and it just hit the spot.

Chicken Feet ($3.28) - a fall-apart treat marinated in a nice sauce, not too try and with a gelatinous texture. As always, this is simply fun to eat, even with the multitude of bones.

Shrimp & Pork Shumai ($3.28) - ground meat in a wrapper, and one of the most flavorful renditions that I've had in a while.

Radish Cake ($3.98) - a surprisingly crispy version, perhaps because it was cooked fresh instead of being carted around in a container and losing the subtle crunch due to steam. Didn't even need soy sauce on this.

Bake Lava Custard Bun ($3.98) - they didn't have egg tarts available for some reason, but this was a great alternative. Another nice exterior, moist yet cooked sweet dough, and a sweet interior that's smooth but not silky - by that, I mean that there's a bit of texture, but nothing off-putting. It wasn't served hot though, so the interior didn't really flow.

-----

I was pretty happy with the other items too, including Har Gow ("Shrimp Dumpling"), Steam BBQ Pork Bun, Beef (meat)Ball, Steam Pork Ribs, Beef Tripe, Veggie Egg Noodle, and Salt & Pepper Calamari. I should note that the Xiao Long Bao was enjoyable, but it clearly does not meet the expectation of a soupy dumpling; I could tell despite not having much if any experience with this much sought-after speciality.

I will definitely return to Yum Cha some time to yum cha. The offerings here are reasonably priced, generally delicious and among the best that I've tried in this town's not-particularly-known-for-dim-sum scene. I wasn't completely blown away by most of the items, but I wasn't outright disappointed by anything as I have been at other places. I definitely missed out on trying some items, and I will have to rectify that issue in the future.
Very good selection of dim sum but a little different from your usual dim sum spot. Friendly staff and very big venue.

Delicious dim sum! I think this place is more busy during lunch, we went here for dinner but is was great! It's a new place in town, clean and typical open Chinese setup with large tables and a buffet area for the lunch. We ordered several dim sum dishes to try out for dinner and we're full when we left. All the dim sum was made to order, authentic and fresh. I'm only on town for a while but thinking about going back here.

First time here, we had 2 different kind of sticky rice with leaf, we love them! Delicious bbq pork bun, custard bun and Roti with curry..reasonable price and friendly customer service.. Dim Sum is available day and night till 10:30pm!

Not only was the selection limited and the food wasn't that great, but the owner tried to tack on an extra $30 to our bill. He tried adding double on a few things we ordered and knew exactly what he was doing. I called him out on it and he deleted it. Be careful if you ever eat here. Check your bill!!! These people will try to rob you blind!
Food was bad. Not sure why others rank this restaurant so high. Don't waste your money there. It is expensive and food is really bad.
came here for lunch after searching for a dim sum place, and it wasnt that busy...good food & attentive service;  the staff were very nice and friendly... definitely worth tryin!

"I think I have an abusive relationship with Dim Sum." These were my boyfriends words after we experienced the superb service at Yum Cha. 

We were instantly greeted with smiles and an explanation of  how everything worked. They even had a selection of hot teas we could choose from: oolong, jasmine, and another one I didn't quite catch the name of. 

Normally service is terrible but here, it's different. During our dining experience three different people asked if we needed anything, kept our waters filled, and no attitude was given. 

The setup of this dim sum establishment was a lot different than anything I've seen either. Carts still came around with the steamed goodies but their fried items were set up along a cafeteria window. They displayed the items along the window and then they bring it over to your table.

Overall, the quality of food was good. Not the best but good. I think as soon as they start picking up customers and pump out fresh dim sum the quality will get better. Otherwise, I'd come back because the staff is attentive and friendly, there's no 20 minute wait, and it satisfied my dim sum craving.
This is the best dim sum I've had in Vegas, and the service is really good for a Chinese restaurant. I also love how they have Roti Canai.

My boyfriend an I found this place maybe a month after it opened last year, and hands down it is our top spots for yum cha in the southwest. The food is fresh, the noodles just melt in your mouth and they have the most delectable fish balls I've ever had. SUPER SUPER FRESH!! the owner is a sweetheart and the staff is very attentive and helpful. Location is great, close the the strip and there's plenty of room for large groups to enjoy this great food together. If in town definetly come through and give your taste buds a treat!
I tried the kung pao style squid and I really liked it. I also recommend the egg tarts and custard buns!!!
Great Dim Sum. Everything is fresh and was cooked to order. Staff was friendly as well. Will comeback for sure!

I dinned at  this restaurant after looking it up on Google of one of the better dim sum eats in Las Vegas. About a 10 minute Lyft ride from the strip,  The place was nice and clean with an open area for the carts to be pushed around.  There were three people pushing carts around with variety of small plates steamed only however. With the exception of one person pushing a cart with an attitude,  the staff was friendly and accomadating. The food was good I would say a little above average versus most dim sum place. Most of the dishes tasted fresh and we even order some stuff off the menu which arrived fairly quickly. Lots of Asian patrons here that usually mean is a good place for Asian food. Price was very reasonable and I would definitely recommend this place to a friend.

We went there last weekend October 6-9, we got an order of dan tat (egg custard) bolo bao (pineapple bun) and guy me bao (coconut bun) to go. It was real fresh and still warm. I will definitely eat in next time I'm in Vegas..

Outside of the Chinese New Year Dim Sum Buffet at Wing Lei, this is my favorite dim sum spot in Las Vegas.  We came with out of town guests, who also enjoyed it as well.  Decor is very plain and simple. The food is solid, unlike most of the other dim sum places in LV, sans the crazy wait times and bad service you'll find at Ping Pang Pong.  It's my ideal choice, with plenty of easy free parking to boot.  

We arrived on Easter Sunday at 11:45, as a party of six, and were seated immediately.  Tried getting reservations, but was told by the restaurant that they don't take reservations for seating on weekends or holidays.  

All the dim sum was on point, and being a party of six, we tried a good amount of items.  Not spectacular, but certainly up to par.  All dishes came out hot, with the exception of the chicken feet.  

My favorite here is the pineapple bun (their version of the ngai wong bau). If you like runny, oozing yolks you'll love these.  But beware, I mean runny!  When you split these buns open, your fingers will be drenched from the orange liquid yolk-like center pouring out...and, you will love it!  The dough of these buns are worth all the carbs. However, note that this is somewhat of an acquired taste.  I once shared my love of these with a friend, and we'll just say it's definitely not something she'd ever order again.  For me, and my traditional Cantonese-food loving friends though, we really loved it! 

Keep in mind that the pushcarts stop coming by at around 2pm.  After that, you can order off the menu, but for me, that just isn't as fun as seeing and selecting what you want.

 As Hubby always says, "If it's Sunday, it must be Dim Sum Day", and whenever we're in LV on Sundays, we happily often end up here!

I cannot even begin to describe how wonderful our dinner was tonight.  I really wish I would've worn my stretchy pants!  The 2 of us ordered 7 items, and we are absolutely stuffed.   My favorites have to be the pig ear, choy sum & crispy pork belly.  (I was shocked that my American husband enjoyed the flavor of the pig ear so much, but he devoured it!) I wish we were staying in town longer so we could come back and enjoy some of the other items on the menu.   A few honorable mentions: beef balls, pork & shrimp shumai & one of the best steamed bbq pork buns I've ever had!

My parents and I went here for dinner. We've been here before when it was another dim sum place. I definitely like yum cha better!   

What I love this place is that they serve dim sum for dinner.   They have a lot of different selections. It's a Chinese Malaysian fusion. They have an amazing Roti that comes with this amazing curry. I ordered three orders!  Another delicious find is their yam puff.  

The manager Eileen is also very nice. She showed us different things we could try and always checked up on us.  I will definitely come back :)

*disclaimer - I'm white and love Dim Sum but rely on my chinese speaking aunt to order for me when we go to Ping Pang Pong since I never know what cart has what! The only reason I went here instead of there was that they had a menu with descriptions AND pictures so I knew what I was ordering! =) 

This place was great! Went on a Friday night and there was only one other group in the whole restaurant. (I thought maybe they weren't open? But apparently they are much busier for breakfast/lunch) The majority of the dim sum items were $2.98 tues-friday, can't beat that! There were a few other seafood choices that were in the $4-8 range as well. We ordered 4 items to share (usually 2-3 pieces per plate) and our total was $15! Awesome! Got the sweet pork BBQ buns, chicken buns, red bean sesame balls and pot stickers. All were delicious. The service was great, we got our food quickly, it was fresh made, steaming hot and delicious! The manager(?) Elaine came over and talked with us, she was so nice! She told us all about dim sum and how their food compares to the other places, and why they don't have carts 24-7 (because the food temp doesn't stay hot enough and it isn't fresh after awhile so they only do the carts during the peak hours when they are busy). Any other time it's made to order. They were super concerned with freshness and quality in their food. You can see the whole prep line and everything is super clean (no hidden kitchen). The restaurants is huge and kind of looks like a mall food court but food was delicious, and cheap, and service was fast and excellent. Totally will go back!
The environment is clean. Service is good. Foods better than some dim sum restaurant . Haha..Good choice for short Lunch time~~!

I've been wanting to try Yum Cha for some time, and I'm so happy I did! 
SOOO much dim sum to try, the stand out was the beef ball. Super smooth, and the addition of worchestishire sauce was perfect. 

Staff very kind and attentive, they were genuinely happy for me to try their food. They have every right to be proud, they are excellent.

No need for Chinatown for dim sum, ever again!

Oh happy day!!! I FINALLY found a delicious dim sum restaurant here in Las Vegas...where to begin on all this food happiness?

Located on South Decatur (South West part of Vegas) This place is easy to get to from I215 or Decatur.   

Inside the place is huge, lots of seating including booths AND large round tables. 

Side note***they're getting set up to have a Cafe which will soon be open for business (if you like bubble tea, boba tea etc.) additionally, they're waiting on a liquor license so stay tuned for being able to order wine, beer  and other adult beverages!!!

Ambiance: totally chill so no need to dress up, this place is casual all the way. 

Service: EXCELLENT!!! Our order was taken promptly, our drinks were always full and any time we looked like we wanted to order more dim sum, our server was there. Very nice, professional and absolutely spot on with our orders. 

Food: absolutely delicious! We ordered three kinds of dumplings, spiced sticky rice  wrapped in leaf , spare ribs, chicken feet, fried pork belly, bok choy, sesame and red bean rice balls. That's just 1/4 of what the menu has to offer. 

Price: all that food ^---- was literally less than $40 and it fed two people. So yes, this place rocks my socks off...yes YOU should come here and try the dim sum (they have a Chinese food menu too if you want that) and yes you had better bring your appetite!!!   

Cheers!
All the food was delicious the sesame chicken, shrimp wonton ,chive dumpling ,BBQ pork pastry ,the gyoza. The service was great. Great recommendations

My husband and I were in LV from Chicago, and we checked out Yum Cha for dim sum with my in-laws.  We had tried some other places recommended by locals, but this place was by far the best.   We arrived early, and the selection was fresh and in abundance.   Not only can you pick from the carts but there's an entire hot station where you can get fresh buns, congee, veggies, and hot lo bak go.   

I felt out of all the other places we tried this one had one of the better selections of items.  I've had A LOT of dim sum, and was very happy with this place.  The roasted pork buns were especially yummy- always hot, soft, with some sweetness.  If you enjoy traditional dim sum this is the place to go.  It's about 2 miles off The Strip, making it super convenient to get to.  (We stayed at Luxor and it literally was a 10 minute drive.). It's definitely worth the trip.

In the search for great Dim Sum and good Chinese Food, one must journey and navigate an ocean of many Chinese places, and accept the fact that there is only an occasional "island" or "harbor" in this sea, that will be worth the journey.

Unfortunatley, Yum Cha is not worth the time or money on this journey. 

The Dim Sum, though freshly steamed, for the most part lacks flavor and distinct spices that make for an epicurrian delight. If you have eaten Dim Sum at The Orchid Garden, Yum Cha will be a major disappointment. 

Not able to find satisfaction with the Dim Sum, we ordered the "old standard" of Kung Pao Chicken. Though the pieces of chicken were of decent size and quality, the over meal had a sweet taste to it, and seriously lacked peppers and onions that give it a crunchy and distinctive flavor.

Good Chinese food in Las Vegas is very difficult to find. We owed it to our Yelp friends to try something new and hopefully found a tasty discovery to share with all.  Our disappointment is your gain. Strongly suggest you don't waste your time or dinning money on this place.

If you are a big fan of Dim Sum, put up with the crowds at Orchid Garden. Yum Cha wasn't crowded, Orchid Garden is almost always crowded. There's a reason for this contrast.

The taste of the Dim Sum.

Located at an old low budget Chinese buffet in a busy plaza we visited this place because we were referred to by a mutual friend. We went on a rainy Sunday around around 5pm. Was a bit dead and there were no carts of food anywhere to be seen. Thankfully we were able to order a la carte each dim sum item on the menu anytime. The service was very on point. 

We ordered the usual dim sum items such as shu mai, har gow, fried shrimp ball, Chinese bok choy, and shrimp in flat rice noodle. They were all tasty and came hot and steaming as if they were on the usual food cart. But these are made to order rather than batched prior to the usual dim sum hours. Never been to a place that will make your dim sum choices made to order. This was a definite plus.

Afterwards, we were all so full and the lady came up and gave us information on their hot dessert item. Even though we were stuffed the server was sincere about the steamed custard buns. We gave in and had one order of egg custard and two orders of the amazing sweet custard bun (can have it steamed or baked I think). The custard buns were warm and crispy on the outside, but inside was soft and filled with runny, sweet custard. Both great choices to end a well balanced meal. 

I would come back again and try the other items on the menu.

Not bad...dim sum was awesome as it can be. Chowmein though is not your typical chowmein noodle; it was more like small flat rice noodles--not yellow. What stood out was shrimp balls: huge!! We went after 3 pm and it was not busy at all!!! Waited a bit for servers to come around to answer questions, but overall not bad at all. Would probably go back if wanting dim sum.

I give this place a solid 2.5 stars -

So In my opinion (just an average Joe opinion) I can't really judge dim sum super harshly but here's my reasoning for 2 1/2 stars even though yelp MADE me only give 2 stars.

We got there and this place only had one other customer. Not a great sign for Dim Sum on a Sat at 11AM. it's a big place. Lots of space and light and it looked promising.

This place was more of a order and we'll make it, or they had it made but you can tell its been sitting out a bit. 

The owner and his wife seemed attentive and very nice. That's why i am giving them 2 1/2 stars. A 1 star can hurt a business and i'll never do that unless it was purposely a crappy experience.

The food was just ok.... Nothing special. I have since had dim sum like 10 times since this experience 3 this past month and honestly Yum Cha just did not cut it for me.

I waited a bit to write this review. Saw it in my drafts and thought what the hell -

There were some standard things missing. The food was just ok. 
I honestly love going to vegas and I love Dim Sum - don't think i'll be back to this place though. Oh and It's expensive. I ended up dropping 80 bucks and I hated it.
Go at your own risk.

We booked a hotel near by and was on the way to Pahrump when we noticed Yum Cha. We decided to stop by and have breakfast there after we check out of our hotel. The morning before heading out we parked exactly at opening time and it seems that there was quite a few families already seated so perhaps they open earlier than their sign (states 10:30 am), also was very pleased that they were open at all considering it was NYE, but hey it IS Vegas and we all know Vegas is the city that never sleeps. We were seated quickly, the dim sum carts came pretty quickly and the food was decently priced. A little more costly than I am used to, but we come from San Diego. The food tasted good, but there were 3 reasons why I decided to rate this establishment 3 stars. I would like to point out their servers are exceptional at how quickly they sweep away the empty plates and used napkins. We did wait on one dish for quite some time, with no one ever checking in and our table asking 2 or 3 times, we felt like we were forgotten. We stayed an additional 10 minutes or so after we had already finished our meal despite putting the order in early to midway through our meal. When we did get the egg tarts, it didn't seem like it was cooked thoroughly and tasted mushy (something even my 8 year old son noted) we are far from being snobs, but it was just very noticeable. When we were ready to pay our bill we walked to the register and waited there for at least another 10 minutes. When you're just standing there awkwardly and literally the only people there, 10 minutes is very long time, lol. It's not that they didn't see us or know we were ready, they just took care of the other tables instead. There were two people at the front desk handling the payments but halfway acknowledged us with our card and bill in hand and kinda just ignored us and made a small gesture to continue waiting while they took care of people that were still eating at their tables. It didn't make sense because we waited for our server to collect our card, but after awhile we decided to just go to the front. Only for the two people in front to be getting all the receipts out for people who were STILL eating and having us wait for an additional 10+ minutes. Doesn't it make more sense to take a quick pause to let us pay and then continue, as we are in front of you waiting and the other guests are still eating? Again, good food. Decent prices, Open parking lot, good servers. But they should have better service when it comes to following up and paying the bill.
Scary trying something new but this place made you felt welcome. Nice service! Clean and pretty good dim sum. Ordered the Ginger Chicken fried rice and also mango pudding with coconut milk.

My family and I came here late on a Saturday night as we were in the mood for dim sum.  It was a little cold that night so we started out with soup. Some of the best soup I have tasted. Then we moved on to the dim sum. They have a large menu of all types of dim sum. Later in the evening we were informed that they do not use the carts as it is a little slower and they want the food to be fresh. The food was delicious! We tried about 5 or 6 different types of dim sum before calling it quits. The staff was incredibly nice and informative.  The customer service here is top notch and so is the food. If you want some good dim sum, you must try Yum Cha!

So delicious! Amazing service! Clean atmosphere, stocked bathrooms, huge menu and all great. The shrimp stuffed eggplant was the best I ever had, Xiao long bao was awesome, sweet tofu, broccoli, etc. but my absolute favorite was the baked lava custard bun was unreal!!! The size of my hand, amazing flavor, runny custard in the middle and I will be coming back for sure!

Yum Dam Cha, Sik Koh Baw

What did I get
Some of everything! Dim Sum plates. I got the Shu Mai, Chicken Feet, Beef Tripe, Cow Tendons, Pork Ribs, Tofu Curd Rolls. Everything was as expected but the beef tripe was a bit tasteless for me, needs a bit more spices please! Also got a plate of stir fried veggies with garlic, also would be great if they stir fried the garlic and not just top it off with garlic (no to garlic breath)

Environment
Very big restaurant, lots of space. The ladies come around with the carts of Dim Sum and you can pick and chose. You could also see all the bakery items near one side of the wall. Typical space, nothing special. OH! The bathroom signs are hilarious.....

Niceness of staff
Um... nothing special. They weren't rude nor were they super friendly. I think with language barrier it is a bit difficult. Mostly they just want to serve you food and move on...

Dollar
Small plates... about $4 a pop! Gets pricey once you start adding up! I was with another person and the bill was about $40, I wouldn't say I was full

Yes?
With so many chinese restaurants in Vegas, I definitely would try elsewhere. Nothing stood out for me to definitely want to come back. 

#WendyTakesVegas #WendyWanders
I'm Malaysian living in California. So happy to find this place. Food is delicious and service is good.

Hands down, the best dim sum spot in Las Vegas. I challenge anyone to find a cleaner, better value, better tasting dim sum restaurant than this one. If you are here during peak dim sum / lunch hours they push the carts around. They don't put the carts all day but you can get dim sum anytime and it's all fresh made to order. Be a little patient - it's all made to order and well worth the wait.

They have a huge menu - more than the average dim sum joint. Save some room, try different things. If you're not sure, just ask. Very nice people. They also have a regular entree menu if you're not in the mood for dim sum. I'm tempted to try their noodles but I was told the portions are huge and I'm always in the mood for dim sum.

One thing that really stood out for me was the curry dishes - the fish ball one and the roti one - both were flavorful and delicious. The one with the roti is Malaysian style, made in house. Amazing.

Was looking for dim sum and found this new restaurant on Yelp. It's across from the International Marketplace. The food was fresh and at a great price. Before 2 pm, they have the traditional carts going around, and they have a food bar so you can order additional items. The owner greeted us and was very attentive to ensuring that we enjoyed our meal. Overall, it was an enjoyable lunch and I'll probably come back again next time I'm craving dim sum.

I didnt expect this dim sum place to be really good. The staff were friendly, good food and fast service. Their pricing is reasonable as well. I love their pork bun and shrimp hakaw! The place is pretty clean as well. And they go to your table once you're seated so you can choose from the dim sum menu. And then when you request one server something, they're very polite and acknowledge you. I've never had this good service in a dim sum place so i was really surprised. I love it. I am definitely coming back to this place with more people!

This place is right next to my apartment complex so I order from here or go here for Chinese or dim sum when I'm in the mood. Their dim sum is good here and they have many options as well. There's not a lot of dim sum in Vegas so I'm glad this place is open and food is good! I like their theme inside and the decorations. It seems really happy and vibrant inside. It's clean as well which is great because other dim sum places I been to, it's not that clean. Their service is really friendly here. I want to try their hot pot since it advertise that they have it here but I haven't got the chance. So far I had their dim sum and regular Chinese dishes here and all been good.

With their name and such positive reviews and high ratings you would think this would be the best yum cha in Vegas....yeah it doesn't work that way on the Monday after thanksgiving with people sparsely seated. Best customer service but a lot of their baked goods like BBQ pork bun, coconut bun, baked egg yolk bun at the counter were old and just kind of reheated and a little dried out/ chewy. They ran out of steamed egg yolk buns and no longer have that egg yolk cake pictured in yelp, and didn't make several dishes that they normally would like white fungus they have on their slide show and other items I asked for. All of the steamed items from cart were gold and unappetizing, the cheung fun was ice cold and noodles hard. This is probably one of my worst dim sum experiences but I am from San Francisco....This meal was all a waste of calories and we should have stopped ordering instead of having hope. Sorry but 1 bad experience prob won't bring me back here despite the really nice helpful people that work here.
Warm and Friendly service. Clean. Great food. My favorite dim sum in Las Vegas. We came in Sunday at opening and were seated immediately.

Yum Cha is a new dim sum restaurant across from International Marketplace. I came across Yum Cha on Yelp in the Hot & New category. So I decided to try it out with my dim sum-crazed friend, who had introduced me to every other decent dim sum restaurant in Las Vegas. 

Upon walking in, it was pretty late in the afternoon and the dim sum carts had ended at 2pm. After a few minutes of waiting (and they weren't busy at all), we were seated and chose our selection of dim sum from the glass display. 

Our orders:
Three orders of har gow
Three orders of cheung fun
One order of Chinese broccoli with oyster sauce
Total price: $29

The FOOD took some time to come out, but came hot and good sized portions. The shrimp in our dishes were plentiful and filled us up. The SERVICE from the woman serving us was very nice and went out of her way to offer extra toppings for our dim sum and kept our waters filled. Overall, I think Yum Cha is one of the better restaurants that have filled this space which seems to have a history with high turnover. 

At the end of our meal, the woman (maybe owner?) gave us a description of each dessert and I almost laughed because it felt like home when your mom makes you eat a lot of food. But in a good way. So, welcoming space and hopefully next time we'll come in to try the regular entrees for dinner.

First timer here.  Came here from California and I was Craving dim sum.  Tried this place and the pork shomai, combination fried rice, baked and steam pork bun were delicious. Friendly service.  Even got some help picking out s few items.  I will be sure to come back.

I don't usually bother with dim sum in Vegas but other options were even more crowded due to the holiday. Line stretched out the door (and there was an equally long line to pay) but so many people gave up that even though there were 20(!) parties ahead of us, it only took us ~30 minutes to be seated. Someone tried to steal our table but the hostess thankfully blocked them.

Doesn't compare to the dim sum I've had in Hong Kong, NY, or LA. Probably on par with what I've had in San Francisco and San Diego. They have a chaotic, inefficient system, not like the well-oiled machines I'm used to for dim sum. Between carts and going up to order at the kitchen, in 20 minutes we had only managed to get 3 dishes. Took 3 people to get our tea.

Guk faa cha: only $1/person for chrysanthemum tea! I like how they give you the rock sugar on the side, though we didn't use it. They were slow to refill our teapot, with lukewarm, not hot, water.

Cart items were mushy from sitting around, which was surprising considering how busy it was. The cart ladies would often pass us by in the corner where we were sitting.

Ha cheong fun: wrapper is a bit mushy. Shrimp on the small side. The 2nd round hadn't been sitting as long as the 1st so was marginally better, but still too squishy for my taste. 3 to an order.

Pork & chive dumpling: though they smelled good, they were bland, greasy, and the filling was hard. I felt like a dog gnawing on a rubber ball. There was supposedly shrimp in this but I didn't see or taste any. 3 to an order.

Bat tong go: sliced too thin so the edges were dried out and crunchy. Also small - I should not be able to shove an entire slice in my mouth. A touch too oily. Just the right amount of sweetness though. Comes 4 to an order but they're relatively small pieces compared to what I'm used to.

Ha gao: these we managed to get right after they were made. Instead of a shrimp ball there were 2 whole shrimp inside each one, though the shrimp they used were again on the small side. Even so, this was the third best thing we had. Getting it fresh made all the difference between this and the ha cheong. 4 to an order.

Malaysian roti: the best thing we had. Even the roti by itself was so delicious it almost was a shame to cover up the flavor with curry, even though the curry was also super-delicious. Comes with a little ramekin of delicious curry (which had some chickpeas and a few small chunks of potatoes in it). There's a serious bottleneck producing them as they're made fresh to order, there's only one pan to make them in, and only one fits in the pan at a time. Got 2, though we could have eaten a pile of them. Menu says it's vegan. Worth coming back for.

Xiao long bao (soup dumplings): the flavor was good and not sweet but there was no soup inside and the bottoms of the wraps were soggy. Despite their flaws, these were slightly better than the XLB Fat Dumpling (which I also like but don't love). Comes 3 to an order and are on the slightly small side for XLB.

Daan tat (egg custard): ordered this at the kitchen. They said they would bring it to our table but didn't ask where our table was. Half an hour later we still had none and could not find anyone who knew what was going on with them. Finally they arrived hot out of the oven nearly 45 minutes later. They were delicious (mostly because they were just made). I haven't had fresh hot daan tat in a long time so this was a nice treat. The second best thing we ate here. Comes 2 to an order and are the normal size kind, not the minis.

Steamed sponge cake: not what I was expecting. Tasted like sweet cornbread but with some almond cookie notes. Not bad but not what I wanted. They are not consistent with the size of the slice they give you, but they give you a huge hunk at least the size of your face.

Mushroom mai (shrimp and pork-stuffed mushrooms): they said they were out when we tried to order it but it came by on a cart later so we grabbed one. The shrimp and pork ball had the same problem as the chive dumpling filling in that I did not taste any shrimp, but these were less rubbery and had better flavor. 3 to an order.

They were out of veggie and potato curry puffs and pan-fried potstickers.

We did not get any of the noodle dishes, though it's of note that they give you your choice of wide or narrow rice noodles or thin egg noodles (I prefer wheat noodles to rice or egg noodles though).

Due to reaching our sweets threshold, we didn't try to get our other sweet favorites like dau saa bao (red bean buns), red bean sesame balls, mango pudding, tofu faa (sweet silken tofu), or golden lava custard buns.

The tables, chairs, and cafeteria area are not very posh but the dozens of wooden bird cages hanging from the ceiling are cute, and the floor tiles and booths look fairly new.

12 items cost $50 before tip.

They lose points for inefficiency, the lukewarm tea, hot items that got cold, and the chive dumplings, but the rest was good enough to make up for it.

Yum cha? Yum-my!
Yum cha means dim-sum in Chinese fyi. 
Ever since this building was BJ's buffet, I never wanted to come near it again. But for Father's Day, my brother and I decided to go with Chinese food and suspected all the other places to be packed. Yum cha was not busy at all during lunch time on a holiday... which was cool with me 'cause the dim sum carts came rolling in real quick. 
We had a bunch of different dishes- steamed pork ribs, two different shu Mai, bean curd, tofu, various dumplings, & rice paper rolls. Not bad, although I'd skip the pork next time. All of these dim sum options are $2.99. Not expensive either, compared to other dim sums near the area (I'm looking at you, Chang's!!). 
Spacious and open dining area. You can walk right up to the open food bar. The owner walked me through it an pointed out each item and suggested the curry roti, which is picture-popular on Yelp. I regret not trying it now. I did try the fried shrimp balls (kinda too oily) and pork ears, which was the most flavorful dish we had. This one was seran-wrapped behind the glass display, and I think they just microwaved it before bringing it out. Wish it were fresher!
They did charge for tea which I found surprising, as most Asian restaurants do not, but it wasn't much. Also about $2 for a tiny bowl of rice.
My father liked it so much that he brought visiting family to try it a few days later, who all enjoyed it too.
Been here 4 times in 9 days. We love it. CLEAN!! Good people and great food. Dont forget "Golden Sand" for dessert.

Clean, convenient, friendly greeting. Great dim sum. Get egg tarts hot out of the oven. Savory items all delicious. Carts vs. steam table confusing. All in all, truly the best dim sum in Las Vegas, and we have tried them all!
A bit hectic but they have great customer service and their food is pretty good :) it's really clean in here as well and it tends to get pretty busy.
Just opened 3 months ago.  Dim sum served all day!  Full and diverse menu. Good service.

So freaking good. They serve dim sum all day which is awesome. I had great service with a group and alone. They food is so fresh and flavorful. Everything is delicious and great prices.  I'm trying not to go every day.

Prologue:
One of our dining traditions when visiting Las Vegas is to try at least one new Asian restaurant.
After perusing several reviews on Yelp we decided that this trip would include some dim sum at Yum Cha.

The Plot:
My girlfriend and I shared a variety of traditional dim sum, including chicken feet, sticky rice with pork in lotus leaf, rice noodle with shrimp, beef short ribs, and beef tendon.

The Scene:
My girlfriend, who is a native of mainland China, and I agreed that the chicken feet and sticky rice with pork were as good as we've had anywhere.
The beef tendon, which was perfectly cooked to the optimal degree of tender, rich, gelatinous yummyness was quite satisfying. 

The Rest of the Story:
The service was intermittent and challenging at times.
The rice noodle with shrimp was cold and the sauce was a little weak.
The beef short ribs were tasty but not nearly tender enough.

Epilogue:
The relatively limited dim sum menu was a somewhat unpleasant surprise considering how many good reviews this restaurant has received. 
That fact alone dropped our review from 5 stars to 4.
Combine the limited menu with the sketchy service and cold rice noodles and the best review we can legitimately give is 3 stars.

Photo design by Billie Z.

This place is really great! Neat and clean restaurant. The atmosphere is very relaxed. The dim sum is also very delicious. Very fast service and I appreciate the option to make a dim sum order at the counter in addition to picking out entrees from the cart. Lots of TVs in the restaurant for viewing. Fast service, would definitely come here again!

So me and my boyfriend have been craving a good dimsum restaurant. And we found this one that has 4 stars. We lived down in henderson so we drove 25 minutes to give this place a try. 

So we got there, two other group were there but we all got seated right away. Then it took about 10 minutes before someone took our order. We had the feeling that they're going to take a long time. So we ordered a lot all at once. It took about 20 minutes to finally get our food. It felt longer because we're both starving. 

While we're waiting for our food to come. Another couple came in. And literally they did not wait for long. And it seems like they were taking care of them more than anyone. They got their food first even though we were there 20 minutes before them. They were making sure their water get refilled while me and my boyfriend clearly have empty water glass but We have to ask to get our water refilled. They were asking if their okay or if they need anything else several times with that table while me and my boyfriend and the two other group that came in the same time we did, they didn't even ask if we need anything. We always have to call them. It's not like we're rude or we're asking for so much. We even cleaned out our own table and even gave them a good tip even though they didn't really took care of us. I'm a server so I know how it is to be a server. 

But overall. The food is great. It tasted fresh. It was really good. But the service. Not so great. It's not that they were rude. It's just that they didn't take care of us but they took care of that other table well. 

But I don't know if we would ever come back. I'm sorry.

This is excellent Dim Sum! I like that after lunch 1pm they stop running the carts and cook everything fresh. It's takes a little longer but the wait is well worth it! If you want the carts go at lunch time 11-1. The staff is very friendly and will offer helpful suggestions. We have eaten at some of the best Dim Sum Restaurants in Los Angeles and San Francisco, Yum Cha is one of the best we have ever eaten!

!!!!! This place is a (new) hidden gem. I can't say enough good things about this place. Some logistics: the place is pretty big with ample tables and booths and pretty clean. They aren't serving hot pot right now (the manager told me its bc its too hot in Vegas right now) which is why we came but it's okay bc we had a more than satisfactory experience.

Must try:
+ Sesame ball (I was crying when I finished it)
+ Salt & pepper shrimp
+ Shrimp dim sum
+ Fried tofu
+ Congee

The servers are very kind and helped us navigate the menu since we aren't that familiar with the menu. Had to take some sesame balls with me to go. I couldn't have enough of it. Will definitely be back! :-)

My family ate here (our son's girlfriends' first Dim Sum experience).  We were disappointed in the size of the shrimp balls and the food did not taste fresh.  I think the girlfriend was totally turned off by Dim Sum so this probably wasn't the best place to start her with.  My husband said both the fried Hom Sui Gok and Jin Duy tasted like they were fried in stale oil.  I was disappointed in the food quality, but the service was very good and the servers were attentive.

Not sure if this is real dim sum.. But I guess it'll do if you are craving it while in Vegas. 

Upon entering, I was surprised at the amount of asians that were there since its kinda located in the outskirts of the strip and not even in Chinatown area. 
Based on the amount of people there, I was thinking that it must be good... Sadly, I was fooled because the hargow was kinda soggy and the same with the xiu mai. Maybe I'm just a little picky because I'm from California.. But this was not legit dim sum in my opinion. I also had a few other Steam dishes but none that were memorable.

We also ordered a few of their fried dishes like the shrimp egg rolls and 2 orders of the shrimp balls. It's nice because they seem to make it fresh to order, but when I received my shrimp ball, I noticed that the paste inside was undercooked. When I pointed it out to one of the servers, they immediately took it back .. Which was nice until they tried to charge us for 2 orders when they only gave us 1. I do appreciate that the waiter was nice enough to remove 1 of the orders when I pointed it out, but I can tell he was annoyed. 

Anyways.. the food here is decent enough if you're really hungry but not up to my standards to what dim sum should taste like.
This got to be the BEST dim sum in town! Friendly service, great variety of dishes to choose from, been here many times now and I love coming here when I'm craving some goodies
When I first came here, I was blown away by there customer service and very good dim sum choices. I recommend this to anyone who is craving for dim sum.
New place ~6 months. First time here. AMAZING. Pretty good quality for dimsum by the strip. The service is phenomenal, they were very on top of everything. Would recommend and would come back.

Came in today at 8:30pm and the place was empty with only a party of 2 . We sat down an immediately the waitress was attentive which to me was good , but then she was a little to attentive pushing items we didnt want and trying to make us order fast , i understand its empty and your probably bored so you want to do something but she was a little to clingy . I heard about this place from a co worker of mine and she says she likes it and its fairly cheap. Im  Chinese so i was not impressed. The food was decent but not good and when we tried to order some dishes they said they were out. For a place that says open til 1030 with all day dimsum they sure were out of alot of items . All in all i dont recommend this place and much rather go back to changs or orchad garden for my dimsum ! My family and i will most definitely not be returning !
My new favorite dim sum place! They have all my favorites and would be a good place for the unacquainted (the special dim sum menu has pictures). Everyone was so nice, and the food was so good.
If your looking for dim sum in the Las Vegas area this place is the absolute bomb! they even have this tofu dessert with ginger syrup; called tofu-far its like eating a cloud9

Wonderful cuisine. Tried the various dim sum. The siu mai, shrimp won ton, and the chive and shrimp dumplings were wonderful. Also ordered a whole duck it was very good.  The fu jook rolls were the favorite.  Staff was courteous and efficient. Overall a excellent dining experience.

We've eaten here many times over the last few months.  The dim sum is usually very good but today was a disappointment.  The steamed pork hash had chunks of hard pork in them.  Items that are usually portioned on the dim sum cart were not available so we had to order porridge and noodles alacarte.  We paid $6 extra for a small plate of dry fried noodles that had no flavor except for the round onions & bean sprouts.  Overall, the food was disappointing.  We also noticed the staff is all new...maybe change of owners?

as soon as we walked in, the service to be seated was a bit slow. The food was good, some dishes tasted a bit different but perhaps it's how they made it. $3 for unsweetened iced tea. Vegetables were good. I don't feel the need to return.

The food is good, but the Dim Sum selection was pretty limited (though it is a weekday). There are a lot of other menu or displayed cook to order items to choose from to supplement the Dim Sum.


Dim Sum items I tried:
Siu mai - these were ok, run of the mill siu mai.
Bean curd - I don't usually like these, but this was good.
Sesame balls - quite good, had two orders.
Pork ribs - these were good, they have bones though.
Beef ball - these were ok, I'm not a fan of the seasoning used in these.

Non-Dim Sum:
Chive dumplings - delicious, but you better like chives... they really border on too much.
Chinese Broccoli - delicious, a bit of a small serving for $6.50.
Beef noodle soup - delicious, loved the soup, my roommate thought it was very expensive for Chinese ($11.50)... but there was a good amount of beef and veggies and the broth was delicious and it was big enough to share.

This place is soooooo good. Plenty of options and things to try, beware you might be here for while enjoying the yummy treats they have in the carts, so fresh and hot and full of flavor. A definite must try! 
You have options of ordering dim sum from a steam cart or heading over to the counter and ordering other various items like egg flower soup and yummy pastries. Overall we were very happy with our lunch

Did this satisfy my dim sum craving? Yes. Was it the best dim sum I've ever had? No. I feel like Vegas really doesn't have an A++ option for dim sum so maybe this is the best there is. It's located on the strip of a strip mall across the street from the International Marketplace building. The inside is pretty big with lots of tables spread out. It's also very clean which is always a plus.

My babe and I came on a Saturday around 1-2 pm and were quickly able to get a table. We were kind of sad that they didn't offer carts going around and that we just had to order from the menu. We tried a few different things, but the Shrimp Dumplings and Curry Fish Balls ended up being my favorite. Both of these had good, rich flavor and I would order them again. The others we tried were just average to me. 

I would most likely come here again when the craving calls, but I don't think it's a top favorite restaurant at all.

I came here on October 2016 and I gotta say it sucked. The food here lacks in portion sizes and quality. The calamari we ordered had way too many breading and not enough meat. The dim sum stuff was average and the decor was unpleasing. The bill turned out to be $80, in which we could've went to Ping Pang Pong at Gold Coast and had better food and portions, and probably spent a little less.

If you like to eat hargow (shrimp dumpling) or shumai, do not come here. Not very efficient dim sum carts. First they take forever to reload their food then they always take the same route. So during my visit, all dimsum carts always started from the other end of the restaurant always leaving me with same unpopular few options. Never saw shrimp dumplings nor shumai until I was full with unwanted food.  Asked what I wanted many times for 30 minutes, but noone really cared. They will simply ignore if you are not getting what you want. Becareful where you seat if you are planning to come here.

For those of us who want dim sum but are not morning people - Yum Cha is here for you! All. Day. Dim. Sum! If you come late (past brunch time) the "cart" experience is not there, but you can still order the full menu and they make it to order. 

This place is a little quirky, with fake bird cages all over the ceiling and TVs showing cooking videos from various Asian counties. The restaurant is also large with ample seating for small to big parties. Although, I'm not sure how busy this place gets on weekend mornings (as mentioned, not an early riser). The staff are bi-lingual and do a good job of explaining what each item is for those who are unfamiliar. They are quick to refill tea/water and are on top of their stuff!

Been here about 3-4 times mostly because the dim sum is all-day. But that's okay because the food is actually really good! Each plate comes out hot and fresh. They have everything from the typical har gow, and shumai to xiao long bao (soup dumplings) and curry fish balls, which aren't usual dim sum fare. However, I do think it's a little on the pricey side for some dishes like the beef tripe, entrails, & radish. 

Yum Cha is great if you want that dim sum fix, and don't want to get up early. It's not the best I've ever had, but it's pretty darn good.

It is an excellent place for dim sum. We recommend roasted buns, caramelized with honey and crispy shrimp wontons. Their shu mei, chicken feet, & steamed dumplings were just normal. But we don't recommend their pig ear salad, which was a bit salty. One thing that bothers us was they charged us $1 per person for hot tea.

We enjoyed our dining experience here! We had just gotten to Vegas after a long drive and my husband was in the mood for dim sum at night! I looked at yelp and we found this restaurant right away since we were staying at the Orleans. 

Food quality and customer service is top notch. The owners treated us like family. The prices are extremely reasonable. We liked our experience. We are definitely coming back!
Place is very clean, hosts were friendly and attentive. Dimsum is definitely better than Orchids Garden or Changs.
Very tasty. We came in after 2 and food was great. On Monday-Friday the small dishes are just 2.88

Very good Dim Sum! Everything was delicious, the atmosphere was low key and everyone was friendly! My favorites were the noodles, the sticky rice with pork wrapped in leaves, and the curry fish balls. So good!
Yummy!  Everything we ordered was delicious!  Won ton soup with noodles, Mongolian beef, orange chicken, and Kunpao shrimp.  Also, the service was excellent!
Some of the best dim sum ever, reminds me of china town in San Fran. Family owned, very reasonably priced. Delicious custard dessert bun.

B

I'm from NYC and Dim Sum is one of the staple foods in the city and in the burbs.  I wanted to like this place because family recommended it but let me say this and I am being as honest as Pinochio's nose.
1) the food is not fresh.  It's steamed but not made in house.  
2) The place is clean.
3) The food is not fresh.  It's been premade other than the soup.
4) The place is in a dope location.
5) The food is not fresh but edible and if your taste for dim sum is not there yet then this place is "GOOD" at best.  

I would not come back unless I was being nice to someone.  Even the soup dumpling was "MEH" I usually don't want to be mean about my ratings but I have to be honest for you folks out there who wants a real honest opinion.  So visit this place - don't knock any place until you tried it.  UNLESS I GAVE IT A "BW" rating.

Food is not fresh
Restrooms are CLEAN
Tables CLEAN and HUGE
Table wait time none.  Restaurant is empty. (1130am)
Take out wait time is QUICK
Customer service is GREAT - people do not speak English well so you have to really speak like you're talking to a 6yr old.  The manager is nice though. 
Ambiance friendly and wide.
Kitchen SUPER CLEAN and YOU CAN SEE THE FOOD in a buffet style glass area.

* Boomsauce scale.
BW = Dis $@% is BASURA! (Garbage).  Not recommended.
BS = it's just O.K. (experience)
BS+ = Yo! I like this place.
BS++= That's Whoa! This place good.
BS+++= Dayumm! This place is fkn DOPE!

Siu mai was hot, savory and delicious, won ton noodle soup excellent broth with flavorful deep fried garlic and onion bits, spring rolls crispy and tasty, har gow delicate, moist and tender, scallion dumplings were fresh with a perfect crispy texture, but the real star is the ginger scallion flounder. I don't think I've ever had fish this tender, flaky and flavorful. Unbelievably good. I'm a huge fan of this place.

A surprise in Vegas. We were in Vegas for a family vacation and wanted dim sum but didn't think I was going to find anything good. Looked on Yelp and found this place. It was such a great treat. The steamed dishes were bought over in a dim sum cart (right away) for your choosing and the baked dishes or entrees were bought over per order by a waiter. The food very good, the service was quick and friendly. 
A definite find in Vegas!
My uncle recommended this place. Very good dimsum. Finished the meal feeling satisfied. The manager/waitress was also very friendly & lively.
the food was fresh and well prepared, a knowledgeable friend invited me and I thoroughly enjoyed. Restaurant is clean and the service is excellent.

Food is very tasty. I really love their shu Mai, chicken feet, pork and veggies rolls, shrimp rice noodles and the sweet tofu dessert. 

However, I think it's a little pricier than other dim sum places I've been to. One thing to note that I never get full with dim sum, it's just really a snack for me. Of course, chicken feet can't make a dent in your belly. It probably costs you more energy to work with all the bones. The main reason is that I get tired of chewing a lot, so I stop ordering more food. So if you are expecting to get full, you should order something with high carb. 

Service is okay, or maybe we were a big group of 20, so the waitress was very confused. The restaurant itself is clean, looks like new. It doesn't really have smell of food all over the place. This is really good for an Asian brunch. I would want to come back.

The only dim sum in town that serves after 3 pm. And their food is excellent. If you come after 2:30 the carts won't be out, but you can order straight off the menu and they will cook your order fresh. LA needs a spot like this!

Good service, awesome dim sum hours (till 10:30), and you can't beat the price!  There were a few minor disappointments such as the lack of adequate red bean paste in the fried sesame balls, and over battered calamari, but the sweet and sour soup was on point!
Great service! Food is good, not greasy.  Restaurant was clean. Eileen was really knowledgeable about the menu and provided lots of recommendations.

I'm very pleased with this Dim Sum restaurant. After living in China for many years, I've become more critical of the lack of authenticity in the states. This place is the real deal. The food was excellent and the service attentive. This place will become one of my go to places for authentic Chinese food! The cleanliness stood out too.

I got mislead by all these people giving 5 stars for a freebie dim sum dish. The place is ok. Service much better than the one that went out of business in its place. It's not any better than Orchid Garden. My favorite place remains the one in Gold Coast....favorite among the ones available in LV. None of them are that great. If they have good food then the service sucks. If they have good service then the food sucks. I am not sure why one of the popular ones from LA have not opened shop here.

We ordered quite a bit of the usual stuff and the price came out to be less than $30 for 2. I am perplexed by why they make you go to the counter for regular items like chive dumplings and egg custard tarts. Those are regular fare. The items on the heated trays should be for take outs or maybe specialized items but no one wants to get out of their seat to get some items while some are wheeled around in the cart. It's seems counter intuitive to me. They do come by with trays selling fried items that normally are not good sellers though.

I think management needs to rearrange the way they set things up. Manager was nice and pointed things out to us but I will probably not be back. There's really nothing to make me want to come back. I wish them luck though. I am not the type to yelpitute myself for a free item. I am annoyed I fell into the trap and went because I thought all those stars meant a good one opened up. Too good to be true.
Staffs were nice. Food was good. Typical dimsum. Nothing wrong. Can't complain about anything tbh. Fairly cheap food. Porridge was good afffff. Would come again.
Good food, I had mostly no idea what most of it was. The General Tso was less spicy than I like, and little fatty, but still OK.

This is my second time eating here at Yum Cha and it has been awesome. The food is great with the dim sum being made as you order. I love eating the shumai and the fried pork rice but I would recommend trying everything since they are all great. I tried the curry fish ball soup today and the curry is home made with a nice little kick to the taste. What makes this place even better is the service each server provides. They are very friendly and would talk to you like you have been there all the time. They are attentive to what you want and would recommend the best food that they have. I will definitely let my friends and family know about this place as they are really good. The price is also great with the dim sum being only 2.98 per order on Tuesday through Friday.

I have tried Yum Cha for the first time and I am hooked. Yum Cha is my new favorite dim sum restaurant and will likely be my favorite for quite some time. I posted a photo of our first round of orders, but the food was so good I couldn't stop to take pics of rounds two or three or even the Roti and Curry. When it comes to the Roti and Curry get your own. We thought we could share one and it almost destroyed our relationship. 

There are so many things that immediately set Yum Cha apart from all the other restaurants in this category. Most noticeably is the walk up counter. Not only can you choose from cart options, but you can also choose from other options at the display. Another major difference for me is the friendly service. Everyone is smiling. Not a common thing I see at most restaurants in this genre. Come experience Yum Cha for yourself. I know I will be returning real soon.
Best Dim Sum in Vegas! The service is also very good, our waiter gave us some delicious recommendations and the overall place is very clean and pretty :) can't wait until they deliver!

The worse dim sum place we had in life. Food is cold and no taste. Order stir fry noodle and it's like steam noodle with grill onion on it. My little nephew had xiao long bao and it's like something from supermarket frozen food. Food smell like leftover food. 

We definitely don't enjoy the food here. I don't think we are so picky about dim sum but this is bad.

My first time here and I was not disappointed! We ordered salted fish and chicken fried rice, crispy pork belly, salt and pepper calamari and their dimsum. The food is authentic and great service. We'll definitely come back and recommend this place.

Open for lunch and dinner. Really good dim sum and nice service....has dim sum and non dim sum menu - only been open 5 weeks thus building reviews. Highly recommend and we will be back :). Everything was delicious. Across the street from three pokestops at the park. Also caught some while eating here; so dim sum and a game. Awesome!!!!

The best dim sum I have found thus far in Vegas!! The staff are very friendly as well, which is a bonus, as opposed to other popular dim sum places here, that offer rude service, and crappy food. Out of all the ones of been to, this one is still my fav go to.

Went here for my birthday (today) for lunch with my significant other and the space itself is very large and has a nice look to it on the inside. 

Service is very friendly as compared to majority of Chinese restaurants. 

Dim Sum Cart doesn't run after 2:30 which was a bummer but understandable. 

When we walked in it smelt a bit like sewage which sucked but further in near the window the scent was gone. 

Food was very good which definitely makes up for any of the drawbacks of this place. We order the chicken fried rice and many of the dim sum plates. BOMB SAUCE

This place has changed hands a few times. We finally made it here today after reading a few reviews. A bit disappointed in the beginning as we waited a while to get service for a restaurant that is not busy. I believe he was the manager that had to tell the cart lady to come to our table. There's two carts of dim sum that goes around, but without a system. The 2nd cart barely made it to our table, we had to wave to her.

There's also a counter that has food displayed and you can also order from there. I hope they would tell you the process as you would guess what's it for, we had to ask. 

Food in general was not bad, but I had better. I like the ambience and it's clean. In the end service was good.

About a year ago, we came here for dim sum and all the staff were friendly especially Elaine. She was very nice and helpful. We ordered shrimp rice noodle and Elaine added some dried or crispy garlic on top for us. It was so good and it made us want to go back for that lol. Other than that, all of the other food were good. 

Today, a year later, we came back again for shrimp rice noodle and for Elaine. Thanks Elaine for all the food recommendation
Not that good, don't order any Singapore rice noodle or any noodle plates from their kitchen, salty and oily. We had tried this place for a few times but disappointed every time.

Friendly service 1 star
Fried chive dumpling 1 star

Umm if you think this is the best then you need to eat at dim sum king to compare
My husband was craving salted fish fried rice and it was delicious!  Dim sum was good. Very fast & friendly service. Kung pao chicken was perfect. We came for lunch.

worst dim sum restrant i had ever been in the u.s.
season?
terrible food. 
shxt  service.
bad decor style.
how do las vegas people stand with it?
how can they gain 4.5 star in yelp?
dont come in. dont come here.

decide to try it again in next 10 day.

Awesome dim sum! Food is great quality for a good price! Ordered about 20 plates of dim sum and everything was absolutely delicious. I highly recommend the dun tarts as they were the freshest and best I've ever had.

First of all, the service here was GREAT. My mom was craving dim sum so I looked on Yelp for some good places and this one had the best reviews and I definitely wasn't disappointed. The owner, Sam, was very welcoming. The food was very delicious, the dim sum didn't come out hot but it was still very good. I only gave it 4 stars because it kind of took a while for them to bring out the food with only a few tables being served.. also some of the dim sum dishes weren't hot. And they had a sign that said "free dim sum when you check in Yelp or google" so I asked if one of my dim sum was free but they just said they usually give a free steamed pork bun.. Maybe they should change that sign. 

Overall, if you're craving dim sum.. This is a good place to go.
Great Food + Great service = Happy tummy. I especially favored the beef short ribs, bbq buns and chicken feet. Try it out.

This place was pretty good! It's different from your usual dimsum because they only have carts of the steam items and you have to order the rest from the server. We went at almost 11am and got sat right away. The only thing the servers were slow to take our order. I have to wave down someone twice but one of the guys who helped us in the orange shirt was really nice. Defiantly recommend and will come again next time I'm in town !

This place is a hidden treasure. Came here for the first time a couple weeks ago and just fell in love. The staff is friendly and helpful. Very knowledgeable in the food and always offer to try new things.
Love this place! The best dimsum place in vegas! If you want affordable dimsum/chinese food go to yum cha, the pork buns are amazing

This is my favorite spot for dim sum. They serve dim sum all day which is a plus. I usually come here in the night time & the food still look tasty. I recommend taro cake & custard lava bun. The bbq pork pastry is the must too. Good customer service & decent price!
Edible but definitely not authentic.  Tastes like frozen dim sum.  Very disappointed. Don't know why the high ratings. I guess we're spoiled with good authentic food in Vancouver BC.
Excellent food and the service was wonderful. Very big place - looks buffet but it is very personalized service. Since it was our first time they explained everything.

Solid dim sum spot.  In fairness, this probably would have been a 4 but we went at night and I suspect the dim sum was not as fresh as it is during a busy lunch hour!

That said, the value is INCREDIBLE for what you get especially compared to the Strip! Highlights were the chive dumplings, shu mai, chicken feet (yes chicken feet!), and sticky rice.  Loved the curry noodle soup as well.  The soup dumplings were not as good.

Service was attentive and friendly!

We were really in the mood for Dim Sum for dinner. Yum Cha was well rated and we were not dissapoointed. The food was delicious and the customer service was fantastic. Everything came out fresh. I was a big fan of their Xiaolongbao  and the fried pork ball. Highly reccommend!

Came here because of the great reviews, so I was a little disappointed when my experience wasn't the same.  Most, if not all, of our dishes were reheated and it tasted that way.  Not sure what the appeal is.

Ahhhhhhhhh. Why do I live so far??? 

I grew up in SGV and have eaten dim sum my entire life. I. Know. Dim. Sum. 

I saw the reviews and HAD to stop by to get the Pineapple Buns because they were calling my name. ???????. These babies were so orgasmically good. Once opening the baos the sweet yolk came gushing out.. it was just simply so satisfying. 

I walked in and went to the counter and ended up order 5 things..... so unnecessary but SOOOL NECESSARY. We were driving back to Los Angeles and definitely needed snacks... even though we literally just ate at Shane's Artisan Noodles. 

Their Pork Buns ??? 2 per order. HUGE Buns... stuffed with pork. Freaking delicious. 

The football looking fried crystal dumplings ??? was good. I wanted more stuffing but still good. 

I also got crispy pork pastries. These are savory and just right. ???

The service was friendly, quick, and efficient. I wish I lived here so I can eat this daily. Bad for my waistline and wallet but so good for my soul

Based on the good ratings and reviews, I decided to try this place out for their dim sum. I honestly wasn't impressed. The service people were nice. Their English, however, was very poor. I had trouble communicating with the staff. They tried to do it a little different here. The standard dim sum dishes are in the carts being pushed around but their "special" dishes are behind a counter where you walk up and order. The order then gets brought to your table. I don't know if that's necessary but I guess you don't have to scour the carts looking for dishes. To me the flavors weren't good. I left feeling like I was missing something. My dim sum fix had not been satisfied.

You can really find some great dim sum here.  I tried the pork sui mai, lotus wrap, sticky pork bun, and shrimp gao, all very delicious and reasonably priced!  Only disappointment were the custard tarts, although they were good, I just expected it to be a lot sweeter for a dessert.  Service was also great. I will definitely be back!

Have you ever been to a dim sum place and don't actually know how much everything is because they just stamp it on your order sheet? Well this place has a menu of all the dim sum they serve and has the prices too. What makes this place different is that they don't come around in carts, you actually order what you want and they bring it to you fresh  $2.88 on weekdays is the cheapest and biggest selection of dim sum on their menu; 3.28 on weekends and holidays. They also have other selections like soup noodles and appetizers (spring rolls, calamari, fried chicken wings). First time here and it's pretty good!

The food is okay, but be careful when checking out.  The person calculating the bill added a few more circles (demarking orders) on our bill, so that it added up to $20+ more than what it was supposed to be.  We called them out on this and they didn't argue about reducing our bill.  

I highly suggest taking a picture of the circles prior to submitting for calculation then doing the math again yourself.  Don't trust them!

Dishonest businesses like this should be shut down.

This is my new place to go for dim sum.  The restaurant itself is very clean, not greasy like every other dim sum restaurant in town.  They have an open kitchen area where they prep food and feature dishes of the day. 
Among the usual dim sum dishes, they have awesome custard steam buns. The buns has yellow yolks with just the right amount of custard and sweetness . If you've ever had the steam custard serve at restaurant in Hong Kong, these are the same!!! 
Easy access and plenty of parking 
Will surely return.

It's hard finding a place you can get your whole family to on time. Today we came here for lunch my family and family from out of town. We were seated right away and we were starving from waiting for everyone to be ready to get ready. Immediately the carts came around and we were already starting to eat. It was amazing. We ordered some other things from the kitchen and then afterwards we looked at the counter items. It was a fun neat experience. Very delicious food.

We randomly found this spot when we were craving some dim sum. We were ecstatic to find out that they serve dim sum all day, which is not typical. We arrived around 3pm and by that time they don't have a cart that goes around with the dim sum. Instead they have a steam table with the food items and whatever else you want off the menu. They had the usuals which were all delicious and I have to say their rice porridge and beef noodle soup were SO good and didn't need additional seasoning, which is rare for me when it comes to rice porridge. We will definitely come back next time we're in town. So good and affordable!

Awesome Dim Sum and by far the friendliest staff I've ever encountered at a Dim Sum place. (Although I might miss the old ladies yelling at me). 

Spotlessly clean, super good mustard, delicious dim sum cooked to order!  Will be back!

Taking over the space of the short-lived Fortune Seafood Restaurant, Yum Cha is a welcome addition to the dim sum/yum cha options we have here in Vegas.
