Yum Cha is about six months old and notably, quite clean. Other diners appreciated the better customer service and lack of pushiness here.  Although we did experience a little pushiness, but after my firm no, the dim sum lady kept on moving.

They have your standard dim sum pushed in carts along with a hot foods counter with made-to-order items.  Those who appreciate extra crispy freshly made radish or taro cakes will understand why this is important.  (Back in the day and at a few random dim sum places outside of Vegas, they still pan-fry the radish and taro cakes table-side, which means it comes out hot and fresh!)  Because Yum Cha offers this hot foods counter, it will come out piping hot!  You can go along the counter and let them know what you want or ask the server to bring it to you too.  We also received an order of Chives Dumplings freshly off the pan this way.

On our last two visits, we got:

* Shrimp and Pork Shumai
* Shrimp Dumpling
* Beef Ball
* Chives Dumpling (Shrimp & Pork) - It comes out so hot from the pan, so watch it!
* Steamed Pork Ribs
* Chicken Feet
* Spinach & Shrimp Dumpling
* Beef Tripe
* Beef Rice Roll
* Beef Spare Ribs - We normally get the Steamed Pork Ribs but when the dim sum lady suggested this one, it was a big win!  The Little Guy loved it a lot!
* Radish Cake - Request it extra crispy!
* Beef Tendon - The dim sum ladies have this one in their cart versus the Beef Entrails, Tripe & Radish dish needs to be ordered from the counter.
* Beef Entrails, Tripe & Radish
* Sweet Rice Cake - I rarely see this dish in Vegas, especially at a dim sum restaurant.

The owner came around on both visits to check up on us multiple times.  He makes sure you are aware of the additional foods at the hot counter.

There are a few service issues that could use some improvement.  For example, I turned the lid on my teapot indicating it needed to be refilled. Unfortunately, no one came to refill it until I asked a server directly.  When I mentioned this to someone in upper management, they told me their star server was out that day.  On our second visit, I think this star server was working because I never had to ask for my teapot to be refilled this time.  However, all employees should recognize when a teapot needs to be refilled.  There are just some servers that are more efficient than others.  There was one server on our first visit who seemed like she hated being there.  It was a pain to ask her for anything since it looked like it was an inconvenience.

On our second visit, there was a discrepancy on our bill as we were charged for an something we didn't order.  Once we brought it to their attention, they looked over it and fixed it.  They did apologize for the mistake and mentioned it was probably a good idea to look over our bill when it's so busy.  

I do appreciate that they only charge tea for the Husband and myself.  At other dim sum restaurants, they'll charge tea for the children as well which can add up.

Prices are split into different categories which are marked on your bill as A,B,C, and D.

Dim Sum: Monday through Friday $2.88; Saturday, Sunday and Public Holidays $3.28
Delicious Dim Sum: $3.98
Chef Specialties: $4.98
House Specialties: $5.98

Overall, Yum Cha has become our choice for dim sum in Las Vegas.  I hope they expand their menu to include more elusive items and old favorites as they become more popular.  

We also enjoy the ongoing feed of YouTube videos showing food from all over the world on the large screens.  Not only does it make us nostalgic, but I think we eat more as well.

The Dim Sum was ok but the customer service was incredibly terrible. We believe they don't make EVERYTHING listed on the Dim Sum menu that was given to us because we never saw half of the things listed. Would I return? Probably not.

The service was good but the food was sub-par. As the first dim sum place I have had in Vegas, I wished the experience was much better. The place is itself is nothing to rave about. I only came here as for convenience in location.

The selection was sub par. The har gow and shu mai was not very fresh tasting. Few times in my life have I not finished a dish and their har gow was one. The skin was not chewy with a nice bite. It was thick and almost stale. I enjoyed their taro dumplings but it was filled grease (grease residue means it was not sat out to let it seep through before serving).

I really wish the dim sum was spectacular but unfortunately it was not.

I brought the "Fun Vegas Foodies" and "Sushi and More" meetup group here today.  As usual,  the staff was very attentive to our needs.  All of the dim sum was on point.  We especially liked to "lai wong bao", custard buns and the sieu mai, pork dumplings.  The restaurant also served us some Malaysian roti canai for free.  We ate so many dishes it is hard to encapsulate everything.  I shall post a bunch of pictures.

Yum Cha is the best dim sum in town. The only place my fiancé and I will go to! The crispy eggplant and sweet and sour chicken rolls are bomb. Must try. Service is always great. People there are sweet. Rock on

Great service, delicious food and friendly atmosphere! 
Decided to try a new Dim Sum place today and glad I ran across Yum Cha. Food was delicious and restaurant was extremely clean. 
Sam, the owner, came over and Introduced himself and was very pleasant to talk with. Staff was always around for anything we needed. 
To all the Hawaiians in Las Vegas .... they have Rice Cake!

This is the only place in vegas that I know of that serves dim sum all day and all night. If you want dim sum past 2pm, this is the place to go!

Even though it's available, the quality is not he best. The service is also not the best. This place does not have carts. You order from a menu and they bring the dim sum to you. Either the service is slow or the chefs are slow but only one dish comes out at a time. And after you finish one dish, the next comes out five mins later. I like my dim sum experience to be a spread... With all of it in front of me at once so I can pick and choose what I want to eat. This place serves it in courses. Nothing comes out together. 

Also there were some mix ups with our ordering. A dish never came out and we had to ask them to check on stuff because food was slow to come. I thought the food tasted fine but my no means one of the best.  Also, this place has the basic types of dim sum but the menu is small compared to other restaurants. The variety was fine for me but you won't find any specialty dishes here.

Truly enjoyed our visit today. The dim sum was tasty and only a couple of dishes were Americanized but they were still great. Their authentic Chinese food and Dim Sum that we tried were truly tasty!!! If you are unsure of what to order, ask! The people are super friendly! If you truly enjoy Chinese food you will enjoy Yum Cha. We will be back
Came here for the first time today and loved it. Food tasted great and fresh, will come here again next time I'm in Vegas

We went to this restaurant, today, based on the reviews.  The only negative I had read was one that referred to the slow service.  I figured that was out weighed by the great reviews on the food.  The food was awful and the service was terrible.  The waitress, instead of believing the customer was right, argued with us and didn't give us our change.  We will never go back there again and I don't recommend it to anyone!
When everyone wants dim sum in Vegas, they automatically always think to go Chinatown to get their fix. but this place is the  don't miss out!
From the Bay Area and first dim sum place we came to out here. Taste like home! Very good, highly recommend!!
Great dimsum place plus the price is right ! The staff and servers are all nice , friendly and professional . The place is clean and service is outstanding. Will definitely come back .

Odd this place wasnt crazy busy on a Saturday at 11am, but don't let that fool you. Everything was made fresh and delicious. We tried a variety of steamed shrimp dumplings, jin dui/fried sesame balls with red bean, shrimp with eggplant, chinese broccoli, and steamed buns with red bean which I personally recommend. Restaurant was open, nicely decorated, and had both friendly and attentive staff. We'll def be coming back!

I was originally from Taiwan and there are some pretty good yum cha where I lived. But I was pleasantly surprised how good the food tastes here. We ordered 11 dishes of dim sum and two plates of noodles and it was about $65, which is a very decent price for dim sum, not to mention that this was in Las Vegas. There's plenty of seating. Service was quick. The restrooms were clean as well. Located in a plaza with plenty of parking space. Would definitely come again if I were ever in the area!

A new but old spot! Same resto different owner. Across from International Market! A cool dim sum place, friendly staff and the Hot Jasmine tea was bomb! Food was good and decor of birds cages above was a sight to see! 
I give this place 5 stars because the servers Always came over and made sure we were good on water and always Asked if we were "okay" will be back! What a way to spend our Good friday dinner 3.30.18

I was very stoked to try dim sum in Vegas, but Yum Cha kind of left me unsatisfied. I do come from Los Angeles, where we are infamous for our dim sum in the San Gabriel Valley. So I know to not have my expectations too high.

The main reason I had to give Yum Cha 3 stars (instead of 4 stars) boiled down to the bill, that kinda left me with a bad taste in my mouth (on top of the subpar tea and dim sum).

I went a day before Thanksgiving (Wednesday, November 22), but they had charged at the 'Holiday' rate. It's about 60 cents more per plate. We had initially found this place through my mom's Chinese newspaper, that had advertise $2.85 per dish. When we got there, the regular prices were $2.95 and the Holiday prices were $3.58. The staff confirmed to me that the Holiday price was enforced for the whole week. (I was reviewing Yelp menu prices, because it's been a while since my experience. It appears they were raising the prices every year). If they were upfront with their prices, I think I wouldn't be as annoyed, but that 'shady' business kinda throws me off.

Overall, the service is good. It's casual but the staff is very attentive to your needs. The food and tea isn't good. Like, if you're drunk and hungry, it would be fine, but who would drive that far from the strip to get dim sum --idk, it is open super late.

To be honest.. I'm pretty surprised how this place got really good ratings. After seeing so many great reviews, my family and I wanted to try this place out. Since we went late night for dinner, there was no cart service since they end it at 2:30 pm so we ordered from their dim sum menu instead. Service started out great by our server taking our drink & food orders. They were very friendly and attentive. Everything was made fresh to order which was definitely a big plus. But everything came to our table extremely slow.. one dish at a time. At one point, we had to ask our server where and when our other food orders were coming cuz we were just sitting there... waiting for the rest of our food to come out. We also ordered the wonton soup to split and had to ask three diff servers for bowls & spoons. Somehow (the lady who was suppose to bring it) got distracted because we saw her grab it in the back but then walked off doing something else. My boyfriend repeatedly tried getting our server's attention until the girl (who we initially asked) finally brought it to us. In addition, we ordered baked BBQ buns, which we had to ask our server where it was, and he misunderstood us and thought we said custard buns. He went to the back to check on it and later told us that they ran out and asked if we wanted steamed ones instead. We were pretty disappointed but our server made it up by giving us a free dessert. Overall, the service was pretty unreliable at times even with the restaurant not being busy. I can def say it's not worth coming back to for dim sum especially because nothing really stood out to be amazing. There's a lot of other places in LV that have better dim sum.

Food here was pretty good in comparison with San Francisco. Im from San Francisco and there are a lot of good places but also a lot of horrible dim sums. I would say that this place is on the good list and hence the 4 star review. Food tasted the way it should, great service, fast and clean facility.  Definitely will come back!

Ordered Curry Fish Ball Noodle Soup (w/ flat rice noodle), Beef Tendons and Pork & Veggi Roll.   It took a while for them to serve the food, but the flavor and taste were great. 
The noodle soup is a local Malaysian dish with a unique spiciness and steaming hot. The other two side dishes were transitional Cantonese dim sum selection. 

Yummy and I was sweaty after finishing all of them.

Wanted some good old fashion dim sum while in Vegas with my crew and found this gem off the strip. Its a 15 minute drive from the the strip but it opens after 10:30 so dont both going early morning. The service is friendly and prompt. The food is above average Chinese dim sum. At least better than the one we have in New York City. price is $4 to $6 per dish but well worth it for the quality. Highly recommended if you crave for dim sum. It opens late!

Honestly, dim sum places in Vegas are not that impressive.  Yum cha has become my first choice when the craving hits.  There's a lot of positives to this place and a few misses.  What is most noticeable about this place is the customer service.  The workers speak a fair amount of English, which helps because they are able to explain the food they are offering and answer questions appropriately.  You'll always spot the man in the orange, who I assume runs the place.  He's always got a smile on his face and is constantly interacting with customers.  He's been prompt and follows through with specific dim sum orders we had.  Most dim sum places in town do not even go the extra mile and many workers come off rude. Not here!

I am not that adventurous and stick with the basic fare like: hargow, shu mai, char siu bao, beef/shrimp noodle, sticky rice, pineapple buns, egg tart, and sesame balls.  I did enjoy the quality and freshness of the food.  The pork shu mai was my least favorite since it was on the bland side.  The sticky rice, pineapple buns, and sesame buns were my favorite here.  I also liked that they offer roti here!

Another major difference here is the large glass counter/open kitchen where you can walk up and order dim sum beyond what is offered on food carts.  This is where you can get congee, fried rice, desserts, and more!  

The space is large, airy, and very clean.  Location is situated on Tropicana/Decatur in the shopping center with Walgreens. Be aware on holiday weekends, this place will charge more (like $3+ for basic dim sum).  I feel like I spent a lot more than I would on dim sum that I had in the past from other places.

*****Yelp 2016 100 Challenge*****
53/100

We went here for some dim sum it was nothing special. I wish they had more dim sum carts option. I guess I'm comparing it to the best one I had in china town San Francisco. We technically had everything in the menu that they had to offer for dim sum. The service was slow for the place not being busy. I believe we should had gotten exception customer service. 
They do have funny signs in their he bathroom which is unique.

This place is OK if you're on a budget and want dim sum. They still have the carts with food but it's limited in variety. This place wasn't packed so there's no telling how long the shrimp dumplings been under the steam warmer.

If anything wait until they bring the fresh one from the kitchen before picking it from the steam cart. Fortunately there is a menu that you can ask the waiter to order which I recommend. 

I would stay away from their fried taro root or any of their food in their glass case. Although the lady said it was fresh and made this morning there's no guarantee she's telling the truth and when you bite into one it didn't taste like it was made that morning. 

The restroom does have a couple of funny signs though.

This place is amazing..through the Fellow Yelp recommendations I was craving Dim sum on a Thursday evening. Noting that most places close at 2, this place serves dim sum until 10:30 pm. This a great place of your have a late night drink, and craving some dim sum. The location is perfect, right off the strip on Tropicana and Decatur. Everything was great. If your not into dumb sum, they also have a full Chinese menu.

Hey there! Ok ... so we have been to many dim sum restaurants here , Hawaii and San Francisco and so far this one is my favorite! The food was hot , the service was excellent, the staff were very friendly and the restaurant... so clean !!! I also loved the fact that you could see the kitchen and know the food is prepared to order ! Everything we ordered was delicious my favorite was the baked custard bun (yummm...) ! We will be back soon ! 
    Thank you Yum Cha !

Uhhh overrated. That is all. For $3.58, you get such a small portion whereas if you go to another place you get more on your plate. Maybe I'm a spoiled Bay Area girl where dim sum is readily available and delicious that this place is nothing compared to it. 

First off, the place isn't very inviting. It seems like a cafeteria in a way. Very big space, but it just feels cold. I mean it's cool they have this bird cage design going on when you look up, but other than that nothing. 

I only ordered dim sum dishes so I can't say anything about entree dishes. But it's cool they warm up the dishes for you when you order dim sum plates so the food is hot when it comes out. The sad thing is the portions are so small! Three small pieces of shrimp dumpling (har gow), shu mai, etc., you would have to order multiple plates to feel full! Nothing spectacular about the traditional dim sum plates either. Like I said mediocre at best. Har gow is har gow. You just get the taste in your mouth, but it prob won't hit your dim sum crave. The baked bbq pork bun came out with two decent sized buns. The gloss was too sticky and their was so little filling vs bun. Sad. 

Winner of this whole experience is the lava custard pineapple bun. This is the closest thing I have found! It's a bigger puff almost muffin looking, but the runny oozy custard is totally on point. Probably the only reason I would go back to this place is just for this dish. 

Overall disappointed. Three stars because the food is okay, the service was good, price a little too high. But I'll be back just for those custard lava buns. If anyone knows where else to try, let me know!

There aren't too many options for dim sum in Vegas, but this place satisfies a dim sum craving. Before coming here I read the yelp reviews, and so many people said that this place was friendly. And they were totally right, the service was warm and welcoming. Jack and I came by for dinner, so no carts were being pushed around. We just ordered the things we wanted and they brought it over. The dim sum was good. The fried egg plant was pretty delicious, I hadn't had anything like it before. And they had fried pork bun which is one of my fav dim sum dishes. Good dim sum, clean restaurant, friendly people, inexpensive - they do a great job :)

Food here is good, but service sucks!! Waited 10 minutes for someone to come and take our drink order after seating. Table next to us waited 5 minutes to get a side of mayo, they were not happy. The guy said first and last time here....don't blame them. Been done eating now for about 15 minutes while I'm writing this review and no one has come by...would like to get the check and leave.

Really awesome staff who will give you the lo-down on all the good eats. The dim sum is great! Major highlights on the fried pork balls, chive fried dumplings, and shrimp dumplings. Probably the best shrimp dumpling and chive fried dumpling in any chinatown I've ever been to. Worth a look whether you're new to dim sum or have been eating it sonce you were a baby.
Delicious dim sum!!! I've been looking for a good dim sum in LV, and I finally found it!

Fresh off the plane from the Upper Peninsula of Michigan, I had found this gem while researching where to eat in Vegas!  Needless to say, what a great start to the trip!  The owner clearly takes great pride in his immaculate establishment and the attention he gives visitors.  He kindly guided our journey and sought out some items for us solely based off of photos.  We even got brave and tried chicken feet!!  The custard buns are to die for!  The prices are great too!  Seek this place out...you won't be sorry!! It's the kind of food that you think of once you are home again and long for it!!

3.5 stars. I'm a huge dim sum person, so whenever I get the chance to try a new place, I go. This place had the best overall reviews, so my friends and I decided to try it. It's not too far from the strip, so take a taxi/uber. 

This isn't your regular dim sum restaurant, least not what I'm use to. The restaurant is a little dark inside. There are carts going around, and some other things you can order to be made. The food overall is pretty good. You can easily judge a dim sum place by their chicken feet, shrimp dumpling and sui mai. All 3 here are pretty good. They have almost everything you can get at a dim sum restaurant, so if you're craving it, this is probably one of the better spots in Vegas.

I don't get the dim sum vibe here like I do most places. Maybe it's the lighting, something just feels off. But don't let that stop you, it's just me. I would definitely come back here for dim sum next time I'm in Vegas.

Came here on a busy weekend to try their dim sum as Changs stopped serving some of our favorites like custard buns. Once seated it was virtually impossible to get anyones attention and most of the carts stuck to the outside tables. Only one would ever venture into the tables on the inside and they had the less popular dishes. We managed to try one order of har gow which was good but nothing else. After waiting for a half hour trying to get served we gave up. We managed to get the attention of a busboy and asked for our check which took an additional 20 minutes. We left hungry and unsatisfied.

Every dish we order was good:  sticky chicken rice, cha Siu boa, lava bun, radish cake, hai gao, beef tripe, taro roll, chicken feet, beef rice noodle.  Great service.  Better than some top Dim Sum restaurants in LA

Excellent service, super clean and good was THE BEST! I highly recommend this Chinese dim sum restaurant. Loved my experience, the owner was super nice. Now I found a place to keep coming to for lunch when I come to this awesome city.

Went to this place at 3pm for a late lunch.  We were a bit disappointed that there was nobody walking around with the carts of food but it is understandable because we arrived at an odd time.  The host did say they have people walking around between 11am and 2pm.  We were directed to a counter where all their food is and all we have to do is point at the food we want and they bring it to our table.  The food was surprisingly good considering it was 3pm and not a lot of people were there. Every item that we ordered was full of flavor and did not disappoint at all.  Definitely gonna come back here to try it during normal lunch times.

Really good dim sum. They seem to have a big rivalry with East Ocean on Eastern in Henderson, but I like both places. I think they have an edge on service over East Ocean, though. Also, there's some food on display, which is a feature East Ocean does not have.
What a great place to eat DimSum....found this place through Yelp and it truly lives up to its reviews.  Staff is beyond friendly and helpful.  A defiant must try.
This place is great! They have some of the best tasting and freshest dim sum we've ever had. They have a big selection of options too. The owners were friendly and helpful too!
Best dim sum place in Las Vegas.We have coming here for 3 times in 4 days. I would recommend anyone coming to LV to take a try of this place! The price here are fairly cheaper as well.

First time eating at this Dim Sum restaurant. We came in a good time because there were not too busy. The staff was attentive and fast at serving us. The dim sum carts keep coming every 5-10 minutes. We kept ordering shumai, chicken feet, pork ribs, and shrimp dumplings. They also have good egg custard desserts. I recommend this place if you are hoping to get some dim sum for a good price while in Las Vegas.

I have to say, their shrimp dumplings and sesame balls are the best I've tried in Las Vegas. Must order!! The dip for Indian pancake is very unique, mix curry flavor with potatoes. So does the beef noodle soup, not just how tender the beef are, but the taste of soup is yummy!
The service is pretty good if you want to view it as dim sum restaurant level, lol. The price is average, we definitely will be back, especially they told us the dim sum is available whole day.
Never had better service at a dimsum place! Great customer service, clean environment and food came quick.  The lady that served us was very informative and attentive to us!
Took my mom here for lunch. Love their food! I recommend anyone that wants to come here for a good lunch or dinner. Price is good. Service is awesome as well!
This was my first time to have dim sum and it was great! The service is amazing, everyone is super nice.

Stopped by here for the first time the other day. Why is there a weird smell to this place? I tried a couple of the dim sum dishes and they were very bland. I feel bad giving this place two stars because the waiters were so nice. 

Maybe I will come back and try other dishes.
Great food. Service is very quick. We came in on Sunday noon and it's packed but they manage to take care of everyone.

We love dim sum and thought we would give Yum Cha a try. We go to Vegas about 3 times a year and since my heritage is Chinese/American its a must when we roll into town. Unfortunately the food at Sum Cha didn't quite hold up to our standards. It ended up being on the inconsistent side. How so? There was a disconnect with the servers and the cooks when it came to ordering separately from the Dim Sum carts. One cart server that we ordered from seemed annoyed at having to leave her cart to order the items from the 2nd kitchen and quickly told us it was backed up. The food was super hot and fresh as it came off the carts but when the 2 items from the kitchen bar section arrived, one arrived cold in the middle and the other was delivered well after we were done with our meal and before we asked for the check. Overall we felt that the food from the carts was the best (even though it was average-mediocre) and surmised that the kitchen may be experiencing its own separate issues.  Not sure we will be back to Yum Cha as there are a couple of other Dim Sum places we like to go to like Ping Pang Pong!
Great place for dim sum! I tried their new dessert today- mochi with peanuts! So good

Oh man. We got like ten different dishes to split and all of them were good. Some were better than others, but the fried shrimp wonton, shumai, chicken wings, fried pork belly and pork dumplings were all excellent. If we had to rank things, the chicken wings were probably the best and the sticky rice was probably the least favorite, it wasn't bad, just OK. The lava bun the custard was really flavorful but a little grainy. Overall we were thrilled with the meal.

Decided to stop in here for a late dinner based on yelp reviews, and it did not disappoint!  Very clean and bright with amazing servers.  The baked lava custard was out of this world, and the chicken shu mei was the best I've ever had.  Everything was super fresh and piping hot. Will definitely be back.

Yum cha is the place, you need to try! Friendly staff with delicious food. I'm giving this place a 5 stars for the following reason:
1. Great customer service
2. Tasty food
3. Food are not greasy
4. Reasonable price 
5. Place is clean
6. You have a choice of dim sum or not
7. Love love love

My daughter found this place on Yelp...took a chance...we are extremely satisfied with everything - service and the food were both great!! Sam and the rest of the staff were very friendly and efficient. The place is clean...we will definitely be back for more!!! We found a better place for dim sum!!

The wife and I have always gone to the more known dimsum restaurant on Sahara but to our dismay, it was closed.  Searched on Yelp for an alternative and found Yum Cha.  It was not hard to find since we use to eat at the same establishment in the past when it used to be a buffet.

Yum Cha did not disappoint at all.  We came in on a slow time so service was very fast.  Menu is your typical dimsum menu; crab/shrimp balls, shumai, chickent feet, pork bun, short ribs, stir fried egg noodles, etc.  Servers were pretty good in recommending items in their menu.  They weren't even recommending anything on the high priced list.  Ended with a baked custard bun which was  the perfect finish to our meal.

First time here. Went to another place near Henderson only to find out they no longer serve dim sum so we decided to drive over. We are from cities with a big Chinatown and have high expectations for yum cha. This place was great. First the place is spacious, bright, clean, and great service. Secondly the food was terrific. We ordered shu mai, har gao, lotus leaf sticky rice, gai lan chow mein Cantonese style, red bean sesame buns, mango pudding, and char su chun fun. Everything was perfect.

3.5 stars!

The service here is great!! Everyone is so nice! And the portions are more generous than other Chinese/Dim Sum spots I've been to. And the restaurant is very clean.

The reason it gets 3 stars is that maybe I'm just used to LA/OC's dim sum where it's a little more authentic and greasy lol! I felt as though the flavors here were somewhat lacking. The congee had no taste and I was expecting a lot more from my favorite: har gow. I was also disappointed that I didn't see honey walnut shrimp on the menu. :(

I like that dim sum is served all day and not only in the mornings like most places. Excellent service, but I miss the saltiness and greasiness of the places I'm used to! Lol

Just spotted this place and stopped by to have dinner. All staff was kind and friendly. Dim sum was fresh. Tea was delicious. One of the servers brought over some rock sugar for tea. So good. 
Great Service. Will definitely come back.
Today is my first time here, I love it so far! The dim sums are awesome! I'll definately come back again and again :)

It's hard to find good authentic Chinese food in Las Vegas, let alone dim sum; however, Yum Cha was great! I wish I knew about this restaurant sooner. 

The service was great. Everyone was very attentive. I literally looked up from the menu for one second and the waiter was over to ask if I wanted to put in an order. It's no secret that many Chinese restaurants usually don't have the best customer service sometimes but I really enjoyed my experience here. For being prime time for dim sum, it was fairly slow but it was a Tuesday morning.

The menu included several options and offered detailed photos of the food items. I was impressed that some classic dim sum entrees offered a chicken or pork option (siu mai). We ordered the chicken siu mai, har gao (shrimp dumplings), char siu bao (pork buns), har cheung (shrimp noodle rolls with sauce), and the egg custard buns (which were ginormous, the photo in the menu was not an exaggeration). I'm picky when it comes to dim sum, but everything was very fresh and delicious! My eyes were far hungrier than my stomach and I really wanted the egg tarts and mango pudding, but that's something I'll have to try next time. 

The restaurant was very clean and you had a clear view of the kitchen area.

I was craving hella dim sum on this random day. My whole family (party of 10) asked me what I wanted to eat and I told them Chinese food! At first, we were Yelping around and before we came here, we ended up in this random sketchy place with the sign all bust and said, we'll pass on this one. Yelping for other restaurants, we came across YumCha. Honestly, this is a really good Chinese restaurant and I enjoyed the variety of food they offered and how authentic it was. Lots of dim sum variety too. 

Ps: Don't get freaked out by the the cages hanged on the ceiling. My baby cousin looked at it and thought there were birds inside.

I came here with a friend for the lunch dinsum and I was pleasantly surprised. We picked this location because it was not on the busy spring mountains street and it had a higher rating on yelp compared to the other dim sum restaurant in the Las Vegas area.

They had everything fresh and the shrimp and pork dim sum are out of the world! Their soup dumplings is also great but we had to order it separately and it came towards the end of our meal. For two people who had about 10-12 dishes our meal ended up being 40$! If anyone else I know wants to eat dim sum I would definitely recommend coming back to this location.

The staff is friendly and the restaurant is clean. They also have cool birdcages on the ceiling which makes the interior very interesting. Got some TVs on so kids could have something to watch

Great dim sum place. Services are little slow but foods are very good! 
Weekday price is very reasonable and they are all freshly made. 
Their pan fried dumplings are so worth to try.

This was some good Dim Sum! On our way out from Vegas a friend and I were craving dim sum and came across this place. I'm not an expert on dim sum, but I left full and pleased. The BBQ Steamed pork bun is always my favorite. The staff was friendly and quick. I'd keep coming back here in my.trips to Vegas for sure.

Really great new place, & the staff is super friendly!! There wasn't a lot of people there when we went (around 6:30pm on a wed) cuz apparently people aren't aware they cook dim sum till close, AND have a full dinner menu? The dim sum was fresh & delicious though & I'll definitely be going again soon!!!

I really like Yum Cha. We got there about 7:05pm and there didn't seem to be any cars in the parking lot. We walked in and there was 3 tables that were occupied. We waited about 30 seconds and a waiter came to greet us. He asked if we wanted a table or a booth. We said a booth. After he sat us.down at a booth the waiter asked if we had ever been here before. We said no. He explained to us that we can order dim sum and Chinese food. We order dim sum. There was a little wait but we didn't mind. It seemed like everything was made fresh to order. I really liked it! This is going to be our new go to restaurant for dim sum. I'm actually taking my daughter there tonight for her birthday.

Love that this place has dim sum at night! There are some things that don't taste quite as good as other places, like the sticky rice and egg custard, but they're still good! I've also tried some of their other food, like their beef noodle soup & crispy calamari and haven't been disappointed.
Seriously. This place is a joke. Maybe I caught it on a bad day but yea. I'm not coming back.

My BF and I were greeted and seated as soon as we walked in and our order was promptly taken. We ordered -

Pork siu mai
Hargow
Pork spare ribs
Shrimp in bell pepper
Mushroom mai
Veggie noodles
Chinese broccoli
Fried shrimp wonton
Xiolongbao

The noodles and Chinese broccoli were perfect, not greasy or too salty. The siumai, mushroom mai, hargow, shrimp in bell pepper, and shrimp wonton were piping hot when they got to our table and had good flavor. 

But, the xiolongbao was only ok. Didn't have much soup inside and were lukewarm when brought out to us. Also didn't have very much flavor to it. 

Aside from that, everything else was yummy and the service was really good. Attentive, friendly servers. Will definitely be back again.

Checked out this place after reviewing Yelp. Delicious and authentic Chinese food. Very kid friendly atmosphere. Loved the salt and pepper fish fillet and the thousand island shrimp. The beef noodles soup was great too. Customer service is friendly and very responsive. Will definitely visit again when Vegas bound. The kids loved the egg tarts too.

The best Dim Sum in town, First time in find in vegas a rice noodle roll with bbq pork. Everything is super fresh and the staff is very nice .
For sure try the Roti Canai, its like a naan but better . they have the best beef tripes in town .the chives dumpling are amazing .The crispy eggplants are very interesting.
This place is my new dim sum place , I have been 3 times in a week,
Great dim sum but I recommend to dine at opening time because choices are made limited! Rice cake!!!

Dim sum off the strip, YES! A bit of true Chinese dim sum amongst the buffets. This local place is 15 or so minutes off the strip in a suburban area of business and residences. Yum Cha offers Great service and an easy to read menu of traditional dim sum cuisine. Prices are fair as the food is tasty and in many cases just as I remembered when I was a child growing up in SF. The dim is more than satisfying to the tummy and palate. This is a definite place to go. Enjoy!
First time visiting here, I like it. Good selections, and non steamed items are cooked to order. Very good sauces and pricing.

This restaurant was recommended to me by a friend when I asked her for yummy dim sum. Not only was the dim sum out of this world but they also serve Malaysian food. The roti with curry is yum , lava custard dessert is yum and this curry soup with fresh noodles was also yum. I wish we could have come back . Definitely will be making another trip here when I return to Vegas. 

The staff is very friendly. Our waitress was very proud and passionate about the food that they serve.
First time here today. One word...AWESOME! Food is delicious, price is reasonable, friendly staff, great service and mostly importantly, CLEAN! We'll be back for sure.

This restaurant is my weekend Dim Sum on the fly kind of place, they have fresh, variety and tasty Dim Sum. They also have regular Chinese food. Great service, moderately priced. They have ample parking, wheelchair access.  This is a good size restaurant and and nicely managed. I strongly recommend this restaurant.

I was good luck for found this place.  I love Dim Sum. It place is Amazing. When I walk in they are welcome and smiles. The food 5 Star. Service 5 Star. I ask for a lot of sauce they give us try everything.  My friend ask Chinese owner ? Then the owner walk to us. He is The Who that walk around and take care very table like another staff.  This place will be my Best Dim sum restaurant in LV now. No more ping pung...pong
Below par.  Way better dim sum in Hawaii where I am from.  Everything just tasted a little off.

I really wanted to be blown away by this place. But I found it to be average for a dim sum spot in Vegas. Vegas has some of the best food from all around the world but for some reason no one in Vegas can get dim sum right. I was raised in LA eating some really good dim sum so when I moved to Vegas a few years back I made it my personal mission to find good dim sum. I moved back to LA after a year so sadly I never succeeded in that mission but I kept an eye on the Vegas dim sum scene. That's why when this place started popping up in my Instagram feed from some of my Vegas Instagram foodie friends I got excited. I cross checked yelp, finding out that it had a 4 and a half star rating so I knew I had to check it out next time I was in town. This next time happened to be on Christmas Day. It was both cool and not cool that it was open but it's a Chinese restaurant. Chinese restaurants never close. 

Now don't get me wrong. It's not horrible. No place I've tried in Vegas is really super bad. Every one is just ....ok. This place didn't really set the bar any higher. Maybe I'm just a little dim sum spoiled I don't know. I just don't find that it lives up to the standard I'm used to. 
We had quite a few dishes I'm not going to name them all but I'll talk about a few. The pork and shrimp siu Mai was cool. Its probably one of the tastier dishes. The shrimp rice noodle fell a little flat for me. I mean literally the rice noodle was thinner than usual. But then again that's my favorite dim sum dish so maybe I expect more. And the shrimp. I don't know why but every dim sum restaurant in Vegas uses small shrimp. Maybe more cost effective but I prefer the larger more succulent shrimp used in restaurants back home. 

The service was lacking as well which hurt my rating. They said I had just missed the rush so some of the things I ordered were not ready so it would take a little longer. So it took us a lot longer to finish than usual. And one of the dishes almost never came. After all the food had come out and we finished eating i asked about it. They said they were still making it. Give it 5 more minutes. After 10 minutes I asked again and one guy said they were still defrosting it. That kind of turned me off. Like I know it might not be made on the spot. Maybe it has to be heated up but frozen and then defrosted and then reheated just didn't sound too appetizing to me. So after another 5 minutes which in total is almost an hour after we initially ordered I asked to cancel it. They said yah it's still not ready we can cancel it. The server went to go cancel it and get the check but then someone else brought it out before the check came back. So we just took it to go. That was I would guess the worst dish of the day. 

Like I said this place is ok. I think I just had my hopes set a lot higher. So I guess ..... the mission continues.

Just had Dim Sum at Yum Cha. I live in Vancouver (Hongcouver) BC Canada, and visit my significant other every 3 weeks in Vegas. I'm Chinese so I wanted him to try Dim Sum since it's my go to comfort food. Him and I both Loved Yum Cha! The service was excellent and very personable and the food was Fresh and tasty. We ordered half the menu and plan to order the other half on my next trip to Vegas. Make sure you ask for the special sweet soy sauce when you go!

We loved Yum Cha so much we had to go again. We had some of our favorites again; shumai, shrimp dumpling, meatball and steamed pork buns. We also tried some new items like the fried pork ball and the baked lava custard bun.  The manager recognized us from a few days ago and is extremely friendly. He thanked us for coming again and remembered we were from New York and wished us a safe trip home. You must get off the strip and try this delicious dim sum!
This place is on the pricey side, and many of the dishes are obviously the microwavable version you can buy as the Asian super markets.

We are on vacation and drove past Yum Cha this morning.   We thought it looked new and and we Yelp'd it.  Great reviews and they have Dim Sum! So after a day in Red Rock Canyon we came in for dinner.   Holy smokes this place is remarkable. The Dim Sum was fantastic.  We enjoyed the Tarro Root which looks like a birds nest. It was yummy.  We had shrimp and spinach dumpling, chive dumpling and some tofu dumpling.  The dessert Dim Sum was amazing. One had a coconut filling and the other was a sesame seed red bean ball.   Well we live in So Cal and are here on vacation.  This will be our first of many Dim Sum dinners at Yum Cha.  

The staff was great! We were promptly greeted and though we love Dim Sum they explained everything and recommend some things too! Great service !

Ps looks like it's large enough for large party's and receptions.

Lastly this is the cleanest place I've ever seen. They have a lot of pride in their family run restaurant!
Had my dim sum cravings satisfied coming here!  Probably the best choi-sum I ever had!  Very fresh and well steamed!  The sticky rice and beef tendon was really good also!  I'd be back.  :)

I wanted to try a new dim sum place. Yum cha just was not very good. I had 8 dishes all were a little off with the taste factor. Also it does not taste very fresh and the food came out cold. Service was nice and friendly but still slow for how empty it was. I wouldn't come back. Safe to say ping pang pong is way better.
It was ok, we got there a bit late, so the food was just ok. The serve was good and couldn't have been nicer. I gave them a 4, just because

WOW! Their dumplings are on point! I was here last week with a few of my friends and we stuffed our faces with every dumpling dish they had to offer. All dishes are made fresh and they do not use frozen items. Also, their hospitality and customer service was fantastic. We felt like they were welcoming us into their home.

I will be going back here often because the food is delicious and my money is well-spent!
Don't waste your money!  A couple of chicken claws and some other nasty shit for $20 - disgusting and a rip-off!

I hadn't had Dim Sum in quite some time and came here to feed my hunger for some shumai and congee. No fear if you're confused as to how dim sum works, for if you can't find what you're looking for in the carts, their are menus with special items you can order. 

Ladies made their way around the restaurant with their carts. Breaded and dry dishes are usually kept on a separate cart vs the hot and steamed dishes. I wouldn't call myself a veteran, but I've been around some DS places, so I knew what to zero in on. 

Though the food satisfied a part of me, the other wanted a more flavorful variety. The noodle dishes were dry and lacked spice. The only thing that helped me like it was the chili sauce. For almost all the dishes, I used one specific combo of sauces. I add soy sauce with some chili  and swirl around until a good consistency. Absolute fave and the one thing that masked the blandness. Congee, usually is a bit more bland as you add some sauce, but when tasting it, it wasn't hot and lacked any flavor whatsoever. Disappointing. 

Not sure If I would give a second chance, but for now, I'll pass.

What a find! The best dim sum place in Vegas - hands down! We found this place in our search for finding Hong Kong style dim sums on our recent trip to Vegas. This place is just outside the strip but not in Chinatown but I would recommend this over all the restaurants in Chinatown. Also it opens very early while Chinatown is still sleeping - so if you are looking to get some comfort food early in the morning to get rid of that hangover, this is THE place you need to head to. Immediately after you enter, you are served nice hot jasmine tea, free of charge and you continue to get refills as much as you need. Promptly the dim sum cart comes along with their yummy collection of dim sums and they are all sooo cheap!!! My absolute favorites were - The Spare Ribs with the Black Bean sauce, Sticky Rice in Lotus Leaf, BBQ Pork Buns and the Pork Dumplings. We straightaway did 2 rounds of each of these. We all had the Shrimp Dumplings, Chicken Feet, Chive dumplings as well, all were top class! We left the restaurant overfed and greatly satisfied only to return in the evening to get some more. The food was so good that we came for a late night dumpling fest. The staff was very kind. They recognized us from the morning and even though they were almost about to close, they welcomed us in and fed us until we we were ready to burst again. 
I recommend it very highly - I will surely visit them every time I am in Vegas for all my breakfasts. Also, the staff was so friendly, I could just go back to give them a visit.

Was looking for a great dim sum place and this place hit the spot. Really great dim sum and menu food. Some things need a little additional seasoning but just use the chili paste provided. Restaurant is clean and service is fast. Could be a little more friendly but it's good enough

Yum Cha...is not so yummy. We took a Lyft from the Strip craving good dim sum thinking we would find it here given the other reviews...but nope. The only good thing about this place is that it's the cheapest dim sum I've had. We also appreciate that they don't charge extra for hot tea.

I'll say that the shrimp dumplings, rice wrapped in banana leaf, and baked BBQ pork buns were acceptable, but the calamari was plain and soggy. The other dishes we ordered (chicken feet, fried tofu skin, fried shrimp balls, pork ribs) weren't memorable.

I can see why families would come here for weekend brunch, or why people who work or live in the area come for weekday lunch. It's a large restaurant with lots of seating. I don't think I'll be back though.

Came in at 8:30 with a party of 5. The place was fairly empty with only one other party in the restaurant. The wait staff was a little too attentative with the lady pushing menu items on us a bit too aggressively and constantly rearranging things on our table. 

The food was only a little decent as well. Many of the things we ordered ended up not being available which was surprising that they were out of items already. Overall, decent experience. You get what you pay for but I most likely will not be returning.

My dim sum expectations might be a little high. But this place was seriously a disappointment considering it received the highest yelp ratings. 

1. Location - it is in a strip mall as everything is in Vegas. :(
However, when in Rome, it is pretty much comparable to other locations 
2. THe space is large and as previous reviews it does feel like a cafeteria. There are a bunch of flat screens surrounding the entire venue and there are fake birds in wooden bird cages. Kinda cool. 
3. Food and the main reason I gave a 3 stars review. 
I had the chicken shui mai, shrimp and beef chang feng, century egg congee, and lau mai gai (chicken wrapped in bamboo leaves). 
First it was expensive and I really don't mind paying for more, but that is not what we got. Everything was ok. HOwever, it did not justify the cost. Chang feng fell apart and shrimp was not really fresh. Lau mai gai fell apart as soon as I unwrapped it. 

Of course, this was when I took my Chinese mother who liked another place and I wanted to give this a try so she of course has revoked my ability to pick a restaurant forever.

TL,DR - food not worth the cost. Lost relationship with mother.

Less than 10 minutes from the strip, definitely worth the drive. Clean. 
Fresh food!
We had dim sum and it was good and authentic. Reviews on Yelp led me here, what a great find!

Sweet sticky rice triangles, yum!
Ha gow, sui mai, black bean spare ribs, rice/meat wrapped in leaf, and red bean sesame balls were all delicious. 

Nice big space, they have their own building off the corner of strip mall. Located by Walgreens, lots of parking.

This Yum Cha was the best thing on a cold and rainy Las Vegas day.  I decided to take my mother and grandma here after reading the reviews & seeing it on someone's YouTube vlog. It was definitely the best decision I've made all day. The wonton soup & xiaolongbao were heavenly. Also, the shrimp shumai and dumplings were super tasty. I will definitely come back again whenever I come to Vegas next.

Steamed Vegetables, traditional Chinese tea (No Bag, just rich tea leaves) and Dim Sum from 10:30am until closing at very reasonable prices!  E and all the rest of the staff get A+ for smiles and hospitality.just google Yum Cha, the building looks new and smells delicious and clean!
Really good Malaysian food... I enjoyed so much!!!! Highly recommended... When  in Las Vegas we always stop here to eat there... Roti canai just unbelievable.... Ohhhhh....
Food was delicious and came out super piping hot! Super friendly service, waitress and owners came by several times to check on us. Their food is unique, Malaysian and Chinese influences.

This is an update on my review from December. We went back to Las Vegas in May and visited Yum Cha again as promised in my last review. Again, we were not disappointed! We were able to try things we didn't get to try last time. It's absolutely the best restaurant and friendly staff I have been to in a very long time. And I go to many restaurants. If you want great authentic dim sum then you are in for a real treat. The prices are great, food is absolutely wonderful and staff is very friendly. I recommend this place to everyone. Thanks again. We will definitely be back on our next trip.

We love Dim Sum but have been spoiled by great restaurants in LA and San Francisco. We were visiting in Las Vegas and shopping at International Marketplace and got hungry from looking at all the foods! We saw the Yum Cha Dim Sum nearby and thought we would take a chance. It is a large room with lots of tables and the food carts on one side. The carts started coming by and we saw some of our favorites as well as new items which was fun. 

We ordered off carts but the menu has tons of choices too. Their chow neon noodles were good but not a ton of flavor. Favorites were Seafood Rolls, Shrimp Balls, Shrimp & Pork ShuMai, and Won Tons. My husband picked something he thought was BBQ pork but ended to be Beef Tendons! They were surprisingly soft and tasty. The tea is such an important part of the meal and was very good too.

Dim Sum is a favorite of mine because you get to have small tastes of so many items. Going to look at the food carts was interesting and gave ideas of different foods. We had tons of good Dim Sum selections for so little money. We will definitely return!

OMG, this place is super delicious. I was in Vegas for a friend's birthday party but I also met with some family off the strip and they recommended this restaurant to us for some great dim sum.

My family is Chinese but I'm very much Americanized but still have nostalgia about eating dim sum. I got there and the staff was super nice. The food looked and tasted amazing. 

You have to check it out for yourself but I enjoy all the favorites like hai gow, shu mai, turnip cakes, and roast pork buns. I can't wait to visit again when I head back to Vegas.

It's not my fave dim sum place in Las Vegas but I do like how it's served all day compared to the usual 2pm. They don't have as much variety and if you go later in the day the food isn't as fresh or hot . Overall, it's just ok but not bad .
Good food and selection.  I like that dim sum is served all day.  Service could be better.
The staff here are attentive and not pushy. Good communication. Lots of choices. Steamed dim sum on carts and hot dim sum from the stalls. Looks newly opened, super clean. Yummy.

WOW!! This is a true treasure. We are visiting from Reno for a school related event for my daughter. We were hoping to find a good dim sum place. We hit the jackpot!! With her rehearsal schedule we couldn't make it to any dim sum places during the normal service hours....and Yim Cha serves dim sum ALL DAY. Order from a menu and it's made right then and there. It's close enough to LV Blvd to be an easy choice for anyone staying to play. It's far enough away to make it ideal for those wanting to avoid the crowds. 

Onto the dim sum. We are only two, so our ordering was limited. The baked baos are HUGE, as in one could almost be a meal huge. And they were fresh and hot as was everything. Siu mai are so packed with flavor we took two orders to go for breakfast! Har gao was perfectly steamed and full of shrimp. The wrapper was properly chewy and tender. Chive dumplings are huge and so tasty and came out piping hot and crispy on the sides from the pan fry. Our craving has been sated until we return. 

The menu has me wanting to try so many more things. This is perfect for bigger groups as you can order a wide variety and try it all. Service is attentive and very friendly. You'll leave with a smile, a happy tummy, and wanting to return.

Editing to add he prices are very good here! A lot of good food for little cash!

Since last week, they've added the gooey egg custard bun! I asked about it last week but they didn't have it. Well they have it now! And its delicious!! I'm used to it being in a golden and crispy bun. Theirs is in a plain white bun. But still good. Its a must try! Not sure what its called in English but in Cantonese its pronounced "lau-sa-bao". Get it!

Great service and good dim sum! A lot of the waiters don't speak English very well, but they're very nice and try to get you what you need. It helps if you find a picture of what you want on yelp and show it to them. Will come back. Boss man pretty cool too!
my go to spot for hangover lunch as i leave las vegas. friendly staff, clean restaurant, and good food.

I feel really horrible to write such a bad review but I rely on yelp for honest reviews so here goes...

I don't think I will ever come back to this place. I came at 5pm on a weekday, so maybe this is why? I felt that everything I ordered was not fresh. The dimsum was regular tasting (I ordered shrimp dumplings, pork and shrimp siomai, mushroom Mai). I also ordered the beef and tendon brisket which was very very bland. I was already feeling kind of grossed out but when my steamed pork buns came, that's when I decided I was officially disgusted. The pork buns looked like it was very very old and steamed to death. It was so soggy and mushy that I could not even take it out of the basket. The pork inside looked like baby food. It reminded me of bread dipped in hot water. 

Sorry, I'm going back to Orchids. Yum cha did not hv sticky tables like Orchids but at least I won't feel that I ate old food.

So. Good.  


Honestly one of the best dim sum places here in Las Vegas. Yum Cha has the freshest dim sum in my opinion and the restaurant itself is very clean. Service is great with all servers and the owner himself being really attentive to all customers. The food is AMAZING and very flavorful. If the item you're looking for isn't in any of the carts, they order it readily for you with no ifs, ands, or buts. 

Best of all...THEY SERVE DIM SUM ALL DAY. They stop bringing carts around at a certain time, but you can order all dim sum items straight from the kitchen which ensures the freshness.

10/10 would recommend this place! Go check it out :)

Food is amazing, definitely the best. This will be my new dim sum spot for now on. This restuarant is across the street from international world market. This used to be a Chinese buffet but apparently they closed down and now it's this awesome gem of a restuarant. The food are always served straight from the steam cart or you can go up to their display that you can order from them. All the items we ordered was very authentic, doesn't taste like those cheap knock offs from Chinese buffets. 

Walked in on a Thursday dinner around 3pm was a very slow time for them. Was seated real quick by the servers. The staff is very friendly, especially the lady that took our order was very helpful in explaining everything to us as beginners. In my option look no further for other dim sum restaurants besides here they are very cheap prices too. Will come back I definetly love this place.

Excellent Love it good price good service nice and clean. if who love tofu must try sweet tofu it my favorite it come with ginger water but just tell server that sweet on the side if you don't like too much sweet.

No thank you.  The customer service was great. The food was obviously poor quality, water logged, too dry or too hard in some dishes which were not supposed to be. Everything had a strange aftertaste .  Only 2 or 3 pieces in each dish you order. Not worth it.
Fresh food, good quality and seasoned well. Their food are not too salty at all like other Chinese restaurant. They are friendly as well. Will come back here.

even though there are dim sum restaurants back in LA, I make the time to eat here every time I'm in Vegas. The service is swift and they're ready to place those shumai, pork ribs, etc. The XLB are freshly made cause you have to orders. It took 10 minutes for 6 pieces of XLB
This place is so nice and really good!! Food always fresh and hot! I love how the inside of the place and the stuff is so friendly and nice! My new favorite Dim Sum place.
Rude wait staff. Was going to Underdtand its busy long weekend. But first bite of hagaw.. was fronzen pieces of shrimp. Raw shrimp. Picture to follow
Great Dim Sum but unfortunately they've lost their liquor license... no beer for you!

Food: horrible Yelp fail. People that are giving high Yelp ratings have obviously never eaten proper dim sum in S. Cal or even Cupertino, CA! Dumplings (Hai gow and spinach and shrimp) tasted mushy (frozen), oil on lobo gao tasted old. So gross. We cannot find decent dim sum here! Of the 4 places we have tried so far, this one was the worst. Tea was decent. 

Service: surprisingly friendly and helpful which is unexpected (ha ha), but they are low on help which is also clear from the help wanted sign on the door. 

Ambiance: clean, but looks like a fast food place. 

Location: across from International Market. 

Won't be back!!

I went with a friend after 3pm and just missed the dim sum cart, but we were still able to order dim sum via menu and it was made to order. 

The dim sum was good, I've had dim sum other places before and can't say that it was extraordinary but tasted like dim sum anywhere else you go. 

Deducted one star because it took a little while for us to get our bill to pay that we had to walk up to the cash register for someone to notice us. It was slow so they weren't busy with customers or anything. Guess they forgot about us!

First time here i was told the food is good.  I ordered food to go it's taken 45 min to get it if you don't have time to wait I don't recommend this place.  It seems busy which is a good sign but when ordering dim sum to go and it takes that long I have to give it a low rating.

Dim Sum and then some!  This is a find if you like dim sum. The Proprietors are from Malaysia and they know their dim sum. Carts came fast and were laden with many selections. We ordered additional items that we did not see on the cart and they were equally delicious. Xialongbao, crispy eggplant, steamed pork buns all were delicious. Shu mai and shrimp dumplings were re-ordered multiple times. Next time I need to save room for dessert. Custard buns looked delicious. Only thing I would not reorder were the beef balls. They were not bad just not as tasty as other offerings in our opinion. The rest was YUM!
The prices are super reasonable. The food is cooked to order and the Dim Sum is delicious.  The folks are friendly. It is definitely worth the trip via Uber for this meal.
Not a fancy place , but the food and service was good . We came right when they opened so the food was fresh . 30 min later the place was packed . Full of Asians so you know it's good .

Had a dim sum breakfast here on a Saturday morning. The host greeted us. Was very friendly. The food is great! Fresh and very authentic Cantonese dim sum. Will definitely come back to try the rest of their menu.

I write this because I cannot stand the unethical ways this place conducts its business.  They "force" you to write a favorable review on Yelp before they will give you a good discount for the meal.  So I KNOW I cannot rely on the reviews I see on Yelp for this establishment.  My own experience here has been extremely mediocre quality of dim sum, bordering on really questioning how people can give such high praises for their food! However, we do experience a slightly better quality more recently, but I still believe in second, third and fourth chances, unfortunately, and I still have to avoid going there as much as possible.  

The positive things I can say about this place are:
1.  Nice setting, relatively empty, probably for the same reasons I gave above for my own experience.
2.  Nice enough service, for a dim sum joint anyway.
3,  Easy parking and access.

Negatives(which for me are the most important factors:
1,  Quality of food is at most 2 stars, on a very generous day for me.
2.  Prices do not in any way reflect the food provided.  I would much prefer Ping Pang Pong over here even in pricing!
3.  I just can't handle the unethical business practice this place exercises.

I would like to propose that Yelp makes all reviewers an optional check box in their reviews denoting that they may be receiving any financial gains for posting their reviews.  Since the owner/manager sits/stands there while he awaits your posting, you know he will see if you are posting a negative review, and by simply posting most of the review that he's looking at, and then at the end be able to check off that box can give the reviewer the comfort of some redemption of his/her soul while posting his/her "positive" review.

Meanwhile, let buyers beware.
Good selection of dim sum. Flavors did not "pop" though. I was a bit disappointed with the lack of seasoning. Food arrived hot. Service was great.

Found this place through Yelp and although this restaurant only opened less than 3 weeks ago, the owner was very friendly and the food was well displayed.  Coming from New York, the set up for dim sum was unorthodox because the waiters don't serve you the food from little carts; instead, they display the food behind the glass so that the customer can see all the possible options. Which is better in my opinion. There are no labels above the dim sum dishes so if one is unfamiliar with the Chinese dishes displayed, the owner takes time to explain which is the most delicious or popular depending on your preference- or all the dishes if you're curious. For the adventurous diners, she will push you to try something new! The prices for each dish are inexpensive. There are many wonderful entrées as well if you are not feeling in a Dim Sum mood. I would recommend the meat wrapped in bean curd skin, pork and shrimp Shumai, steamed sweet pork bun, fried sweet pork bun, and sesame red bean balls. Everything was full of flavor. Please try it! My friend and I will definitely dine here again in the near future.

Las Vegas has some of my favorite eats in the world but I stand by what I've said: They just can't do dim sum right!

But when comparing it to other dim sum places in Las Vegas, Yum Cha is okay. We ordered a variety of the typical standard fare. Most dishes are bland but still palatable. I like the squash/pumpkin found in the black bean spare ribs but I think they were using it as fillers to give less meat. Food was served hot from the steamers and didn't appear to be reheated leftovers from the day before so that's a big plus. Don't forget to look at the heated bar holding some more food like congee with Chinese doughnuts and liver and tripe with daikon.

The staff was very attentive and the place was clean. Yum Cha, cute name and all, is a decent place to get your dim sum eats if you're in town but don't go in with high expectations.

When going to the office I stop here for a quick bite. Service is quick and the staff is friendly. Usually only one cart rolling around but you can order any type of dim sum and it comes out fast and hot. It's not the best but it's better than the most.

Interesting place. The food is average, IMHO. 
The great part is the food is served hot.

Though I've had better versions of almost everything we ordered elsewhere, I wanna say I enjoyed the tripe and shrimp hargow here. 

Service was friendly, quick, but there might be a struggle with communication at times. 

The prices are at $3.49, $3.99 etc. everything we ordered fell into either of those two categories.
I went there on Saturday night based on yelp review. Place is awesome. Great customer service. Great dim sum especially the fried eggplant. Will definitely return.

This is absolutely one of the worst restaurants my family and I have been to for dim sum!
They don't even deserve my one star.
I don't understand how this place has 4 1/2 stars with close to 700 reviews!
My family waited at the table for 20 min before any server took their food and drink orders.
Everything arrived slow.  The plates were hot but the food was terribly cold. We sent plates back and they never came back. The carts never came around our table, we had to get up and ask for it.
We continuously waited for entrees for long periods of time.  None of the dishes came with the right serving utensils, like soup bowls or soup spoons. The complimented sauces never came with any of the dishes like traditional dim sum.
When the bill arrived, my father put his credit card in the check presenter. When the server came back with the bill, it had no cc and the bill was never charged. I walked up to the front and someone from another table said this wasn't his credit card. And I said thats my father. So they charged the wrong table.
I explained how bad the service was the entire time we were there and he said was "sorry holiday weekend" I also said I work in the service industry whether holiday or not service should not be this terrible, the cashier asked if I worked on the strip and I said yes and he said ... "they can afford to make mistakes!" What kind of restaurant gives you that answer! If you're off the strip you should show more excellence in customer service to avoid these comments and mistakes.
I've never in my entire like experience such terrible restaurant with customer service and food!

This almost seems a bit ridiculous, but I always get nervous about highly-rated Yelp dim sum places because I find that those rated lower tend to be more authentic. Despite my previous experiences, I decided to give this place a try. I honestly wasn't impressed.

I'm Cantonese and have tried dim sum from all different sorts of places. Personally, I find that I can really speak to the culture, authenticity, and taste of what dim sum should be. This place was not it. Yes, the restaurant is clean and the service is good, but it was so Americanized. 

The dim sum was expensive. The taste of the dim sum itself was subpar. Some of the foods were old and dry and the flavor itself was lacking compared to other places I've tried. They only had 1 cart being pushed around. The remainder of the foods were by order, but came out cold and unimpressive. Nice people overall, but if you're truly looking for authentic tasting dim sum, I would not opt for this place.

This dim sum place is pretty substandard. Came on a Saturday and all three carts had the same 5-6 items. There's an odd menu system where if you don't see it on the cart you can order it, but what's the point of that with dim sum?!? Shu mai was pretty good, everything else was fair to poor. Greasy dumplings, heavy pork buns, just not a fan. If people truly think this is the best dim sum in Vegas they need to get to LA, SF, or Portland to try really good dim sum.

Came here on a Saturday at noon. Food wasn't very good. The food didnt seem so fresh. The worst part was they had already ran out of the Tofu with ginger! Why oh why?! I may give it another go though. Hopefully it will be better the second time around.

Damn, I had some high expectations based upon 534 reviews. I was sadly disappointed, came here on a Saturday night around 8:15 pm, and they were out of shrimp dim sum. What the heck kind of dim sum doesn't have shrimp?! Ordered pork Belly, it was pork katsu that came out. Tripe was ok, tasted like MSG. Beef noodle, did not have flavor. Calamari was salty, veggie noodles, bland. Save your money and go to Orchids Garden.

This place never fails to impress me. Great customer service and great authentic dim sum.
I had my usual with tea. This time we ordered won ton soup. It was so delicious. I love that the dim sum is always freshly cooked.
Ok dim sum. I would not go out of my way to come back for the food. But the service was really good.

Chinese Dim Sum can seem like a basic concept and that they should all be similar. Yum Cha had quite a few entrees that most Dim Sum restaurants don't usually offer. 

The items that we ordered were all really good and tasty. The quantity per order is a bit smaller compared to the others I have been to. The service needs some improvement as well. I have been to Dim Sum restaurants where you have to shoo them away because they don't stop offering items.  Can also be annoying, but when I want more and they're not coming around is worse. 

I would go back next time I'm in Vegas and looking for Dim Sum.

Have been there 2 weeks ago and dim sum was great with quality service.  The price is reasonable.  The environment isn't the transitional one but we all enjoyed the dinner.  Definitely will come back soon.

I think this is my new to go place for dim sum... Everything inside is updated. Modern decor, great service, good food.. I like the idea of them coming to your table and you just pin point what you want. Hahaha if there's a dish I wasn't familiar with; they fully inform me and best described the dish. The only thing I wasn't fan of was there's other dishes at the counter but you have to get up let them know and they bring it to your table. It would of been better if they had a small menu for that at the table for convenience... Otherwise, I will definitely come again.

This place is super clean and the food is really goos. I highly recommend this to everyone that wants to try Chinese style dim sum. There is always service with a smile and the atmosphere is super friendly. I would definitely come back for some more food!

Delicious food and great service at 10pm. Beats any fast food option by a long shot! Everything we ordered tasted homemade with fresh and flavorful ingredients. We loved the hot and sour soup! They even made us fresh baby bok choy (not on the menu). We will be back!
I was here one time after going to the gym... they have good food. It took a little while to get some of the fried dumpling tho so that sucked but for the most part it was a good experience.
